description:
This place is a gem. I'm not going to say much else because I'd prefer not to have people infringing on the last few open seats during Happy Hour. 

We came here because everything in FiDi (Novela, Local Edition, Dirty Habit) was crowded and I had no desire to elbow around the suits. Really good prices and the drinks are strong but still taste good. You can also get "window" seating (aka the jank stools next to the windows).
author: Sophie W.

description:
love this place! but if you're walking from FiDi, you better be in good shape to get up the hill on Bush haha 

but it's totally worth it!

TT used to be a lot more dive-y, but I like it better now. the inside is still old-school saloon style, but with a greatly updated drinks menu and liquor choices. 

extended happy hour has $8 old fashioneds made with top shelf bourbon. that alone is enough to make me a regular

there's a mezzanine level which is good for groups with a couple of large seating areas, but you'll have to carry your own drinks up from the bar

bartenders are is on point, quick service and knowledgeable

this is now one of my top 3 places for after work drinks!
author: Bob U.

description:
Looking for a great bar with great drinks, great service, and great vibes? LOOK NO FURTHER! This bar is absolutely fantastic! Amazing dive bar to meet new people and listen to great music of all kinds! 

My friend and I came from L.A and the first night we stepped foot in this bar (which was right near our hotel) the bartenders were so helpful  and kind and everyone there was so welcoming. We came back every night!

Definitely coming back next time we're in town!

Thanks so much Ali, Jerome, and all the bartenders for a great experience! 

Cheers!
author: Danielle M.

description: It's hard not to like everything here. The location is great and easy to find. The ambience is cool and comfortable. The drinks are inexpensive and delicious (and they have happy hour every day). This is the perfect dive bar.
author: Rhianna M.

description:
Their HH ends at 7:30 which is great compared to many nearby venues. The other selling point is the inexpensive (for SF) drinks. For one reason or another we always consider stopping by whenever in the area.

This is not a destination dive bar but it will pull you in due to its central location, near Union Square, the Chinatown gate, Nob Hill, right above the Stockton Tunnel. It is near bars and restaurants so it's very good as a pregame or after dinner spot.

Go early evening to avoid the crowds, and well, for HH pricing specials. The later the night goes the more crowded it gets and doesn't ever let up.
author: Peter L.

description:
3.5 Stars

Happy Hour until 8pm. Hell yeah!

Great service. 

Great view.

Not so great drinks...particularly the margarita. Gimlet was okay.


I'll come back and give this place another try. See what other drinks they can make...
author: Owie N.

description: The perfect dive bar! Well it's not really a dive... it's actually a nice little 2 story neighborhood bar/lounge that's walking distance from several major hotels in downtown San Francisco. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Robert S.

description:
I came here in a bad mood.  I dinged my car door.  It wouldn't have been so bad, but it was ME who dinged it, so I only have myself to blame.

Oh well...after a few Happy Hour drinks, I didn't even care that I was running late to see my friends for dinner.  I was so engrossed in my drinks, but after the buzz wore off, I beat myself up for that self inflicted ding.
author: Ron L.

description:
I have been to Tunnel Top a few times now and it never disappoints. There is always a good flow of people and always a spot to sit at the bar or in the upstairs lounge areas. The last visit was during St. Patty's day this year. Even though all the other bars in the SF area were hosting crazy paid events, with live music and green beer. We decided to keep it low key and hit up Tunnel Top and good thing we did, it was busy but still had a good vibe and we got to enjoy the folks that real part took in the event.

Overall, I like this spot and it is definitely a good spot to go to for a drink!
author: Nicole A.

description:
We were running early for dinner at a friend's house. Since Tunnel Top was on the way, we decided to stop by for one drink. My friend and I walked in on Friday, July 14th around 6:30pm. It wasn't super busy, so we were able to find two seats on the left side of the bar.

Happy Hour: until 7:30pm
*Barrel Aged Manhattan: woodford reserve, carpano antica, angostura bitters ($8)
*Tunnel Top Old Fashioned: bulleit bourbon, bitters, cherries ($8)

Drinks are originally $10, but lucky for us, we went during HH, so we got $2 off each cocktail. I enjoyed the manhattan. It was made well and I like woodford reserve. My friend seemed to enjoy his old fashioned as well. I like bulleit, so I'm sure I would have enjoyed it too if I tried some. Our bartender was great. Very friendly. We never had to flag him down to get his attention. One thing that did bother me while here was the cleanliness of their glasses. I ordered a glass of water and the glass was dirty. Unfortunately, I didn't notice it until after I started drinking the water, so that kind of grossed me out a bit.

Divey bar with a great happy hour. $8 for a cocktail can't be beat!
author: Elena N.

description: We stumbled across this bar while looking for a place to catch a drink. We had a couple of their mules which were at a pretty good alcohol to mixer ratio. Very refreshing. The pricing is OK, nothing to leave you broke in one night, which is always a plus. Atmosphere is pretty good, there was a mishap with an older man and a younger girl over a seat but the doorman handled it pretty quickly. Would check our again next time if in town.
author: Azucena G.

description: It sits right on top of the tunnel. Walked in,  the music was good.  Dj was playing alot of local rappers, Mac Dre, e40 along with everything that's being played in the radio at the moment.  I immediately liked the vibe. Went to the bar to order 2 old fashions.  The bartender was very attentive.  We waited at the bar area that's near the bathroom.  I dont recommend sitting down there. It smells like you're in the bathroom.  My cocktail had a lil too much of something but it was drinkable without complaining. When your downstairs,  you can look upstairs and see the Dj , people and if a small table becomes availavle.  After a few mins,  a table was available for us; we darted up there.  People were dancing and kicking it upstairs.  Ok . Glad we came up there.  Our table was next to the window which allowed us to look down at the street and get a glimpse of a city night.  It was quite romantic actually.  Listened to some songs,  danced and sang in our seats, then we bounced.  Definitely a place to go to . Will return
author: Elease T.

description: Cool vibes, great atmosphere. Bartenders were so attentive even though it was busy and the music was popping. Will visit again
author: Natalie G.

description: I didn't like it, I ordered a mojito and it wasn't very good. Plus everything is sticky, from the bar to the chairs, and there was a smell, it seemed to me like, old and humid kind of smell. People were nice tho, but won't go back.
author: Daniel N.

description:
My friends and I first came in August for my birthday, and it was kind of by accident, but boy am I glad we discovered this place! (I came back a few weeks ago, and once again I was not disappointed!) It's a cool little bar that you might miss, if you weren't really looking for it. If you're into little dive bars, you will definitely like this place! The drinks are reasonably priced, I think $10 a drink, and they are super yummy! I recommend the watermelon gimlet and the spicy mango margarita! They have an upstairs area, where you can enjoy your drink and dance to cool music from the DJ. He will take requests, and play anything from new school, old school hip hop, and even Latin! The bar tenders are friendly and the security will always make you feel welcome and safe.
I am actually planning to head back in about a month and this will be the spot to go to!
author: Cece S.

description:
My colleague who used to live in SF recommended Tunnel Top while I was in town a few months ago. So a few of my other colleagues and I walked over here after dinner on a Tuesday night. I didn't expect it to be busy, but there were a good amount of people hanging around the bar. 

After ordering drinks (vodka cran for myself), we made our way upstairs and found a lounge-like seating area - open area, comfy chairs, and tables in between. We sat in the corner and didn't really move from that spot for the next hour or so. The loft area seemed like the smart place to go because you get a good view of the outside world and the inside world. Makes for a great people-watching spot. 

The bar itself is laid-back and casual, perfect if you just want to casually hang and have a few drinks with some friends. Right when we were about to leave a DJ started setting up shop. For the few songs we stayed for, it seemed like he was going for a more upbeat dancing vibe, which I could see happening here on the weekends. 

I'll definitely try to come back when I'm in SF next. Cool bar and cool vibes all around.
author: Issabelle F.

description: Solid dive bar conveniently close to Union Square.  Walking up the sketchy stairs in front of the tunnel get you "on edge" to have fun and hit a dark bar with regular people - not Union Square shoppers.  Friendly place - and divey.
author: James N.

description: Love the atmosphere! Includes little window seats that show view of the street. Bartender is amazing, helpful. Keeps up with a very calm and relaxing bar seen. Everyone has to try the spicy mango!!
author: Joanna R.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night for happy hour with friends and while it is a nice bar its probably not the best for a big group trying to catch up because the seating is a little awkward. The drinks were just ok, I got the peach mango chile margarita which was more on the tart side but they do have a good happy hour!
author: Rachel N.

description: We really enjoyed having drinks here. It was full downstairs when we got there, so we grabbed our drinks and headed upstairs and had the floor to ourselves. We sat at this little cute table with old school metal chairs that looked right over Bush St. I thought their spicy mango margarita was amazing, so start with that! Prices weren't bad- we paid $16 for the margarita and a vodka tonic.  It wasn't too loud so we were able to sip and chat while looking out at the streets and people watch. We'll definitely be back when we're in the area again!
author: Chrissy R.

description:
DJ Hector in the house!! He was originally playing at a different venue, and I had coordinated 10-15 people to watch him in action, but he got a last minute gig here... So we migrated the group there accordingly. The bar itself is alright. Just your standard divey, somewhat trendy bar. Bringing in deejays like Hector is just what they need to liven up the atmosphere.

Hector was perched upstairs in a small corner overlooking the bar, with a narrow catwalk and many two-seating tables along the way. It was a little awkward constantly trying to squeeze by when four or five people were crammed around a tiny table, but after a few drinks, this errs on the side of cozy. There are larger lounge spots to hang out upstairs, but these tend to be claimed first.

I wouldn't come here until a deejay like Hector was playing again. He mixes some awesome hip hop and throwback beats, and you can tell that the bar patrons enjoy the vibe he creates. I'm going to assume he'll be there again, so for that, I'm looking forward to my next trip to Tunnel Top!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I agree with another reviewer, this place more hipster than divey. I came here with my spouse, waiting for my reservation next door at Bouche. 

This is a dark bar with a nice vibe. I had a handsome bartender serve our drinks. I was here pretty early in the evening, so I cannot comment on this place when it gets crowded. 

I wouldn't make a special trip to visit this place, but if I were in the area, I would definitely stop in again.
author: Martin S.

description: We were heading to the Masonic for a concert and found Tunnel Top to be a nice stop on the hike up Sacramento St. hill. I had a Gin Gimlet and it hit the spot. This place has a neighborhood, laid back vibe.
author: David F.

description:
This bar was recommended to me by a coworker. I don't go to Union Square often and I requested a spot that was low key, but still nice. This didn't disappoint! I loved the ambience and unique details - the mirror in the bathroom was refurbished from a vintage TV. Like other Yelpers I really dug the music that was playing. It wasn't too loud which I really appreciated. 
The cocktails were stronger than anticipated but no complaints about that here. The bartenders were nice and attentive. Would recommend and I plan to return!
author: Emma B.

description: This was a great laid back spot with affordable drinks for an out of towner. We were able to try the drink specials and the berry mojito and the IPAs were great and would recommend you trust your bartender he gave great suggestions.
author: Efi E.

description: Classically San Francisco, modern-ish speakeasy with interesting decor and fixtures, deceptively strong artisan cocktails with a dive-bar feel. This has been a go-to bar for me since I moved to SF. I love that they have a DJ who spins upstairs on the weekends, and that they have an upstairs. The mezzanine is cute and intimate, decorated with odd paintings, with a view of the downstairs bar and a few little tables by the original single paned windows that overlook Bush St.,... order the Cucumber Gimlet, just do it. You're welcome.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Tunnel Top is a great little bar with a dark mellow ambiance, cool fixtures and decor, and good strong drinks, with a focus on classic cocktails and modern variations thereof. B ordered a Moscow Mule and I had a "mexican" Mule with a tequila base; I didn't know how well that concept would work but the drink was delicious!

The atmosphere feels kind of like a modern speakeasy or an artisan dive bar (and the pricing reflects that- not insane upscale club prices, but you'll pay more for a drink here than at a normal dive). I really loved their mezzanine lounge area; there's great seating for people/bar watching and dark corners for getting comfy in.
author: Summer M.

description:
Trumer Pils on draft, super-friendly barman, great view.  

Tunnel Top is my new favorite dive in SFO.
author: Thomas R.

description: Great cocktail, accurate name. Good DJ. Divey but still nice. A bit too dark for my tastes, but other than that it's wonderful.
author: Leslie S.

description: I come here periodically for a drink or ten. I usually get the beer since I'm a beer drinker. I was shocked when I was charged $6 for a Stella in a LOCAL bar!  Yes, know it's $6-8 in a brewery or a touristy bar but I thought it was a bit steep for Tunnel Top. Great atmosphere and music though.
author: Paul S.

description:
My friend realized she forgot her ID while trying to get in and the bouncer pushed her out the door. Literally pushed her and us outside. This was completely unnecessary as she is a tiny girl that weighs like,100 pounds.  We were too shocked to protest at the time.

Yes the drinks are solid and the music is fun, but this just left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Stephanie K.

description: No food. Great ambiance. Good drinks.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Small and cozy place. Easy parking at night time. Lively and friendly staff. Found a seat ast the bar and had a few yamazaki 18 year... everything there was priced reasonably. Such a great little bar, clean,  and fun. Also their selection for spirits were supple. 2 thumbs up!
author: Miss J.

description: I was in San Fran for the 3 day weekend and a friend suggested this place for a late night drink. Loved the playlist, 90s hip hop, and the dive bar atmosphere was a cool vibe. The drinks were good, the prices are reasonable.
author: Sarah T.

description: Someone I just met recently invited me to have a drink here. I had the berry mojito. It was okay. I don't really like alcoholic drinks, but I DID get drunk after drinking one. Cramped atmosphere. There's a DJ. Dark inside for a dive bar feel. Pretty fun place. No food.
author: Denise C.

description: Great hangout spot ! Ate here last night and loved it ... the drinks were pretty awesome too ! Luv the dragon lighting and the ambiance . Plan on returning very soon .
author: Odie G.

description: Came to SF a few weeks ago for a Raiders Game. I can't say enough about this bar. All time favorite. The music was fabulous. The crowd was good. The drinks were yummy. Yes I'll be coming back. Yes I'd recommend this place to friends and family.
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
Dive bar with fun ambience.  Cocktails are typical prices -- $2 off before 7:30pm.

Great intimate area upstairs; has a NYC feel and so of course I loved it.  Would come back if in the area!
author: Siv L.

description: There's an upstairs and a downstairs with plenty of seating but it can get crowded quickly. It's a little easy to miss but the drinks are stiff and decently priced. Crowd is usually a mix of locals and transplants
author: Tasha M.

description: Best music in San Francisco. Love this place and need to make it back sooner than later! Love a good time? Go here people.
author: Gordians K.

description: I spent new years there with my boyfriend and it was an incredible way to ring in 2018. Our bartender Brian was by far one of the best bartenders I've ever had. Thank you Brian and Tunnel Top Lounge for making our new years one for the record books!
author: Rachel H.

description: A great time. Not too crowded. Awesome music to get you movin. Perfect since we're staying across the street at WorldMark. Thanks for the fun!
author: Sonia D.

description:
Pending where you are sitting, this place can be pretty loud and hot. The upstairs is a great place to hang out, but you have been warned. If the place is full you'll experience both of these things. I really enjoy this bar though and have been back many times and each cocktail has been great along with a solid beer selection. 

A dark bar that has the speakeasy feel with the red lights everywhere downstairs. A pretty trendy place with interesting art upstairs. Strong drinks is always a plus too and they definitely don't have a light pour
author: Thomas K.

description: They have cool vibes good music. The bar itself is pretty, and a great spot to hangout with people. Bad stars for terrible drinks. Their drinks seem to be watered down. Even the beer tasted like it was watered down. Not cool because we bought a couple drinks and didn't even get buzzed. Cool place to check out but if you're coming here to drink with your friends I would reconsider
author: Jess L.

description: I came here with a friend while in town last week and it was pretty cool.  Had a nice vibe to it and the drink I had was strong.  It's definitely more of a dive bar than what I'm used to but I dug it- I'd come back!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Had a wonderful evening. Great cocktails friendly staff. 

I ended up meeting the owner by chance and he was truly a wonderful man. I would highly recommend Tunnel Top for a great whiskey cocktail and good vibe.
author: Kayla B.

description:
Came here for happy hour with a few friends after work one day. I had never been here before and really liked it! Great little spot.

I ordered the cucumber basil drink and it was right up my alley. Anything with cucumber, basil, and gin is my drink of choice. From what I recall, it wasn't too pricey either!

Will definitely be back again soon.
author: Ilana B.

description:
The drinks were a little expensive, but I love the great service and the fresh fruit that the drinks come with! 

My friends and I tried the berry mojito and the watermelon gimlet. Both came with a lot of fresh fruit inside of it, but also a copious amount of ice -- there seemed to be more ice than actual liquid! Both drinks were great though. My personal favorite was the berry mojito, since it was so crisp and fresh that it covered up the bite of the alcohol.

-1 star for the huge amount of ice that came with my drink, but would definitely come back again.
author: Jessie Y.

description: So glad some places stay the same. Tunnel Top is a classic. 90's rap music on Tuesday night - RIP Prodigy
author: Peter L.

description: An awesome laid-back bar that's a favorite stop of mines if I'm around Union Square.  The bar appears divey, but it really isn't.  The drinks aren't necessarily top notch, but they have a strong pouring hand and at a reasonable price.  I really enjoy the atmosphere of this place, it's dark and somehow homey.  The upstairs loft is a great spot to sit down and chat with friends, while the bottom floor is a bit more lively.  They usually have a DJ going so the place can get pretty loud.  I really like the music here.  One final thing to be careful about is that it's cash only here, so make sure you have some on hand!
author: Bryson L.

description: My friends and I came here for drinks. There was ample seating upstairs (downstairs was crowded) and it was nice to be able to sit down. It's a dark, loungey type space. Because of how dark it was, I didn't notice that I had put my jacket and bag down on a large sticky area on the uncomfortable seats. I think the poor lighting definitely was doing a good job of hiding how sticky this place was. It didn't feel very clean. My biggest complaint, besides the uncomfortable seats, was the music. They were playing terrible music the whole time we were there...like heavy metal stuff. I think there were good drink deals happening so I can see that it can be a fun spot, but it just wasn't my kinda place.
author: Nicole D.

description: A good local. Upstairs adds a different dimension. Good selection of spirits and brews.
author: David H.

description:
My best friend has a few drinks and forgot her glasses here and they were able to find them and mail them to her! What amazing customer service! 

Awesome bar!!
author: Hillary A.

description: This one was not on my list honestly, but visited it out of curiosity while passing by. It turned out to be such a win!! We entered at 11:15 pm and it started to get crowded thereafter!! Music was really dashing and one cannot just sit, it will make you have the urge to dance anyways. I guess the DJ was mixing it well, blending in pop music and some Spanish tracks. Usually it's more of a locals hangout place. Sure it's dark, but that is what gives it a rustic casual feel. More of a speak easy feel rather. And the cocktails!!! They are like ..... Boommm !!! Have one of it and you are good to go !! They have good gimlets and Mules. More of the youth crowd is present and there is a casual dress up !!! Very friendly feel overall.
author: Foram C.

description: This is an awesome place to hangout but the DJ is such a boring person he has no clue what he is playing. I wish this guy gets out and makes it the most happening place in SF. He played all girly music on a Friday night (04/28/2017) we guys couldn't enjoy that girly music. It's not that girly music sucks I'm just trying to make things better for everyone. Thanks Agian
author: Gopi S.

description: Strong and expensive cocktails. Too often I feel like my cocktails are watered down. NOT here. And be sure to check out the bathroom - pretty neat for a divey place!
author: Amy W.

description: Great bartender and great drinks, but it smells like my scrotum after I jog 10 miles.
author: Mark T.

description: This is a sweet, dive bar, no pretense, but friendly mix of locals and visitors. This is an ideal place to meet a friend, bring a small group, or just to go somewhere and have a drink. The bartenders are friendly and helpful.
author: Jason P.

description: The go-to spot in the City when my wife and I are checking out the sights or after attending an event. Cool bartenders, and quite frankly, their playlist is basically the story of my younger years. When the front door's open it can get a bit chilly if you're sitting near it. We always head to the back end of the bar. The men's bathroom is... interesting! It's not necessarily bad, just ... interesting.
author: Andy B.

description: The real trick with this place is when you leave, go under the tunnel and meet the troll. Tell him Joe sent you and give a wink and a nod. You'll thank me later!
author: Joe R.

description: Cool little no-frills hangout with great drinks at great value. The bartenders at Tunnel Top offer generous pours from a decent selection, and the bar-and-balcony combination creates the perfect ambiance. This is an ideal venue for small-groups, as the half-tables along the walls offer the perfect spots to lean in for good conversation amidst the buzz of the bar. With an easy-going atmosphere and relatively low prices, you can afford to lose count of the both the hours and the drinks here.
author: Cam O.

description: Great bar, good location.  Staying at the Ritz Carlton, got back from the opera, needed a place to get a drink, and the Lounge at the Ritz was not cutting it due to rude customers and slow service.  The lady and I walked the 2 blocks down the steep street to this little gem.  Good music, quick bar service, and reasonable prices for San Francisco,  what more could you ask for to wind down til 2am.  We got a table upstairs by the window after ordering drinks.  Turned out to be the perfect place to unwind into the night, and still close to the Ritz.  Will definitely come here again if nearby!
author: G V.

description:
Great bar, great music, cool crowd. Love the upstairs space and the various places to sit with either a large group or date. Will be back to try some of the cocktails.

I wish it were not cash only and I came when I was hangry so some snacks would be nice (popcorn machine would take this place to the next level!)
author: Semuteh F.

description: Really cool neighborhood bar with a mix of old favorites and craft cocktails. The music playing was cool too. We'll be back.
author: Tim A.

description:
Cash only! 

Fresh watermelon gimlet was indeed fresh.  Both the foot and drink were crispy in nature and i enjoyed it very much 


Raspberry mojito was inefficiency fresh.   You see the bartender grab fresh berries and muddles them for flavour which is a nice change from every other place that uses syrup to flavour their drinks 

Over all a unique place to experience craft drinks worth visiting
author: Tina A.

description: It's a pretty fun place to get drinks! The crowd here is on the younger side and the music is loud, but the atmosphere was still pretty chill and welcoming. I wish I read the Yelp reviews before coming here, because apparently the cucumber basil drink is pretty good. I just got my usual jack and coke. Not a difficult drink to mess up, so I can't complain. I'm not too into hip hop, but the selection the DJ was playing sounded good to me.
author: Karen R.

description:
Really, Tunnel Top is more like 3.5 stars but I gotta bump 'em up for having such a great view of the street from their balcony bar. 

If you live in San Francisco and haven't been to this bar yet, Bookmark it on Yelp and make it a point to visit. It's not fancy, yet I wouldn't say it's a dive either. Just a bar with good drinks and casual ambiance. 

People rave about their cucumber basil drink, but the one time I ordered it years ago it tasted like Italian dinner. Too much basil I think? Or maybe someone grabbed oregano instead of basil? Stick with the classics here, like a Cosmo or a beer and you'll be safe ;)

Like many SF bars, it gets crowded fast. Go upstairs if you can and watch everything unfold from the loft. Probably one of the coolest things about Tunnel Top is the upstairs area. A very unique experience.

Crowd skews on the younger side. Pretty attractive folks, so if you're single this would be a good place to take your Tindering offline. 

Overall, a pretty cool bar. Go there and see for yourself!
author: Abby S.

description: Love  this little bar! Great vibe, drinks and live DJ, definitely coming back :)
author: Agustina P.

description: This place is awesome! I met up with a long time friend on a Tuesday night for dinner, and we were looking for a relaxed place to grab a drink after. We found this place on Yelp, and based on the pics and reviews, we decided to go for it. The beers were cheap(er) and we grabbed a spot on the second story and people watched. The art inside is hip and funky, it was exactly what we were looking for. I definitely want to go back!
author: Mollie H.

description: It's got more hipster ambiance than a typical dive bar. Their specialty drinks are satisfying and pretty reasonably priced.
author: Joseph G.

description: Nice little bar. We happened to stumbled upon and it was great. Good music nice atmosphere and great drinks and beer. We had the fresh berry mojito and watermelon gimlet. Would definitely come back when in town.
author: Karina S.

description:
Tunnel Top is too small for the amount of charm that it contains.

This bar is teeny-tiny.  So tiny, in fact, that you might be afraid that one too many people packed inside might cause Tunnel Top to teeter off its precarious perch above the Stockton St tunnel entrance.

Despite the small size, the vibe is amazing.  There are two levels, with a main bar on the first and a wrap-around balcony on the second.  In the middle of it all is a giant chandelier made of old beer bottles.  Somehow Tunnel Top makes it all come together.

Even on a Tuesday evening in the middle of winter, Tunnel Top was mobbed.  And I mean totally shoulder-to-shoulder mobbed.  There was absolutely nowhere to breathe, let alone sit back and relax.  (Do San Franciscans *ever* have to work the next day?!)

Of course, once I saw the dirt-cheap happy hour prices, I knew why it was so busy.  Treating myself to a gin-and-soda followed by a glass of their house white wine was a no-brainer.  (FYI -- cash only.)  Drinks were strong and tasty.

All in all, Tunnel Top is a awesome bar.  Despite the claustrophobia, I can't wait to check it out the next time I'm in SF.
author: David G.

description: If you're in the area and need a drink at 4pm, this is the place. Divey - yes. Smells like urnie - yes. Cheap drinks - yes. Cash only - yes.
author: Hang W.

description: It was me and my friends first time coming here ..a bar owner recommended we check it out and it was close to our hotel so why not?  It looks really small from the outside, and we were just about to leave when the DJ arrived and when he told us he was playing hip-hop, we stayed lol.  DJ played some good music, the drinks where cheap ....for two hennessy drinks with a mixer, came out to $16 not bad! We usually pay at least $24 for two wherever we go. On the second floor, there is a lounge area ....perfect spot to sit down, drink and dance.  Too bad we couldn't find a place to sit upstairs ...we ended up leaving since it got really crowded inside.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Cute little corner bar with an intimate vibe. I was a bit bummed when most of the draft beers seemed to be IPA's or lighter wheat beers. Even the darker beers were hoppy. I just prefer regular dark beer. 

I settled with a Dark and Stormy that did the trick to relax me after a day of running around. Cash only, so remember your dolla dolla bills ya'll!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Nice afterwork ambience. Not too crowded, but still enough of a crowd you aren't "drinking alone". Drinks are a little pricier than your "dive bar" selection, but also made with fresh ingredients and more variations than your standard bourbon and coke. 

Neat upstairs area with antiques (we sat by an old popcorn machine!) and great for intimate group conversations. If you want to make new friends, the bartenders are welcoming and the crowd tends to be outgoing.
author: Megan M.

description: Heard good things and I popped in for a drink. Pretty crowded around Thursday happy hour but snagged a table up top. Predictably expensive as SF is--over $10 for a cocktail. I had the watermelon cocktail and it really tasted super watery and had a seed in it. I would pass next time.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Walked in on a Saturday evening and this place was packed, but not to the point of it being too uncomfortable. I slid my way to the back of the room, creeped in between a few other patrons and placed my order, "I'll have a Bulleit Rye, one rock please." The bartender was quick, polite, but for the most part non-conversational. Eight dollars later I was sipping on my first of many libations at Tunnel Top while hanging with a crew of great Yelpers visiting San Francisco. 

The top balcony proved to be a blessing as we found lots of room for our entire crew to sit, dance, socialize and indulge. The DJ was on point for the most part with the occasional lull in the set list, which was actually appreciated by my old arthritic bones attempting to crip walk to some 2Pac - horrendous I tell ya.  

The ATM claims to be able to dispense $200 at a time but I found this to be a big fat lie after it kicked out my card minus any cash at all. I had to first check my bank account to make sure I wasn't charged, and after seeing I was in the clear I jumped in for $100... easy peasy. Yeah, cash only bar, total bummer.
author: Brad B.

description: Great bar right above the Stockton tunnel. Order the Watermelon gimlet, they muddle fresh watermelon for you and its very refreshing! At night they have a DJ who plays some throw back jams!
author: Nina P.

description:
Great ambiance
Yelp thinks this is too short of a review, but the place is awesome yet I don't want to bother describing it's awesome me was. I am lazy, but I feel entitled to leave a rating. So there. Suck it up Yelp. This is s 5 star place.
author: Mikhail F.

description: Unpretentious and mellow spot to have a few drinks with friends. Really good vibe and reasonable prices. Conveniently located downtown, great spot for after work HH or late night-cap.
author: Adrian C.

description:
~Warning: CASH ONLY~

This felt like one of those places that could be really "hit or miss" depending on the crowd, the time of day, and your general state of mind.  Our group rolled in at 10-ish on a Saturday night and the place was already pretty packed.  The downstairs was basically at capacity, so we wiggled our way upstairs and found it to be much less crowded.  We were able to secure an awesome corner spot for our group of 10+.  

It was loud, but not crazy loud, and the DJ was spinning a pretty good mix of stuff.  What made the night was the group of people I was with (you know who you are) - so I'm not sure if the place would seem as cool independent of them.
author: Jocelyn A.

description: Very odd hole in the wall bar. The pictures from Yelp looked better then what this place really consisted of. Gentlemen bartending was interesting but not in a good kinda welcoming way. I am from LA and small bars like this are normally a bit more welcoming.
author: T C.

description:
Met some fellow Yelpers at Tunnel Top after the Hornblower and yep I see why they call it what they call it.  Definitely felt like I was in a tunnel while downstairs.  Top balcony was a little more spacious and provided the atmosphere for our rawdy group to sing along to the music at the top of our lungs without being disturbed.  Did we disturb others?  I don't know but no one said anything.  I'm sure I drank alcohol here but frankly I don't remember.  I do remember digging the vibe here and being very bummed when my hubby wanted to leave.

Next time Tunnel Top!
author: Alisa M.

description:
They have beer. But I watched a man touch himself for about seven minutes outside. I've been told this is normal. 

Have drinks here if you don't have a fear of men touching themselves.
author: Chris C.

description: It's the bar you want to be at when you want music from a DJ, and good mixed drinks. Only $10 for mojito. Good prices, good atmosphere, good drinks. Come her to chill, talk and drink.
author: Michael I.

description: I have seen business men in their ugly suits try to "purchase" female customers. It always smells like bleach and the bouncer is a discriminating misogynist. I have seen him rough up women for no reason. It was so disturbing. He seemed to take pleasure in it. I get chills just thinking about that place. If you are female, watch your drinks and be on defense mode.
author: Krystal S.

description:
Drinks = well drinks, hard liquor and beers. Great choices! :D

Prices = reasonable.

Service = friendly. 

I'll be back!!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Nice after work hangout. There's some awesome weirdo decor, and some great views for people watching. 

The bartenders are cool, and I liked the unusual cocktail variations. The beer choice is OK, but not amazing. Would go back if nearby. No food.
author: Peter N.

description:
One of my favourite place in San Francisco! This is my bff and I's hideout. Lol I love this place so much. I always meet my bestie here since he just live across the street. (Lucky him) The place is not that big but it's very cozy. The bartenders are very nice. The drinks are not that expensive. They could be packed after 5 since all these hot men in suit are done working and needed some cold beer, what a nice view! Hahaha They used to have this cool empty bottle chandelier, but they changed it. Don't know why. 

So if u need a place to hangout after shopping in the city or just needed a drink or two, u should come here!
author: E-lie P.

description:
Oh Tunnel Top, 
My dearest Tunnel Top,
Why must you be a cash only bar?  
With your fancy melon gimlets and blueberry mojitos, 
People travel across the City and come from afar.
You always promise a fun and not-so-classy time,
I love your happy hour,
Especially when I'm sipping on some wine.  
Or maybe on those crazy Saturday nights, 
Where we take 10 shots and sing to Ellie Goulding's Lights.
You are a cozy little spot with a vibe that moves me.
Bartender, just pour me another shot, 
Or mix it up and, oh shoot, I forgot......

I didn't bring my money.  

That was my poor attempt at poetry.  Thank you for not booing me :)

But this dive bar would get so much more business if they took card.  My friends love it here since they always have a great selection of beer and crafty cocktails for the ladies too.  Sigh.. no thanks ATM that charges me $2.50 for withdrawing from you and another $2.50 from my bank.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
"Don't worry, ALL the guys will have beer goggles on anyways."

Sometimes I don't know whether I want to slap my guy friends' in back of their heads for being so insensitive or be thankful that I have such honest friends. 

Come Saturday night, I promised myself a chill night; dinner and "maybe" go to a wine bar afterwards. Not dressed appropriately, the next thing I know we're bar-hopping in SF. GREAAAAAT. Bad enough that I can barely see sober, I'm in flats so can't even see at eye-level. Throw several shots in the mix and we have a recipe for disaster. STEER CLEAR, FOLKS. 

After a bust at Sugar Lounge in Hayes Valley (hella boo-boo on a Saturday night), I remembered Mike L.'s review of Tunnel Top and suggested to my friends that we go there next. 

Atop the Stockton Tunnel, lies a diamond in the rough. Tunnel Top maybe a divey bar but it has so many redeeming factors. It even has a chandelier made of wine bottles. How cool is that? 

1. NO COVER. NO DRESS CODE. NO ATTITUDE. 

2. CHEAP DRINKS: $7 for a shot of Hendrick's (yes, I'm crazy like that) in Union Square? Unheard of. 

3. AWESOME CROWD: The mixed crowd was easy going, friendly, and knows HOW to have fun. Props to the white boys upstairs getting all hifey doing the "bus driver dance". The boys had rhythm I gotta give them that. IMPRESSIVE. 

4. B(   l   )TY SHAKING MUSIC: DJ Tin One (?) was KILLING IT! Spinning Top 40s, Hip Hop, and even a tribute to the late Whitney Housten, he had everyone dancing and drunkenly thinking they were auditioning for America's WORST Singer (*raises hand*). The transition from MJ's "Billie Jean" to Rihanna's "We Found Love" was epic. LOVED IT. 

5. MEZZANINE FLOOR: Great for people watching below BUT ladies please...from the bar below, I can see your panties or lack thereof when you're standing near the railing. Kindly keep your cha-cha covered till after 2 AM. Thanks.

Tunnel Top is a cockfest (which is why we left against my will) but my friend was right...you can be wearing a muu muu dress with a lampshade over your head and the guys won't give even a sh*t. Single ladies, HOLLLLAAAA!

OTHER NOTES:
*HH everyday from 4:30 PM - 8 PM
*Nightly drink specials; e.g. $4 tequila shots
*Fast and efficient bartenders
*Two large couches upstairs
*One restroom for each sex
*Parking available below at Sutter-Stockton Garage (open 24 hours and $8 nightly flat rate)
*CASH ONLY
author: Cherylynn N.

description: 90's to 2000's alternative/indie rock was playing while we were there making this more nostalgic than expected. The open couches and small dancing space were a nice touch for this small bar my favorite spot to sit however, is upstairs by the white pained windows that peer down into the San Francisco streets. It almost makes you feel as though you're in a foreign place for a sort while providing a sweet escape for a rainy Sunday night.
author: Sarah S.

description: Can get harder to move around during prime time than most bars around here, but the specialty drinks are pretty legit. They make a mean dark and stormy, and their berry mojito is good too.
author: Brock F.

description: Great vibe and strong drinks.  We went for a bachelorette and this place was perfect.
author: Marivel K.

description: Went on a Friday night, super crowded but enough space to move around! I tried both the watermelon gimlet and the berry mojito. The watermelon gimlet is definitely a must-get, tastes just like fresh watermelon juice! The berry mojito was less sweet than the watermelon gimlet, but still good and better than other berry mojitos I've had. The bar is very very dark, and the DJ on this Friday night played a lot of throwback 2006 music!
author: Claire L.

description:
When I lived in San Francisco for a short while, I would walk past the Tunnel Top every single day on my way to work. Never did I actually go inside, and what an utter shame that is.

I friggin' love it here. The layout is the best part- it's like a duplex. That upstairs area is so damn cute and you get to overlook all the hub bub below. Or even better, you can get an upstairs window seat and go all Peeping Tom on the neighbors across the street. 

The girls' bathroom is a one-seater, which is annoying, but totally worth the wait. There's a disco ball in there. 

Cash only- The only serious bummer. But I think this one's worth it. Can't wait to come back!
author: Amy S.

description: This place is pretty cozy as has great craft and old school drinks. There's something for everyone here. The bartenders are very attentive and "on it!" Music is great too!
author: Beth E.

description:
Yo HO! I mean yooHOo! Happy HOlidays!
Tis the HOliday season, and lots to be excited about with so many festive gatherings with family and friends!

AnywHO, I am a big fan of Tunnel Top. You don't really know what to expect of a bar that looks like a dive outside, but not really one on the inside. My most recent visit to TT was a bittersweet as it was a going away party for someone near and dear, my twinnie! TT provided an ambiance where my gal and crew could enjoy the last moments of her being a SF resident. The tables upstairs were reserved in advance, and TT staff were reliable and friendly. Sweet tunes were spinning thanks to G for a few hours, and the sweet old school and new school jams were appreciated by all, as there were lots of head bobbing and booty shaking. I was entertained not only by the slide show of random pics of places, people, and things on the wall next to the stairs, but also the people watching down below.

TT has many cocktails to choose from, and specialty drinks like the mojito-- so check the menu behind the bar. And HO, they have wine and beer, and you guessed it, HOegaarden on draft! Woot! 

Since it's a pretty small bar, it tends to get crowded, so I'd check out TT for HH after work, or go early on Friday and Saturday evenings. TT also can get hot and stuffy inside, so if you run hot like me, stand next to the door if you're downstairs; and in front of the fan if you're upstairs. You can pretend like you're a model and practice your poses in front of the fan! hahah!

Make sure to bring cash, as TT is cash only! 

Grab your friends and drink and be merry this HOliday season!
Miss you Twinnie.. hurry back, so we can drink some HOs together! Ruvs!
author: Gill C.

description:
4 stars because of the cash only deal. 

Absolutely pleased with this artsy urbanized themed bar. 

Bar tender was quick and attentive with our drinks.

Seating upstairs includes lounge type seating and window seating. 

You'll love the bar, drinks, and people!
author: Alyssa A.

description:
TUNNEL TOP, WHERE YOU WILL LOSE YOUR VOICE FROM SCREAMING A CONVERSATION TO THE PERSON NEXT TO YOU! Seriously, just because it's "cool" to have loud music, doesn't mean that you have to BLAST everyone's ears. It was hard to enjoy this bar. 

The drinks are good, though. 

Those DERN kids and their loud crazy rock n' roll!
author: Audrey S.

description:
Man up and get a watermelon gimlet! I wish I could've tried their other delicacies but I was doing hopping 1 place 1 drink
Quick service too for a busier weekday evening.
author: Alex W.

description:
Really chill spot. There's an upstairs section to sit, an amazing selection of beer, and the aura is just overall "chill." It's a bit small so when it's packed, it may not be the optimal place. They also only accept cash, so keep that in mind.

Since I'm near this spot, I will come here whenever possible. They've got my racer 5!
author: Albert K.

description:
Great place to meet up for cocktails, it's actually quite the ideal location ~smack~ in the middle of downtown and close to everything. Maybe you need a break from holiday shopping this season, a place to celebrate Happy Hour after work or a quite little bar to sip a cocktail solo. 

This place may be packed, but it's never pretentious. I wouldn't consider it a dive, but it's dark and mysterious. You can find yourself in a quality cocktail type of mood without breaking the bank. They have a scratch bar full of choices, so it's up to you. 

What are you drinking?
author: Rebekah T.

description:
(...a parchment describing Tunnel Top drifts into your hands...)

Once upon a tunnel, lies a saloon with stash
Drinkers be mindful, for they barter in cash

Their brews are crafty, and their cocktails strong
If thou arrives past midnight, the queue shall be long

They serve a cider that's an interesting booze
It drinks like alcohol, but tastes like juice

If thou art a romantic, and searching for love
Build up your courage, three drink's enough

Find your path upstairs, where narrow roads stand 
It's a space for a love drunk, to reach for her hand

The drinks are strong, the bartender foretold
So fools beware, of the liquor you hold
author: Ringo M.

description: This was a go-to place during the dot com era for FiDi folks, and is awesomely still around. Wound up there last night for the first time in years. Basic beers on tap, decent cocktails, and an all round good vibe. If you overdo the booze, you may well wind up at The Green Door next door for a happy ending to the night.
author: Nick C.

description:
Hmm. Looks like a few people have had the same experience I had with the blonde bartender. 

Preface - I really like(d) tunnel top. It was good music, a bit divey, not too bad prices for drinks, and overall a fun spot. But dang, someone has to get her attitude in check. I've worked in and respect the service industry and I know how important tips are BUT that just makes me feel like I have to earn it even more so. I know I am not entitled to a tip. 

So, my friend and I are waiting to be served, the other bartender looks super busy and the blonde bartender is just chatting up some guys. So I raise my hand (no wave, no snapping, just a raised hand). She walks over and says "Don't raise your hand, it's not cool, I'll see you". I chuckled and thought to myself "but you didn't" but I let it go and instead I just ordered. As I said, tips are based on service and this was pretty poor service so I just paid for the drinks. She counted the money the moment I handed it to her and she started mouthing off something (I couldn't actually hear over the music) and gestured me to leave the bar accompanied with a sarcastic "BUH BYE!". 

Sorry ma'am but you are not entitled to a tip. If you don't like "serving" others or having customer service, then don't work in the SERVICE industry haha seems simple to me. You give bartenders a bad name.
author: Adrian M.

description:
Cool bar, really cool location and close enough to union square that if you for some sad reason need to go there, you can scour the memory away with beer after.

The beer selection isn't particularly interesting but they have enough solid regional standards that you'll be fine.
author: Misha T.

description: I was very underwhelmed during my first visit to Tunnel Top last night. It wasn't crowded when we got there around 10pm, which was sort of nice; we got bar stools near the open window, which I liked. The bartender seemed annoyed when we ordered drinks from the cocktail menu. One cocktail with fresh watermelon was okay, kinda weird after taste. The other cocktail was coconut-y and just way too milky and plain. Seriously looked like a glass of milk in a tumbler. Very minimal effort; a cherry or really anything would have made it much more appealing. We drank half of our drinks, then called it a night. The layout of the place is cool with a DJ upstairs, so I'd maybe try it again, probably more around happy hour than later in the night.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
Love the vibe, upscale dive bar if you will, a little oxymoronic but its the best way I can describe Tunnel Top

A decent variety of draft beers as well as bottles that should satisfy most peoples needs. I saw a few standard drink specials such as Dark and Stormy and Basil Gimlet. They also offer a good selection of hard liqueur so have no fear you will be able to get your drink own! 

-CASH ONLY-

Overall Thoughts

A nifty hole in the wall bar that's still low key and a great option to escape all the crowds
author: Eddie W.

description: This bar is pretty good.   Ususally there's space after work, the drinks are good, and the location is great.  The staff is generally nice, and they have a good selection of beers.
author: Michael E.

description:
So I was staying nearby in at the Triton Hotel and was looking for a spot for a nightcap. After some careful considerations through a lengthy Yelp search, I decided to pick the closest bar possible. So I walked up this hill -- this hill with a tunnel on top of it -- to the Tunnel Top bar.

On a Tuesday night, it wasn't busy. I grabbed a bar stool and stared at the fresh fruit and herbs ready to be infused into the bar's specialty cocktails. I ordered an IPA, although I think I meant to order the cucumber vodka and basil martini. Ah well.

A few fellow drinkers murmured amongst themselves nearby as a New Zealander chatted me up, eventually convincing me to swap seats so he could talk to a pretty young lass. A little creepy, perhaps, but you got to give the guy credit for trying to get a little action.

But yeah, the place is divey and dark. Relaxing and unpretentious. And they played Rappin' Rodney Dangerfield on the jukebox, which is honestly the one and only vinyl I've purposely smashed to pieces. Made me smile.
author: Will S.

description: Love this little bar. Very relaxed and great beer and bourbon selection. It's a must stop on every visit to the city
author: Life I.

description: Nice little spot w/ a nice bartender! Even though I just got a beer lol  friend had a mojito that looked delicious.
author: Adan M.

description:
If you're looking for a cool / non-douchey bar with awesome bar tenders, great people, the perfect atmosphere, and drinks that have a substantial amount of alcohol (and for a good price,)  this is your place.

The bar vibe is awesome with a lot of young professionals. There is a second floor to the bar as well with really cool seating. 

Prices are extremely reasonable and the drinks are not too sugary or watered down. They have an awesome selection of drinks, and great recipes.
author: Ariella H.

description: Went there on a rainy saturday night. Drinks selection is all right, not overwhelming not poor. Music playing was some r&b / hip hop pretty cool. Nice place to stop for a drink if you happen to be nearby.
author: Fede R.

description:
I've been to Tunnel Top quite a few times. The bar is fine, but I have to give 1 star for the rudeness of a blond girl who happens to bartend there with incredibly nasty attitude towards people. Very moody, rude, obnoxious. If you have problems with attitude don't work as a bartender, please! 
This place could be so much better without her. Never coming back again!
author: Mariya Delilah D.

description: Small neighborhood bar. Great selection of whisky, and beer, friendly bartender/owner. I'll be back.
author: Thomas R.

description:
This bar was a good place to start the night. They had even have happy hour on the weekends ($2 off signature cocktails and $1 drafts)! 

All the fruits, herbs and veggies were freshly cut, we saw the bartenders doing so throughout our visit. Favorite cocktails were the watermelon gimlet and the dark and stormy. 

It was only a Saturday but there was still college football on and there was only 1 tv which is the only downside if you wanted to watch sports. Overall, this place had an awesome vibe with playing rock and alt rock music with a good selection of drinks.
author: Erica D.

description: Not a dive bar...cool, chill place. Good beer and  drink selection with reasonable prices. Game was on mood was chill. Id come back with my bros.
author: Jason C.

description:
Tunnel Top is, quite literally, on top of the Stocktown tunnel. Coming from downtown, it's (sadly) a urine-infested stairway away. But those 20 steps up are worth it. Especially if you like good ol' hip hop music. You can dance right by the bar. You can dance upstairs in the balcony. You can dance in the narrow balcony aisle by the windows if you reaaaally wanted to (I wouldn't recommend it; it's tight and I'm 5'2").

And the best part? Drinks are more than affordable! Thank you for being a divey bar, Tunnel Top. Please don't change (:

$9 Oban
$7 Hendrink's gin and tonic
$6 Jager

CASH ONLY
author: Sandy T.

description:
We stopped in here for a quick drink around 6pm on a Saturday. The place was dead. It was me, Lisa, and two old dudes at the bar. Then, a few others showed up... then a crowd of well-dressed folks walked in for pre-show, pre-dinner, cocktails. Then a couple of pilots on a two-day layover arrived... and a few regulars. Before you know it, our quick drink turned into a full-on, knockdown, dragout, drunk! Brian, the bartender, was super cool and was johnny on the spot with drinks and refills and bar snacks and conversation and whatever else anyone needed. No matter what strange cocktail order was thrown at him, he was all over it... and quick too!
The crowd was a great bunch of locals and "others" like us and we had a great time. The music was a great mix and not too loud to have a conversation.
This was one of the most enjoyable evenings we spent in San Francisco!
author: Charles S.

description: Such a fun little divey bar! The staff was awesome and not too bad looking either  the upstairs has the most adorable seating areas and when I was went they had a live DJ upstairs. Just such an awesome place to feel at home at. It's great because it's mainly locals and certainly not a tourist trap like a lot of the other small bars. Just go and you'll definitely leave with a smile!
author: Krystina M.

description:
Suuuuper cute bar! Came here after dinner as we had dinner nearby. There are two levels--where the upper level is more of a balcony with a few intimate seats and the main level is the bar area. The balcony area has a pretty cool view of the SF streets at night!

We ordered a watermelon gimlet and raspberry mojito--YUM for both! Both drinks were refreshing and enjoyable. 

It's pretty grungy...if you compare it to other bars in SF, but it's not too bad of a place! The bartender was friendly and attentive, and drinks weren't too expensive either ($7/drink?). 

I'd come back again, but I can't imagine how this place is if it were extremely packed...hot and sweaty, anyone?
author: Rachel C.

description:
Came here after work for drinks - it was pretty packed, but I was lucky enough to grab a spot for two. The watermelon gimlet is highly recommended, but a bit strong for my taste. However, they do have about 4 different mojito selections, and I did become a fan of the blueberry one.

Cash only, but at least you don't need a reservation? (My friend's choices were here or somewhere else where you need reservations...).
author: Kris I.

description:
It's a good atmosphere. It can get kind of busy downstairs. Not a super classy place, but just casual. They have pretty good drinks that are strong. Upstairs it's a little more relaxed. It's easy to find parking nearby and public transportation is quite accessible.

Overall, I'd check it out again if I was in the area. Diverse crowd.
author: Natalie M.

description: Well for it being tiny there was a cool Scottish terrier inside who was a patron you could say, how cool is that? A dog greeting maybe it's a San Francisco thing because I have never been welcomed by a dog in any local bar. The lighting was a show stopper you could say it's very ornate it was a bird cage chandelier that had light bulbs exposed off the bottom of he cage. Bartender was a cool guy to chat with he had been an employee of this bar for over 10+ years and he mentioned being a patron before actually working here so I'm guessing he has to love it there. He was one man taking the role of multiple people jobs; he was the only person running this bar he served us drinks cleaned up after those who left and everything else he was the sole operator and everything else this night. I don't even remember what we ordered since it was kinda divy we got some domestic beers and stayed for awhile it was early so we had hours before anything seemed to get crackin. He mentioned music coming up around 10 pm on Saturday but it was around 7pm so we weren't waiting around till then what seemed forever when you start bar hoping early like we were. Great vibe for nothing crazy just chill out drink your poison and watch some football here
author: Justine S.

description: Try the Whistlepig Manhattan, you're welcome. And if Manhattans aren't your kind of thing, call the Uber anyway. It's the perfect drive bar in every sense of the word. The people, the drinks and the music are amazing. Grab a drink here and just remember this review when you start telling your story about that time you found the best neighborhood bar in San Fran.
author: Joel H.

description:
When it comes to the price and the quality you can't really beat this place if you live around the neighborhood and is looking for a bar to frequent. I would give this place 4 stars for the great drink selection, cheap price, and cool crowd. But since I live 2 streets away from this joint its a 5 star for me. 

They have a bunch of craft beer by the bottle and on draft. I rarely go for the well liquor since top shelf is only 6-7 bucks a pop. The bar tenders know what they are doing. It's pretty much an awesome San Francisco bar minus the 14 buck drinks. I am really getting to a point where I find over priced drinks unjustifiable. 

Only thing is, bring cash since its cash only!
author: Guang H.

description: Tunnel Top what happened?  You used to be the place where the good, the bad & the ugly would converge under one roof and let go of all inhibitions. Sticky floors, white lines on the bar, the uneasy feeling when climbing the stairs to the second floor because you had no idea who or what you'd see. Its all replaced by a doorman, cushy benches upstair, and hipster noir decor with DJs playing Drake. Now you're just another classic SF dive bar that drank the Tech money kool-aid. The application for "a place of entertainment" permit pinned outside the building gave it away. Too bad TT, but thanks for the memories or lack thereof.
author: chennie c.

description: Chill place awsome drinks and even better prices for SF they mostly play OG hip hop brings back my youth memories Bartenders are supper friendly too.
author: Judith A.

description: Great music! Justine, the DJ plays a great mix.! The watermelon giblet is awesome and the bartender made great recommendations on whiskey for my husband. We only game up for the game, but glad we stopped in!
author: Trang N.

description: I thought I had left a review on this spot, but apparently I missed it. I went on a Friday night, DJ was playing some nice music and the drinks were on point and not over priced...The only downside is the line for restroom gets long and it's only one toilet.....
author: Koby G.

description:
This place is a gem! We came here on halloween night after being in the zoo that is Polk street. They have a really interesting drink menu above the bar. It was kind of s crazy night so I kept my order simple with a gin and ginger ale, which was evenly balanced. I would like to come back and try their speciality drinks- their mojitos look delicious. 
They had a DJ who played good top 40s with some old school hip hop mixed in. He also took requests which was cool. Overall the vibe that night was great. People were dressed up, dancing and having a good time without being rowdy.
author: Prianka K.

description: We were visiting from L.A. in search of a bar & lounge that played good music and had good drinks with a good vibe .  We received all that and more.  The bouncer, at the door, was real friendly and down to earth, the DJ (Justin) was smooth with his music transitions and even took requests.   Played hip hop/r&b old and new school.  The diversity of the crowd showed how great of a place this is dancing mingling and having a good time. My friend is moving here to go to school and we will definitely be back.
author: Lauri P.

description:
With my recent discovery of Tunnel Top, it has quickly become one of my favorite bars in FiDi. Although labeled as a dive bar, it really doesn't have that feel to it. Downstairs, it's more like a modern prohibition-style extreme mixology bar. Upstairs, it's a small hip-hop club. Fascinating combo that actually makes for an awesome night.

Drinks here are incredible. They use a variety of fresh fruits and herbs to make some of the best tasting and healthy cocktails in the game. Watermelon gimlet, berry mojito and a decent selection of beers on tap. Prices are manageable as well. 

Upstairs, there's two lounge areas, some chairs, and tables in the back. The small bypass between the lounge area and tables makes it tough to get through on a crowded night. Be sure to come early and snag some lounge space, or else you'll end up on their tiny dance floor. Speaking of dance floor, ladies beware. The world is full of perverts and if you're leaning by the upstairs railing, someone on the bottom floor will have easy access to take a peak. 

Music is typically top 40 hip hop with some old school mixed in; DJ is always killing it.  No cover is always good. Bathrooms are large but have no stalls, so lines almost always appear. With such a small venue, it gets packed quickly. 

The cage hanging from the ceiling adds a nice touch too...
author: Dmitriy S.

description: Came here for my sisters 21st bday last Saturday and our group had such a great time!!!! Drinks weren't too pricey and the music was awesome. We all loved it. Will definitely be back next time we are in town :)
author: Adrienne F.

description: Ok bar. Came here to check it out after dinner. I didn't really see the appeal. It's really small and it's cash only. I got here around 11 and it was already really crowded. There wasn't anywhere to really stand and chill. We went upstairs since they had a couple of tables near the windows but it was still pretty cramped up there and already full of people. Maybe the vibe would be different had we came with only a few people with us, but we had a good 15 people so there wasn't any room for all of us to stand together at once. But a lot of people seem to like this place, so I'd probably come back if I were around the area.
author: Jeannie T.

description:
Tunnel Top's a fun lounge-y bar, and definitely good for groups. I dropped in here with a couple friends on a Tuesday night recently. The bar area was full, but the upstairs lounge was almost totally empty. Lots of couches and reasonably-loud music meant we could have lots of relaxed conversation.

Service was friendly and quick; beer selection was decent, and it looks like they have a rotating drink and entertainment menu. Lots of reasons to go back here.
author: Bill H.

description:
It seems a bit presumptuous to give a 5-star to a place when I don't frequent the SF bar scene as others, but believe me this is one fine establishment.

Went drinking on a Wednesday night and we were worried about not finding a place to sit.  Luckily a large group was just leaving.  In a medium sized room, there are more places for standing than sitting.  But the bar counter was readily available with a single bartender to take care of us.  

The selection is quite nice, with a handful of beers on tap (see pic) and several chalkboards with hand-written special drinks for you to try (I had the Dark and Stormy with rum and ginger beer, quite tasty!).  

I didn't catch his name, but somehow through the night, I struck up a conversation with the bartender about a recent new bourbon whisky produced in NY.  I read about Hudson Whisky in a recent article in Forbes Life as something to try.  Looks like curiosity got the best of his so he brought down the bottle to try, handing me a half-shot as well.  Thanks!

Live DJ was spinning some funky tunes as well that went along the lines that theme from Austin Powers mixed in with some Dinah Washington.  Don't know, don't ask, it worked.  You don't have to ask me if I'll come back because the answer is yes.

Lastly, I would probably take off half a star because payment is cash only.  This place didn't strike me as low funded or low key.  The location of the venue should speak for itself, so my friends and I couldn't figure out why they didn't take card. 

All in all, if you're looking for a spot to put down a few drinks with your friends in the city, here is my first recommendation.
author: Andy L.

description:
Only real downside is they only accept cash. 

Besides that; good vibe, great bartenders, and cool views 

If you haven't been check it out
author: Sean B.

description:
Entering Tunnel Top is like finding yourself in a mysterious portal where time does not exist and the moment held before you seems as if it could suspend itself in actuality forever. You are undoubtedly in the heart of an urban metropolis, yet there is something so secret about the moments you spend here. Perhaps it is the seduction of dark corners around the catwalk-like second story, or the sexy tracks spun from the DJ's private platform at the end of the maze, or one too many tart capirinhas or sugary raspberry mojitos, that do the trick. In any case, one thing is clear: you will not forget what happens here. Memory clings to the dream sequence occurring at this sacred spot, overlooking hills dotted with city streetlights, many of which lead down to your lackluster--and often bitter--reality.

Every tunnel should be topped with a Tunnel Top.
author: Kate V.

description:
I'm not a big fan of dive bars and this place didn't really change my opinion on that.

Overall this place is pretty tiny. The upstairs area is bit less crowded compared to downstairs, but that's because you can't really get a lot of people up there with the sofas in the way. There's sort of a dance floor up there too but it's not all that big. FYI ladies, it's along the railing so people from the lower level can look up at you. Music selection wasn't that bad, since they played stuff I remembered from middle and high school.
author: Allen C.

description: I felt like this place was an Oasis in a Sea of otherwise Touristy/Pretentious/Dirty bars. I spent a lot of time in NYC, so I am always on the lookout for a spot where I can feel comfortable cozying up to the bar for a drink or two and this was the place! I came in at 5:30pm on a Friday and there were a good number of people, but still room to sit at the bar. They have a pretty decent beer menu, and also made a very good vodka martini for a really reasonable price. By the time we left, the ground floor was packed, which seems like a good sign for the night ahead. I would definitely come back when I'm in the area and looking for a good happy hour spot.
author: Danielle G.

description: Always a fun place! The location is off the beaten path but the bar is nice and the drinks are good.
author: Zach H.

description:
If you're looking for a chill, lounge-ish kind of place to grab some drinks with friends, Tunnel Top just might be the place for you!  I had heard about TT for a while now from friends, but I had never gone in until we dropped in for our high school friend's farewell party.  I must say...he picked a pretty good venue to say goodbye to everyone.

The place is pretty small, but the lower level is an especially tight fit.  After you walk in, it's just a few short steps until you're already in line at the bar.  They managed to squeeze in a table or two, but there really isn't much space for anything else.  Each time we would get our drinks, we would head straight back upstairs to the couches the rest of the group had claimed.  It felt quite a bit more spacious up there, but it's mostly because it was so busy down below.

Space aside, the rest of Tunnel Top is awesome.  The DJ was playing mostly mostly hip-hop and top-40 and though there wasn't anyone dancing or anything, I'm sure there might have been if there was room for it.  As for the bartenders, I was impressed by how fast they were able to get drinks out even though there was only two of them working.  Fast, well made drinks that were pretty cheap as well?  Win.  Just make sure you come prepared though, as the bar is CASH ONLY (they have an ATM out front if you need it).

Although parking in the area can be tough, the Stockton/Sutter garage is right next door.  Though it may suck having to pay for parking, it's convenient and the hourly rate is pretty cheap.  Since drinks at the bar won't cost much anyways, it'll all even itself out by the end of the night.  If you're still bummed though, just think of it this way - the sooner you park, the sooner you drink.
author: Mike L.

description: Great dive bar downtown. The upstairs area is pretty cool too. Just wish they took credit cards. To their credit though I pretty much can make a generalization that I don't like any cash-only bars yet somehow Tunnel Top escapes this and is great. It's easy to walk to from FiDi or Union Square area so we'll often go here for drinks after work and is also a great late night/last-stop spot!
author: Amanda M.

description: Hi tunnel top!!! with negatives reviews if I was allowed. This is to call BULLSHIT on the "service," we received tonight. The "bartender" AKA terminator stand-in wanna be that handed us a bill with 16 drinks on it. 16. At $8 a piece. Sir, excuse me. I'm not a tourist. And I'm also NOT DRUNK. We had 8. Maybe 9, being generous total. NOT 16. 16 drinks we were charged for as I sit her writing this review clearly trashed and incapable of mathematics. 16X8 equals $128. We had AGAIN 8. Maybe 9. MAYBE. Which is $72. That's a difference of $56 +tip. Which you argued back and fourth... "What would benefit you to charge more?!?" Ummmmmm how about tip plus drinks we didn't order?!? $26 + $56 is $82 bonus gee. Um. Weird. Extra money in YOUR pocket?!? Please F@ck off. Really. I one, was not born yesterday. Two, am clearly not inebriated and am capable of coherent, reasonable, logical conversation to tell you; my friend and I did NOT order that many drinks and further more... THREE YOU. DO. STAND. TO. BENEFIT. FROM. OVERCHARGING. CLUELESS. PATRONS. WHICH. I. AM.  NOT. (I was a cocktail waitress for 10 years you a$$.) We didn't order 16 drinks. We arrived after 8pm. And barely had 1 per hour till closing. You don't serve food. Snacks or nuts. Just drinks. Which 16 I had not. You're LUCKY my friend paying the bill didn't want to push this BS bill anymore. And paid you. And WTF TIPPED YOU ON TOP OF IT DESPITE MY PROTESTING.  I won't be coming back. And will tell everyone I know to NOT visit you either. Shame on you tunnel top.
author: maria K.

description:
The place gets its name from its location on top of the Stockton tunnel in SF. It is kind of out of the way if you aren't going for dinner at Bouche or exploring Stockton for some reason. It is a nice if unremarkable dive bar if you are looking for decently priced drinks and being squeezed in with strangers.

Inside of tunnel top there is one main bar to your left when you enter. There will be a max of two people serving drinks so prepare for a little wait. The place has a great selection of cocktails with some combinations I have actually never seen before. There were a lot of fruit infused drinks with watermelon and other fresh fruits that are a nice change of pace from the fifty step drinks you get at other places. The only problem though was that the bartender made these drinks in two steps. I think it might take a little more than that but yes thank you for taking a chunk of watermelon. Mashing it in a glass and pouring vodka over it. This is definitely something if not the thing I was expecting.

Besides the odd drink The bathrooms are located terribly right near the bar so expect the line for the bathroom to crash into the line for the bar and play a fun game of what am I waiting for and why am I surrounded by so many people. If you can get away make your way upstairs. There isn't much room to be had up here either when things get late into the night and more crowded but it is nice to look out over the entire place while holding your drink for dear life. There is actually a lot of seating upstairs and you can bring a group of friends and have a good time. Check to make sure it isn't taken up by a party or anything though.

 Later in the night a DJ begins to play a mix of tunes that range from electronic to progressive. It really is eclectic and fits the vibe of the whole place in general. There are weird images being displayed on the walls and really you shouldn't expect anything different from a dive bar in San Francisco.

It's a decently good time but nothing to go out of your way for. If you are in the area check it out and have a drink with friends otherwise there are much better places to check out a little further in the area.
author: Nick R.

description:
Very unique and very San Francisco place.  Like the layout.  
A lot of TV screens and projectors to watch the game.  Very good and friendly bartender.  Very good for groups.

Love that golden AK-47 mounted on the bar.  One day I'll make an offer.
author: Alex R.

description:
This was the first stop in our bar crawl (Pub Crawl SF) and while I enjoyed the place itself (two story, small but cozy), I was pretty pissed when I found out it was CASH ONLY. Maybe getting cash is not a problem for a local, but I live in Palo Alto and do not know the city at all (and that includes not knowing where the ATMs are). Additionally, finding an ATM is not so easy wearing 5 inch heels ( think of the SF hills)

After borrowing some money from a friend, I got a tequila shot which was generously poured. It took a while for the bartender to get to us, but to be fair, the place was busy.
author: Elena M.

description: what a cool, divey, san francisco bar! love all the wacky decor, the old architecture of the place and the drinks were pretty good, too. i rated this place 4 stars since it was chock full of character both spatially and patron-wise. the location is well suited hence it's name. go already if you're looking for a signature, san francisco bar that's not trendy but definitely an institution.
author: Trujillo F.

description: Michelle really made my night, despite being a very crowded bar she was attentive and courteous bartender. Just like a great bartender should be, nice to see her not fall under pressure. The Manhattan she made was great, she used a bourbon she recommended and made a phenomenal drink.
author: Monica A.

description:
Where I met my future husband. This place has a place in my heart. Listed in one of those cheesy travel guides as a "off the beaten path great find" I decided I wanted to check it out. So I put it on a list.  I conveniently left the guidebook in the  pocket on the plane. 

While visiting from Chicago, I really wanted a memorable San Francisco experience. Now how could that happen after losing my guidebook? ;) 

I checked into my hotel and went down the street to get some wine and cheese to stock up my room. While on the way back I saw a little hole in the wall. It was dark and small and perfect for my first alcoholic beverage of my trip. I ordered and sat next to a man at the one table. A professor who knows no other bar in the city told me the name - Tunnel Top. 

"Why does this sound familiar? Wait, the list. I may not have the guidebook but I do have the list I made of four places I wanted to see and, of course, Tunnel Top is on it." 

I just stumbled upon it. Coincidence? 

I frequented the place for the week. On my last night in town after getting left behind by my wine tour bus, lost in Muir Woods and hitch hiking back to the city I stopped in for one farewell and ended up with the love of my life.
author: Kelly C.

description:
+ strawberry mojito
- bellini was gross
- music wasn't that good on a Saturday night
- weird crowd
author: Sherry L.

description:
What happens when 4 girls in their tightest jeans and high heels walk into Tunnel Top with none of their guy friends within a 5 feet radius?

Other guys swarm around them.

I wish I could say it was a delight to have all that attention. But between the stinky European guy, the 16 year old with a cheesy smile and the arrogant dude, well, there's just so much unwanted attention around us.  I downed 2 blueberry mojitos within 20 minutes to dull my senses. 

Hey. Those drinks were stronger than the last time I was here!

Our friend who was feeling such a wild child last night, took the guys on single handedly. 

Thank God!

I decided to get some fresh air.  I flipped my phone open and started texting Erik: "where are you?! my sis is getting hit on by a guy who looks like an ugly version of Harry Potter!!"

* ting ting*
