Before I could read his reply, the arrogant guy showed up and started talking.

His travels around the world.  How he's a hedge fund manager. 

* I really don't care for that. I'm a no load mutual funds kinda girl *

I read the reply: "maybe Harry Potter brought his magic wand? LOL!"

Ha! I could certainly use it to make this dude disappear!

POOF! 

Bloody brilliant.

Tunnel Top, you still score with the cheap drinks and the great DJ. 

But I could do without the rest of the trimmings. Or maybe I'll just make sure to come back with an army of bodyguards next time!
author: Janice C.

description:
It's a dimly lit bar that has a DJ who plays Motown on Thursdays, a full bar which serves a drink of the day, champagne splits, and I assume beer/wine. The Two Stars are for the two absolute acai and sodas with real blueberries.  Way to up my antioxidants and intoxicants simultaneously.

But beyond that, what's the point? I feel like being able to say that I went here and know how to find it is supposed to make me cool or something. I'm too old for that crap.

They have a very minimalist/rustic theme, which I think has been played out by bars coast-to-coast. I'm tired of feeling like I'm hanging out in a dusty mismatched attic. It just seems like a way for places to keep their start-up costs low. But in this case, it's been here for years. So it's obviously keeping its redecoration costs low. What's the point? I like a dive or a pub once in a while. But there's definitely a point in life where you don't have to "hang" there to prove you have street cred anymore.

Lesly S. said it hardly ever gets too crowded but we went back Saturday night  and the place was full to the gills of "diversity frat boys in tuxedoes"...and let's just keep it at that. There were three of us at a table and unless we all leaned in we couldn't hear each other very well. It was dark, very crowded and very, very loud. After two splits of champagne we left.  

I think people will either love or hate this place. I'm of the latter. Thanks Paul D. and Veruca G.  Sorry Lesly S.

#FYI Ca$h Only
author: Kelly G.

description:
I live only about a block away from this place, see it all the time and I regret not trying this place out sooner. This place is going to be one of my regulars! It's not a huge place, but it definitely has a cool vibe. They used all their empty bottles as decor, even their giant chandelier in the middle is composed out of bottles. They have this loft space that hosts more seats, so they can pack more people in.

Hands down, their Watermelon Gimlet is AMAZing with captial AMAZE! They use fresh watermelon and you have a choice of mixing it with gin or vodka. It was so delicious, I didn't even know there was alcohol in it until it hit me! The crowd is also great, I came here for happy hour with some of my coworkers so there were a lot of young professionals. They were pretty busy during happy hour and I can understand why, I would imagine their late hours are just as busy as well. They have a large projector that displays some video against the wall. I also saw a turntable near the stairs so I assume there's some DJing during weekends?

Great staff, great crowd, great ambiance, and great music. CHEERS!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This is definitely an after work meet up type of bar. I stopped in for DYL a while ago to say hello to some of my old friends. Overall, this is a decent place but the quarters are pretty close. If you don't mind that then, by all means you'll love this place. Also, the upstairs area is pretty cool because you get a pretty awesome view of the city depending on where you are.

The drinks seem to be pretty stiff from what I've heard. I mainly just stuck to non-alcoholic since I was off to another party.

Decent location, when you get to the tunnel on Sutter and Stockton, walk upstairs and you'll find it.
author: Amy J.

description:
What can I write about this place when I was not allowed in? and where is the negative star? .. this place don't even deserve one star

Eek! Methinks not and so do my friends!! Why? Coz I was .. I dont remember as I was bit drunk and the guy who "checkpoints" the ID thought we all were drunk and did not allow us in !! duh.. as if I'm trouble.. I'm so opposite of trouble when it comes to drunken state.. anyway we were not all drunk, except me.. maybe.. waste of time, walking up the stairs to tunnel top after bar hoping.. from now on, we.. me and my friends never ever attempt to check this place even when we are sober.. I'm gonna take a big HOP from tunnel top next time when me and my friends go bar hoping.
author: Hema K.

description:
Every time I've been here... I've gotten wasted.
Not particularly PROUD of that, but just saying, I've always had a hell of a time!

My cousin DJ's at this bar, and I've been here for birthdays and graduation celebrations!

Drinks usually range from $4-$6! But the thing is, Cash only!

It's two stories, and on the second floor, there's a seating area;
Other thing is, you'd have to get there a bit early (depending on day) to swoop on in those seats.

There's space on the second floor to act as a dance floor.

I love this place, but the only thing is, bathrooms.
There's only one bathroom for the females.
And I have a small bladder.

But, coming to this bar, has NEVER failed me! :D
A great time all day, err day, err time. :)
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Dirt cheap and delicious.... that about sums up the drinks served up.
A casual crowd... nothing fancy shmancy about the folks here.

The place is small, two stories. Weekends -the upstairs turns into grind on a girl central. So avoid unless you can score a seat by the DJ or on the couch. Otherwise spend time downstairs chatting with friends.

The DJ turns out some great tunes... different depending on the night of the week you are there. 

A great bar for a chill night if living in the Nob Hill area. 
Oh ya, it's cash only.
author: Kinga H.

description:
It's part trendy and part divey and comes together perfectly. The Tunnel Top. A must stop if you're in the area. It is for us at least. Every year we all end up meeting here; stories will be told and stories will be made. Drinks will be drank and as Barney says it's legend (wait for it) ...... dary. 

This bar is beautiful disorder. The decor screams "Dammit! I'm charming!" The shelves are cluttered with bottles of all shapes, sizes, and colors. Boards with suggestions line the ceiling and while I've never actually read them, tequila, jager, or some form of the cheapest beer will magically make an appearance. 

It's dark, loud, and crowded. There's a beer bottle chandelier; it never gets old and makes for an excellent talking point, no matter how many times you've seen it. There's no shortage of shady corners for intimate moments and the music and dancing keep things lively. Whether you're upstairs or downstairs, you'll have a good time.
author: Alicia K.

description: great location, fun vibes. i went there on a Tuesday night with an old friend, and it was very quiet and personal. we had a great table on the 2nd floor and it was the perfect dive bar experience. the drinks were not the cheapest, but it was a great way to catch up.
author: D E.

description:
Great cocktails.  Good service.  Cash only.

We stopped by this place for a few drinks before a retirement dinner.  This place is awesome!  They have some interesting decor, including a cage with a mannequin in it hanging above everyone.  There is also a projector that projects onto a screen on the wall enclosed in an art frame.  Very nice.  There seemed to be an upstairs section reserved for parties.

The bartender here was great.  Friendly and knew his stuff.  I tried a cocktail with brazilian rum, coconut milk, and nutmeg.  It was amazing!  Someone else we were with had a blueberry mojito that he was pretty happy with.  They had maybe a dozen special cocktails on chalkboards above the bar.

This place is cash only, but there is an ATM inside.

If i'm ever in the area again with some time to kill, I will definitely stop by again!
author: Jon B.

description:
the 20+ people in our party RAIDED the upstairs of Tunnel Top!!! dancing the night away... even on their tables (which we were later told not to do)... 

Tunnel Top was such a great time especially because there's NO COVER unlike other bars/clubs around the area!

I honestly don't remember how the drinks tasted.. but my only complaint is that both the upstairs & downstairs area of TT are really small SO its hard to ROLL DEEP with a large group, but i'm glad we did because TT attracts some older people who creepily stare SO at least we could keep to ourselves

GOOD TIMES =)
author: Jenny S.

description:
Fun chill bar. First time here was for happy hour on a weekday. Second time was this past Saturday for my cousin's birthday. The watermelon drink was tasty and only $6! However, the shots of grey goose were not chilled :( It's a small place but there's 2 floors. Good music and fun dancing!

Reminder: Cash only!
author: Christine C.

description: Stopped in for a quick drink. Sit near the door, because it gets stuffy and hot in the back. They don't run cards for tabs under $20, but they have an atm inside. Cocktails run about $8-$10. Fair price.
author: Quincy R.

description: I had a good Manhattan, and it wasn't too crowded to sit down in on a week night, an epic win by SF standards.  The upstairs seating is the best, and you can even get a little view of the street from up there.
author: Brian K.

description:
I can't believe I've been in this city for years and never been to TT! 

I came here on a Monday with five friends, walked up the tunnel stairs and encountered some crazies. The bar has two floors, dark, very chill, and live music!!! 

We ordered downstairs (cash only) and enjoyed upstairs on a cozy lounge table the portuguese beats to Bossa Nova Mondays and amazing cocktails!

The Coconut, Nutmeg, Rum was a tropical xmas in a cup, Bellini was fancy, Blackberry Mojito was fruity, Dark n Stormy was aight, and the Watermelon Gimlet was refreshing, not that strong, but so delicious! The drinks ranged from $6-$8. I'm definitely going to return to check out Latin Tuesday's or other nights with different DJ's and having more Fresh Watermelon Gimlets. Great for dates, small groups, or a HH companion.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
For me, Yelp is a lot about meeting people, having good conversations, and making new friends. And so it was the case last night as Rene C. and I met for drinks before the Gogobot Launch Event. We talked about family, our work, other Yelpers, and subsequently agreed to meeting for dinner soon with our wives. 

As for Tunnel Top, we sat upstairs before it got crowded and near the window so that we could get a little more light. I happily quaffed my Big Daddy IPA and enjoyed the Dive Bar comfort. This place is also located in a cool area of "Outer Union Square" and I'd love to come back with Friends again.
author: Eric B.

description: Can't get enough of this place! The dj the past Saturday night played the best tunes. I love that it's off Union Square, so it's easy to get to but not packed with tourists.
author: Amanda V.

description: I liked the laid-back divey bar vibe of Tunnel Top. But why does it smell  nasty and why is it cash only?? And was that a real AK47 above the bar?
author: Sunil R.

description: Great bar! We arrived in San Fran and found this bar. Loved the atmosphere, and fantastic vibe. Only criticism was that one bar man did make us feel uncomfortable. Later we asked the bouncer he told us he's name was Nathan. Real shame as it made us hesitant to come back again.
author: Annabelle B.

description: The Tunnel Top was a hidden gem my brother and I found around the hotel we were staying at. The atmosphere was awesome and the drinks were just as good. Must try the watermelon gimlet. Yum!
author: Marissa R.

description: What a classic spot. The bar has a great feel, both downstairs and upstairs, and the folks that work there are always pleasant and patient, including the bouncer. They always come correct with the music -- at least when a DJ is working. What I may appreciate most about Tunnel Top is that it never seems to get overcrowded. What I like least is that it's cash only.
author: Bobby N.

description: Great bar! I was here on a Monday night and it was not over-crowded but pleasantly full. The new owner is really friendly and service was great. Nice selection of music that wasn't too loud, so we were easily able to talk. They now accept credit cards, which is nice. I highly recommend this if you're looking for a casual, laid back place for quality drinks.
author: Marissa K.

description:
3.5 STARS

In an effort to "branch out" from our usual haunts, my friends and I thought we would check out Tunnel Top.

It's in the perfect location; right in the middle of downtown/Union Square area and close to other bars like Bourbon & Branch, Rye, Jones, Swig, Ambassador, Cantina, etc. 

Tunnel Top is on the smaller side and has a bit of a cozy feel. Once you walk in you are literally already waiting in line for a drink, so that should give you an idea of just how small the place is. Getting a drink was fairly easy, though!

Drinks were decently priced and I loved that they used fresh ingredients for their specialty drinks. I ordered a regular mojito; just the right amount of sweetness and bitterness, really refreshing ($9). My friend had the strawberry mojito and she loved it!

Music was good - mostly hip-hop and some top 40. Everyone was dancing and having a good time. Crowd was pretty mixed too - lots of late 20-somethings and some early to mid-30s. There were definitely some creepy crawlers, lots of Europeans and it definitely attracts tourists and the B&T crowd. 

Overall, I would come back here - their mojitos are reason enough!

*CASH ONLY!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I love this place and everyone I take there seems to enjoy it as well.  

My favorite is the strawberry bellini. 

Cash only. Discover your thirst quenching favorite!
author: Ali B.

description:
such high expectations for tunnel top, but they all fell through!  i came with a big group of my friends, which will usually do the job for me in terms of having a lot of fun.  we even pregamed!

but... no.  the bar itself was a cool divey place, the music was awesome (booty rap!), and there was room for a dance floor, but no one was dancing.  we tried to start stir up the bar a bit, but no one seemed to be feeling it.

reading more review; it seems to be more of a friday night place, which is typical for bars in downtown / soma / fidi because people go right after work.  that's probably true - just don't come on a saturday night like i did!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Wasn't as tasty has I hoped, but was still worth the price. The portions was good and the service was good.  I'm gonna try something else next time.
author: Biggg J.

description: So, no food, but way a great little semi dive bar.... no unruly people, nice bartenders, bouncer who cleans up after everyone.... loud music (but good music), jumping spot with good beers on tap (not the regular crap).... This is my new favorite bar in S.F.
author: Mark K.

description: I love the music there!! Great location and we love the upstairs space, next door a cute yummy food..
author: Keri A.

description:
This is seriously one of my favorite bars in the city! Although it is a bit divey, drinks are reasonably priced and Justin (the Saturday night DJ) keeps the party going with the best hip hop, spinning the latest and greatest along with classics that seem to never grow old. Unlike some DJ's I've run into, he is sooo approachable and ALWAYS takes ALL of my requests. So try him out and I bet he'll be more than accommodating (as long as it ain't wack, haha!). 

I typically go here on Saturday nights with the intention of "warming-up" the evening; however, I usually end up staying the entire night, ALWAYS leaving with a good buzz and having danced my ass off.  I won't delve too deeply into the layout of the establishment or neighborhood proximity given all the specs within the preceding reviews, but just know that the Tunnel Top is an easy stop if you happen to be visiting the area.

Pros:

- The music! 

Justin always comes correct and caters to the crowd (but like I said before, as long as it ain't wack!).

- The location and proximity to surrounding neighborhoods. 

Chinatown, Union Square, and the Financial District (to name a few) are an easy skip, hop, or jump. :) Always a plus when visiting The City.

Cons:

- Bathrooms 

They definitely could be cleaner. I've seen much, much worse; but then again, they're far from the best.

- Floor Space. 

Although it is a 2-story building, the place gets easily packed given the lack of floor space. It doesn't take too many patrons to crowd this place. Oh if I only had that much more room to hit my Bernie (haha!)...

Overall, this place has captured a special place in my heart and I'll definitely keep coming back! Whether it be to simply kick-off the evening or to spend it here entirely, the Tunnel Top will not disappoint.
author: Mike G.

description:
I didn't think I would love a dive bar,,,,but here it is!!

Just remember to bring enough cash!
author: Cali G.

description: It's become a tradition now everytime I'm in San Francisco to stop by this place for a few Anchor Steams. Not really sure why. It's hot, the bar stinks and the bartenders are usually jerks. But I love it.
author: Eric S.

description: Comfortable and fun bar that reminded me of the bars I frequent in my home city of Providence, RI. Unpretentious, great beer and lovely atmosphere. Love the option of the lively downstairs bar area or cozying up in the lofted open second floor that looks over the downstairs, where there's couches and pillows. We went on a night with a DJ playing an awesome mix of soul classics and 90s hip hop with a projection of videos on the wall to go with. I could have stayed longer if it weren't for all the bar hopping we did to try and conquer the city in the less than 48 hours we had there. Luckily Tunnel Top was conveniently located across from the hotel!
author: Caitlin T.

description: Cold beer, loud music, and low prices. What's not too love? If the music's too loud, maybe you're just too old. This place has a great location and prices that will keep you coming back.
author: James M.

description: For the guy who was asking about non-alcoholic beer: per San Francisco ordinance, they only serve water on request.
author: Gabriel S.

description: A great place, walking distance to Union Square. Good, old school atmosphere and good music. This was a favorite place when I lived in the city.
author: Michael B.

description: Small little Bar, I cant believe it has 2 floors for how small it is. Simple and dark. Bartenders are really fast with orders. Place can easily get packed fast. Despite the size people can get confused because of the bar facing the entrance and everyone trying to get drinks. CASH ONLY... ATM inside. Love the beer bottle Chandelier. Chill little place.
author: Diego V.

description:
Great service, both the doorman/ security guy and the bartender were very nice. Even on a busy night with only one bartender working the entire place, the drinks came out at a decent pace. 

But just so you know... this place is cash only. And the night I was there the ATM was out of cash! But if this happens there are other bars around that also have an ATM.
author: Shannon H.

description:
So we went here because of a comment/review that I read that someone else left.  This is a dive bar and the drinks are good.  Pretty strong!  Friday nights are PACKED..  so you better get there before 5pm else you won't have a seat at the bar. 

The upstairs is nothing to mention, maybe I missed a secret door or something?
author: Rob W.

description: I went here to watch the Warriors game because the Golden Gate pub around the corner was too crowded. It was a chill spot to watch the game. I think there were good drinks but I didn't drink, so perhaps my review isn't particularly valuable! Seems like a solid spot to meet up, socialize, and maybe take a date. There's some space on the second level so long as it isn't roped off.
author: Lucky B.

description:
Tunnel Top is a non-touristy gem of a bar in Union Square. Come for the cool bartenders, amazing drinks, and just locals having a good time. 
 
It's nice to find a bar in the area that isn't too touristy. It's also an easy bar to direct out-of-town friends to... "Go up Stockton from Union Square till you hit the tunnel. Then look up."

The bartenders here are awesome and they make really good drinks. I really like their refreshing watermelon mojito. The happy hour is a dollar off drinks - beers on tap (Boont Amber, Hoegaarden, Guinness, Trumer pilsner... ummm maybe more) are $3 then. 

But perhaps the best thing about the Tunnel Top are the cool bartenders who manage the crowds. On this one occasion, my friend and I were sitting at the bar when it started to get packed. My friend left to use the restroom and there were folks trying to order drinks from behind her seat when she got back. The bartender told the folks to make way for my friend in order to be served. How awesome is that?

Come to the Tunnel Top if you're looking for a great happy hour spot in the neighborhood. Great bartenders, drinks, and crowd almost always guarantee a good time.
author: Jon L.

description: Liked this bar, about 5 blocks from the Bart station. Drinks aren't bad, although they are cash only!
author: Tiffany M.

description: The after party was brought to Tunnel Top and how appropriate with it's small dance party on the second floor and super divey bar on the first. It's close quarters but it's one of those bars where you can have a good time and not be worried about what anyone thinks! It's loud, it's crowded, and i'm pretty sure a pair dancing very intimately near my friends and i were starting to take off their clothes. Gah. That was my cue to check out the bar. I like their chalkboards with their current drink specials. It was hard to get a bartenders attention but they're going as fast as they can. The lights are dimmed low and the music is pumping so a few drinks will put you in a good place.
author: Samantha L.

description: So it's my 4th time coming here on Mondays, place looks cool, not overly crowded, and very warm.. I work around the corner so it's a nice place to wind down.. Thanks blode bartender for making my co-workers and I feel welcomed...  Much better place than Last Drop!
author: T S.

description:
I came in yesterday night with a few guys I meet here in town while traveling in the city.
After searching on Yelp for a nice place close to our location we end up in Tunnel top.
The music was OK ( not my cup of tea but after a few drinks everything is different )  the sound was terrible all night.
Because it was the last night of one of the buddy's from TX I ordered the drinks for everyone ( they were such cool people and I felt that's the list I can do to thanks them for there time in SF).
As a tourist myself I didn't know that the place closes at 02:00 AM 
At 1:52 I ordered $60 worth of drinks thinking I can drink them in with no problems after three minutes the doorman came up in a in a very brutal way asking us to finish the drinks and to be out of the place within a 5 minutes I told them that I just now ordered the drinks and we will drink them as fast as we can but in my opinion the bartender shouldn't of taken the order from us or at list let me know i should be out by 2 AM before spending the money.
The doorman told me
 " you  have three minutes to get the f... out of here" , 
I told him that's not the way to talk to a client , when he heard that he grabbed all of our drinks that were completely full and threw us out of his place in a very embarrassing way after I spent A few hundred dollars total .
I was shocked by his behavior because we didn't do anything wrong I told him nicely  and respectfully my opinion  , we were not noisy and definitely not causing any problems.
I truly don't recommend , they should be ashamed of them self .
author: David H.

description:
I friggin love this bar. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the fact that's it is cash only. Which, I know, is not uncommon in SF. But, it's still annoying.

I've been there a few times, and each time it's been one bartender. But man, the dude can make drinks quick -and more importantly, DAMN TASTY. It's hard not to dance around on the menu and try different things to see how he makes them.

I'll be going back to this bar again and again. The location is kind of fun to walk to as well, check it out!
author: Marit S.

description:
(TRUE STORY)

A close friend, who resides in SF, took my girlfriends and I to Tunnel Top. 
I thought 'great.. just another typical hole-in-the-wall bar' as we approached the front door, but as we walked in.. the place was bumping with Hip Hop beats, everyone was dancing upstairs. I walked to the bar with my friend and I instantly felt as if I was part of a Vodka commercial (attractive people huggin' the bar).. and to add 'the cherry on top' there happen to be a group of young guys, on a sales trip from San Diego! *TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE*

The 2nd floor is crowded but worth every toe-steppin', drink spilling, dancing-in-place second!
author: Cindy M.

description:
When I first went into this place, it honestly looked a bit small and dirty.  And, to be fair, it can be a bit crowded and hot inside, but it really wasn't so bad.  It took a bit of work to get the bartenders' attention, and they definitely took their time making the drinks, but the prices weren't too bad (it came out to about $6/drink).  The drinks were delicous btw... we tried the watermelon gimlet and some blackberry drink, and both tasted like they were pretty much juice.  
I didn't get a chance to stay long, but I enjoyed stopping there briefly.

Overall: If you don't like 'dive bars' then you probably won't enjoy yourself here, but cheap drinks and a fairly busy atmosphere made this a fun stop.
author: Keith C.

description: What a unique bar that my boyfriend introduced me to.  Literally on top of a tunnel - great views of Union Square and the city below.  The fresh watermelon gimlet was refreshing and delicious.  Fairly nice staff, seemingly older post-work crowd, nice vibe overall.  Will definitely check out again soon!
author: Angela R.

description: This place is amazing so good!!!! Christian is the best so helpful make sure to ask for him!
author: Krystal M.

description:
What happened to my favorite bar?

The staircase and entire upstairs had the overwhelming smell of a urinal.  So disgusting!  

Walked in and then headed right back out (trying not to touch anything on my way down).

Sad.  I did really love this place.
author: Joanne G.

description: Eh, I guess I don't see the appeal. Typical bar, bar tender seemed annoyed I wanted to order a drink. And the kicker is - cash only!
author: Steve T.

description:
I was really impressed by this place.  The bar is two stories, so you can look down from the second floor.  It almost feels like the bar is off-axis, which is a cool feeling.

The music was absolutely incredible, playing a mix of samba-type latin music.

Well drinks were $5, which is perfectly acceptable.  The bartenders seemed friendly and willing to chat when they weren't tending to other patrons.  Next time I'm in the area I think I'll be stopping by  for a drink or three.
author: Dave S.

description:
Two words: SH*T SHOW!!!!

I don't know what it is, but every time I come to TT, I have a hootin' ass time.  Maybe it's the extra strong drinks (my drink of choice would be the greyhound with goose splash of lime, thank you very much).  The bartenders are so great...the music is poppin'...by 11pm or so, my drunk ass is shaking what my mama gave me.  

The peeps are always really chill, last time I came here was for a bday party and had a blast.   Oh, but for whatever reason, I always get lost finding this place.  I literally circle that block over and over again, until I realize, "idiot, you just passed it on the right side for the 11th time!"  Whoops.  

Oh, the bouncer is really friendly too.  Bouncers never get a "shout-out" so I'll be the first.  "You do an amazing job at checking ID!"
author: Soo Jin K.

description:
Best Happy Hour in SF. What bar will have HH from daily from 4:30pm-8pm? $1 off all beers. Draft are $3 and bottles at $2.75! WTF?!? Yes, I work until 6pm and can't get anywhere until 7pm. So yes, HH until 8pm is awesome!

Bar is literally on top of the tunnel. I know. I made that one up myself. Small space downstairs w/ an upstairs area. Perfect for an after work drink. I can't imagine what its like on the weekends with the DJ spinning. I hear there isn't any cover. Even better to check out sometime!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Last time I was here a well-hydrated young lady walked up to my friend and I to ask if she could borrow a dollar.  After we declined, she lunged at my friend's drink and started to inhale his vodka.  

5 Stars for the look on his face when that happened.  Minus 1 Star for the guy who grabbed my girlfriend's butt and ran-off.
author: Andy K.

description:
Love this watering hole. The drinks are delicious, service is good, and happy hour prices are great. The watermelon gimlet is so refreshing and even has mashed watermelon at the bottom. The blackberry mojito is also yummy. The atmosphere and decor is pretty cool. I love the vodka bottles chandelier and the random graffiti in the bathroom. 

My only qualms about this place are that it's very, very dark - making it not date-friendly (at least not for a 1st or 2nd date) and that it's cash only. I'd definitely be back often, though, since it's on my way home from work.
author: Lin C.

description:
love this place. sometimes it's hard to catch the bartender, but drinks are always pretty good. cash only isn't a problem for me, but i know some people get bugged by it. i love the dj on saturday nights!! he's my favorite!!! upstairs is a bit tight for dancing but i don't care about that either. it's just a great, easy place to come and get dancing! 

woot for dj tinone!!!!
author: Nancy H.

description:
Fun bar, the DJ on Friday is better than the others.  Great place, good drinks, usually a pretty fun crowd-make sure you bring cash...no plastic here....

About as opposite as you can get from the crap that you get in the Marina.....shhhh, don't tell that crowd!!
author: Gee W.

description: I really like this quirky bar. Good drinks, good space, its pretty much a low key saloon, but more fun.
author: Emily D.

description:
Oh. I get it. It's on top of the tunnel. How clever.

This place is ghetto and cash only (and it looks like the ATM has been out of service forever). The bartender is nice, the shots are stiff, and there are movies playing on a big screen mounted on the wall between the main level and the mezzanine. The bar, in general, smells like toilet... but that could be due to the fact that I was seated right at the top of the stairs probably right above the bathroom. Still, it was a bad smell.

This is definitely a spot for professional drinkers. Small, dirty, cheap. When I turn pro, if I am living somewhere nearby in the City, you may just see this review jump to 4 or 5. Until then, I'll stop in for a quick one if, say, I'm standing out front and I'm thirsty and I happen to have some cash, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way. 

Hint: there's an ATM across the street at the laundromat that gives out $10 bills.
author: Don B.

description:
I want to like this place so badly! SO BADLY. The location is awesome, and despite its placement in the heart of tourist territory it seemed to be filled with locals. The setup is also pretty great--not enough floor space to induce dancing, but just enough to be able to navigate. Plus, you've got the option of being able to hang out upstairs or downstairs, in case you're in the mood for a scenery change at any point during your time here. Convenient.

But I'm docking two whole stars for the MASSIVE HEADACHE incurred here. The music was beyond too loud. It was inescapable. I blame the fact that it was a Saturday night, and blaring music seems to be the requirement at any late-night establishment, regardless of the presence of a dance floor. Whatever. I enjoyed hearing "I'm On A Boat" at volume 11 just like everyone else, but I really just wanted to talk to my friends. I'll be back on a weeknight when I can hear myself think.
author: Stefanie L.

description: It took me 5 years to build up the courage to go in this dive, and I totally regret not making this a regular stomping ground. Burritt Room and Tunnel top are the two bars that locals must visit near union square.
author: Danny B.

description: Been here a couple times and became friend of the owner. Very friendly and cozy place to be after a long day's work.
author: Andy D.

description:
Still ok to come up here on a night out hitting the bars, but when you've hit some of the other places around the neighborhood and come in here ... you do feel it takes a step down.  That's not a knock so much as acknowledging the other places just have more going on.

Overall though, the selections here are just ok.  If you're looking for something out of the ordinary, you won't really find it here.  But tried and true basics are always a good thing in my mind and the Tunnel Top delivers.

The space downstairs is pretty tight on a busy night, but everyone seems to manage.  Upstairs has more flexibility with tables and rails.  Good atmosphere and vibe from my visits.

The bartenders do a decent job of it as well and I've rarely had to wait too long for my drink.

All in all, a good little bar that doesn't try to pretend being what it's not.  Recommended.
author: Patrick K.

description: This is a cool little place.  Friendly bartender.  Great Happy Hour prices.  Next time I'm in the area I will definitely return to this bar.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Great happy hour... 4:30-8:00... great location... walking distance from North Beach and the Financial, and an easy scoot from SOMA. They have a downstairs bar and an upstairs sitting area/loft, which is always appealing to me. The name is suiting, as it's right on top of the tunnel.

Mixed crowd, easy to get to, cheap drinks. Cash only!

This was one of the first spots I came to when moving to SF in 2008, and I barely remembered how to get here. I was quickly reminded as I took the 1BX to work and passed it every single day. You can arrive by foot, bus, or tunnel... though I don't recommend tunnel.
author: Kristin F.

description: Being from the city, this is my favorite bar. It's always been my go to. It's Cash Only so remember to bring cash, if you don't they do have an ATM. No Cover. Drinks are regular price. (try their Gimlet it's delicious). It does get very crowded on weekends but i personally don't mind it, they have good music so i like to move. I also like Monday nights; they have a Bossa Nova band playing upstairs. Ambiance is great and so is the crowd. Parking is never an issue either. Furthest I've had to walk was a block.
author: Liliana M.

description: Great lighting, great drinks, great music, friendly bartenders, overall good experience.  Women's bathroom looks like some sort of strange witches' den with creepy decor and red lighting but that was actually kinda cool.  Very yuppie crowd.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Good, chilled bar with a decent beer selection and a good bartender, who did a good job of managing the whole bar by himself.

Good place for after work drinks
author: Ben C.

description:
If you are looking for a chill bar to grab a couple of alcoholic beverages, Tunnel Top is freaking it. The location is perfect (on top of the tunnel downtown) and the fact that you can either chill at the bar or go upstairs and get your lounge on with a group, is a definite plus. 

The atmosphere took a little to get used to because it's really dark with just a bit of red lighting, but once your eyes adjust, it's actually pretty cool. The bartender was also really cool (and attractive) and the people at the bar were mad chill (meaning that they weren't loud and crazy). I definitely will stop by this spot next time I go to San Fran. Boom!
author: Aaron N.

description: Fun bar, diverse crowd, DJ plying mostly hiphop on Fridays. Bring cash with you, although they ave an ATM macine inside.  Some couches and tables on the second floor for lounging with your friends. There is really no dance floor, so part of the second floor becomes the dance floor.  Cool look bottles of chandelier. Might check this place out again if  I'm in the area.
author: Claudine V.

description: Good place -  if you're coming to this place for the first time, it's above the tunnel not below. Good prices for a bar, typical dive bar stuff, plays hip-hop music primarily. 2 floors but crowded nonetheless. Their specialty drinks aren't that great. Got 2 long islands, one was way stronger than the other. Blackberry mojito was disgusting. I'd still give it four stars though, my only gripes are their own drinks and how crowded the place gets. I got a drink spilled on my back, wasn't particularly happy about that.. the guy offered to clean my back but that would've been awkward.
author: Ryan L.

description: Absolutely loved the Tunnel Top! Was visiting from L.A. when my friend took me to the Tunnel Top for a late night cocktail on a Monday night. They had a live acoustic Bosa Nova band performing upstairs, and they were fantastic. You can't find places like this in L.A. The ambience was perfect. I will definitely come back on my next trip to S.F.
author: Charlene G.

description:
Found myself here at the end of a two bar "bar crawl" with Boyfriend and his mother (kinda strange, but the woman can drink me under the table any day of the week). The vibe of this place yelled "dive" to me, but everyone here was pretty friendly -- and at least polite if nothing else. Cash only, too, so make sure you grab some from any of the nearby ATMs before walking in. They seemed to have only mojitos on the night that I was here, which sucks because I'm not a mojito fan. Something about the mint.

But I got a strawberry mojito anyway and after we all got our drinks, we moved upstairs to a seat along the wall at some bar stools. It's a pretty neat little spot if you get there early enough where you're still able to chill before the live DJ starts up. One of the groups over by the big couches cleared out, so we were also able to snag their spots and ended up just nursing our drinks and chatting. The DJ was supposed to start before we left, but he was still setting up when we left about an hour later.

Overall, a nice place. Not necessarily my bar of choice, but I wouldn't mind going again with a group of people. And if they had something other than mojitos on the menu.
author: Anna W.

description: Great local bar, good vibes, not pretentious.  Worth checking out!
author: Mel G.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SF.  Drinks are good, vibe is good, times are good...

Like the DJs too.
author: Simon S.

description:
Not a bad place to spend an evening.  Went there tonight, and the DJ was playing non-offensive music from the 90s and 00s.  Service at the bar was a little slow, but after you first drink, you tend not to mind so much.

PRO:
- Unpretentious, no dress code
- Upstairs lounge isn't as hot as you might think it would be
- Decent music, not too crowded
- No cover charge
- Walking distance from Union Square

CON:
- Slow bar service

TIP:
- Cash only bar, and the ATM is not always reliable
author: Drew P.

description:
I really like this place. It is not pretentious, a little divey (but not as divey as Chelsea Place next door) and it has a good mix of locals and tourists. I love sitting at the bar during happy hour. All beers are $1 off. Cocktails, shots and wine are all reasonably priced.

Two cons
Front door is always closed, whats up with that? 
Only one bathroom, the line can be kinda long
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Cheap drinks overall. $6 Jameson ($5 during happy hour). Most beers are also discounted by $1 -- but not the Big Daddy IPA. *sniffle*

Live Bossa Nova band every Monday night! *swoon* And they indulged my request to play Girl from Ipanema without rolling their eyes. Thanks! :)

But yeah -- overall solid establishment. This will definitely be my go to place on Monday nights.
author: Edward Y.

description:
Tunnel Top!  TT TT TT!  ::tee hee::  Now that that immaturity is out of the way, onto the review...

I came here with my  Two-Drink-Min lady friend to pre-party before Happy Hour - yes, that's how we roll.  $6 mojitos and $5 Jameson shots at Happy Hour.  Its says something about the quality of our pre-party drinks when we didn't have a drink at the other Happy Hour.  We'll definitely need to come back when the DJ is spinning.

The best seats in the house are the pair of two-person tables upstairs - views of Bush street from the big windows and overlooking the downstairs.  It's a great corner for some privacy or some exhibitionism.
author: Kevin W.

description:
My friends and I have fallen in love with this bar.  Literally located on top of the Stockton Street Tunnel, Tunnel Top is a gem of a bar with no cover, cheap drinks (cash only), and good music.  It's a pretty tight space, including balcony upstairs but it manages to pack a good number of people inside.  If you can get in early, or hover long enough, there are some couches upstairs that make a good perch for large groups.  

I really like the chandelier that hangs in the middle of the bar that is made up of over one hundred empty bottles of booze and illuminated from within.  It's a really cool looking piece!
author: Nick D.

description: Small dive bar with a cool vibe and great music.  They have all your drink fixins.  I love the top balcony area where you can drink and observe the commotion down below.  The top is a great spot to lay low and just people watch or hold a conversation with a small group.
author: Terence N.

description:
A great bar with a cool vibe. The drinks are a tad steep, but they're also a tad strong. So in my opinion it's good! The DJ did kind of suck this night, but the DJ setup and sound system was good. So just change DJs! hehe

I can't say enough good things about the space. It has large areas where you can sit as a huge group and have a good time. While at the same time, it has little two seater tables in dark corners where you can be intimate and romantic. It starts out quiet, and the night ends loud. So it's a pretty diverse environment. I dig it.
author: Brandon W.

description:
I think the lame bartender from last night ruined my experience here. Elease and I were ready for a real drink after Dine About Town dinner at the Fifth Floor  and made our way to the Tunnel Top. 

The bar was packed downstairs and then the crowd quickly left 10 minutes after we were seated. At that point the bar was pretty dead with maybe 4 other people. Our bartender was not only non-attentive but she took about 10 minutes to actually acknowlege us, then another 10 to take our order, another 10 minutes to collect our cash as we waited to leave this place. The best part about all of this was that they didnt have the watermelon gimlet I wanted to try, so I asked the bartender is she had a substitution/alternative reccomendation. She said no at first then thought about it and said raspberry might work so I went with that. 

I think the place is chill, good prices but the service is definately lacking. I wont base it off one bartender but yea she did it for me.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Taken here by a friend and now it's my go to spot for drinks. The drinks here can be hit and miss depending on how busy it gets: or maybe it's just me wanting more alcohol in them :) But if you're looking for a "divey" bar with good music and an upbeat atmosphere Tunnel Top is definitely worth checking out. Personally this is more of a place to get your first drinks of the evening in rather than somewhere you can sit and drink all night.
author: Seiji S.

description:
"Can I have a Sex On The Beach please?"- Me

"Sure, (Making Drink) That'll be $6"- Cool Bartender Lady

"$6?! Really?! Hell, I'll take two then!"- Me

"(Laughs) Well in that case it'll be $11"- Cool Bartender Lady

"Alright!!!" -Me

I had stopped in Tunnel Top before, but my friends didn't want to stay the last time we came, so we had left early. If I had known the drinks were decently priced, they played some good music and the crowd was cool I would've stayed the last time! My roommate and I had a good time. I will be returning! 

There was some annoying drunk chick that kept touching my afro. She was quite annoying. I had to bring my alter-ego, Mz. Thang, out to get her to stop! But, that wasn't T.T's fault! GO, you'll have good times. Just watch out for drunk chick's putting their hands in your hair.
author: Lauren H.

description:
The subject of my looks comes up a lot. And this is never a positive experience. Once again it happened. "I am going to rate your looks on a scale of 1 to 10" 

Oh Crap.

She points and says, "now I have been drinking and I always tell the truth when I am drunk"

Oh Double Crap.

"youuuuuuuuuuu are a 7"

Wait? What?! Did she just give me a 7? Holy Mother of God I just achieved average! woo hoo! Best Night Ever!

But there's more!

"youuuuu know, you are more like a 7.5"

WHA!!?????

7 1/2? SERIOUS?!! 7.5 MEANS I CAN HANG OUT WITH AN 8 AND NOT LOOK OUT OF PLACE!  I'm a little above average! AWESOME!!

"but, I can't see straight so once I sober up I know you will be back down to a 5..........tops"

True store.

Tunnel Top is not one of my regular haunts, but it should be. I love this bar and they stock one of my favorite piscos! The bar is warm and inviting has an extended happy hour. Bring cash as they don't take credit cards, but you won't need much. If you are on a date, there is seating upstairs with seating along the widow giving you a view of beautiful Bush street.
author: V B.

description: One of my favorite dive bars in this part of town. I'm a big fan of their cocktails that has fruit in it.
author: Damoon M.

description:
Vacation cabin setting+nice and cozy ambiance+amazing drinks+peanuts raisins snack mix+the most charming bartender!!!!

They use fresh fruits in all the fruity drinks, it smells wonderful sitting at the bar when our bartender, Jean-michel, was making drinks. He's super nice and makes amazing drinks. 

You HAVE to get the strawberry mojito was delicious, tons of freshly crushed strawberries! Really easy to drink, just the perfect ratio of sweetness to minty-ness, SO GOOD. They also have watermelon gimlet with fresh watermelon (which smelled amazing too).

I'll be back for more delicious drinks!
author: Erica L.

description:
Go to an ATM first, folks, because its a cash only bar--and you're going to want to go here.

After the *meh* of Irish Bank for DYL, half of us decided to head over to Tunnel Top to finish off the night (I wasn't about to walk all the way over to Haight for Matt's bday continuation party!). 

I huffed and puffed my way up whatever street its on (shutup--I smoke when I drink), had another cigarette outside, despite rumours that you could smoke upstairs, and walked in. 

Cozy, and a teeeennsssyy bit cramped was the first thing that came into my head. I wanted to go upstairs so I begged someone to buy me a drink (and by beg I mean I batted my eyelashes and asked in a sweet, soft voice) and left to the top. It was standing room for a moment, and then a large group next to ours left and guess who snagged it! Woooo!!! We had a place to put our stuff AND set our beers down to dance! Oh--here it comes--the reason why I gave this place five stars.

Their DJ was OFF THE HOOK. I've heard a crapload of DJ's in my short lifetime, and by far he is the best one I have ever encountered. There was this unbelievable transitioning between songs that only the master himself could do--from the stones to snoop then back to some 90's rock band--VERY hard thing to do. But he pulled it off beautifully, which is good because Drunk Jaime likes to dance. Alot. So does, apparently, Drunk Chris and Drunk Matt H's friend, which was also good because next-morning-sober-Jaime remembers the night before and would feel embarrassed if she was alone. By the end of the night, the DJ played "Jump Around" (or whatever the name of it is), and quite literally--we jumped. I'm surprised they didn't kick us out from all that damn noise, but hey! There was just so much fun to be had!

When a few of us decided to leave, one random person not from our group pulled Chris aside and said "You guy's can't leave--you're the life of the party!"

And Tunnel Top let us be that. HOOORRRAAAYYYY! I am SO going back!
author: Jaime L.

description:
This place kicks ass. It just does. 

1) No cover
2) Kick-ass music all week long
3) Great decor
4) Close to union square

They always have great dj's who mix it up with everything from latin music to hip hop. If you go you will see the music list for the week. 

I wish they had a website with the schedule posted. 

I always have a great time when I go here. The upstairs dance area isn't that big, but it's large enough for you and your crew if you decide to roll 15 deep.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Have you ever wondered what would happen if a Yuppy Bar and cool, down-and-dirty Dive Bar had a night of crazy, drunken hotel sex and one came pregnant from the tryst? Well boys and girls, we now have the answer - Tunnel Top. It has the grit of great Dive Bar but it's wearing the alluring scent of an upscale Yuppy hang-out. Whatever...it works! 

You have to love the touches, the upstairs with the leather couches, the artsy bottle chandelier and the PBR. Aren't those contrasts great? If you haven't been to Tunnel Top it definitely should be on your list...they have a great tequila selection for the die-hards, PBR for the lushes and a nice Rioja for the refined. Try it, you'll like it...
author: Todd E.

description:
I had a lot of fun here.
It was a random Wednesday night and we found ourselves upstairs drinking.  Some random people befriended our group and went from chilling on the couches to dancing on the tables (not really recommended since the tables seem wobbly)

They were playing some oldies -- white people funk or something.  Which means not being able to dance and flailing actually works FOR you here.

My dark & stormy was tasty and strong.
That's all I ordered though.
Oh, and their bathroom was relatively clean surprisingly!
author: Van W.

description:
Love the wine bottle chandelier and the unexpected window behind the bar.

While I've heard the mojitos are great, the vibe of this corner pub just puts me in the mood for a pint of beer. I love the down tempo feel and the (presumably) unintentional mood lighting. Perfect for an after-work drink with someone you're sweet on.

UPDATE 9/19/2006:
Do NOT miss the watermelon martinis currently on offer at the Tunnel Top. Positively delicious and not likely to be around long. . .
author: Miriam W.

description:
What a perfect name for the location. They were playing some dope reggae & dancehall mashups when I was here last Friday. The first thing I noticed was the red chandeliere made of bottles, which I couldn't stop staring at the whole night (I'm a sucker for unique lighting fixtures). I spent about $13 for 2 cocktails, which was so much easier on my wallet, considering the $10 small gin/tonic that I paid for @ Ruby Sky on the previous weekend.

Im glad we stopped in, im gonna remember to come back when I'm in the area again.
author: Tricia A.

description:
Went to Tunnel Top with 3 friends. Downstairs was crazy-packed! Upstairs there's a little more room, with couches, but it's still really small. I really like how open it is, you can see all of the downstairs area when you're upstairs. If you want to dance, head upstairs and hang out with the DJ who's squeezed into a little corner haha. 

What I really like is the location! My friend lives 1.5 blocks from this place so getting there and back was a breeze! 

If you like watermelon, you will LOVE the watermelon gimlet! I'm allergic to watermelon sometimes, but I eat it anyway (oops) and this was delicious! i kinda wish they gave you a bigger straw to get some of the actual watermelon bits, but oh well! it's still damn delicious! the pomegranate cosmo was also really tasty! 

Overall, I really like this place. The bottle chandelier in the middle of the place is awesome! Will come here over and over and over again! 

CASH ONLY!!!! This was the only bummer. 

P.S. if you're a girl, make sure you go to the bathroom. LOL unfortunately i didn't see any chalk when i was there...
author: Christine B.

description: A hidden gem.  Great happy hour, can get a bit crowded, but what great place doesn't. Also one of the best happy hour deals in the union square area.  worth the climb up the stairs (burn off 1/4 of one of those pints maybe)
author: Mike V.

description:
still... the best mojitos in SF.

But bring your cash, and lots of it. Once it touches your lips....
author: Brent A.

description:
Ended up here randomly on a bar hopping Friday night. It was quite the adventure to find this place too since we didn't really know where we were going. All we had to do was walk through some abandoned looking streets to get to the mouth of some random tunnel I never knew existed and then up these jenky stairs where I thought some homeless man would pop out of no where around the corner to surprise us. Easy, right?

Anyway, I was so glad when we got here because there was a decent crowd inside with some good music playing from the DJ and a nice sitting area on the second floor (which is also a dance floor, but no one dancing).

I got the watermelon gimlet - fresh watermelon mashed with some freshly-squeeze lemon and gin. Flavor was GREAT, but there were chunks of watermelon that were just too large and should've been strained out. But, it was only $6 for that cocktail, so it's not too bad. 

My friends and I sat upstairs by the balcony where we could oversee the entire downstairs crowd. The chandelier was pretty cool - a bunch of old beer bottles lined up in the form of  a chandelier - pretty unique and chic. 

Overall, pretty cool place. I'd come back here.
author: Julia K.

description:
I love this place !

The week, live concert and cosy atmosphere, and the week end, DJ and clubby atmosphere.

Every bar tender are really friendly and so efficient when it s full !

By the way, the straberry mojito is wonderful...

Definetly, I ll continue to go in the Tunnel Top !!
author: Morgane T.

description:
I've been here twice, but I don't remember the first time I went.  They were pretty quick with the drinks (I hate waiting for a bartender as they try to keep their eyes averted from you).

They also let you smoke upstairs.  Oh, and I didn't feel too young, old, hip or dorky here.  You won't either.  muah.
author: Karen F.

description:
If you like a good old fashioned dive bar, you'll be comfortable here in no time. Walking distance from the financial district, Union Square and the like, it's just the escape you may be needing from tourists, crazy shoppers and trend-seekers.

Get your favorite beer/cocktail and head upstairs if you want something extra cozy. There's a lounge area and a few tables by the window, overlooking the street. It's a great place to unwind and have a conversation. On a cold day, all the better.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I love the people who come to this place as the bottles frame my favorite bartenders Brian and Libby with the Green Door lighting further in the backdrop.  
I am also in the service industry and Brian and Libby keep a tight ship and are as welcoming as you will allow them to be for you.
author: D B.

description:
Avery's right, it's a pseudo-dive bar...any bar that has a water-melon martini is totally not allowed to be a dive-bar. There are rules.
But still...chill atmosphere, nice bartenders, good music and my favorite sexy low-lighting. This is a great place for an after-work drink...or twelve.
author: Nikki M.

description:
What a random surprise near Union Square!  After suffering through hours of shopping last night among hoards looking for last minute gifts, I ascended the Stockton tunnel steps in an attempt to escape the madness and find a decent drink to put me back in the holiday spirit.  I would have walked right by this place if it hadn't been for Yelp.  From the outside, a smashed, poorly lit, unreadable sign was the only evidence of its existence as even the windows are covered with blinds, creating a disguise from the Union Square weekend revelers in search of the glitzy nightclub or trendy bar.

I was fully expecting a dive bar atmosphere, but was met instead with a softly lit, refined ambience that had the feel of a cozy lounge than a gritty dive bar.  Live music filled the air from upstairs and the crowd had a very local, neighborhood vibe despite being near SF's tourist and shopping ground zero. No cover charge. No pretention.  Some were there to listen to the music, others were there to relax, others there to imbibe and socialize.  It's one of those bars that pulls off being something to everyone.

The best part, however, were the excellent speciality cocktails at very reasonable prices.  $7 for a Martini in SF near Union Square?  On top of that, the beer selection was one of the most eclectic I've seen in SF as it heavily leaned toward Belgian craft brews and styles.  The toughest part of the experience here was deciding between a pint of Belgian beer and a unique house cocktail.  Oh well, I guess I'll have to return again soon.
author: Mike B.

description:
Walking by this place, I always thought it was just another dive bar, a la Summer Place or Mr. Bing's.  I was so wrong!  Once you pass the heavy wooden doors, you step into a very cute, cozy bar with quirky character.  Very nice rotation of music, complete with dj set up behind old fashioned cabinets tucked away on the upstairs balcony.  

Cute two-tops by the window, or along the exposed brick wall.  Couches and sofas to lounge on, or if it gets too crowded to sit, a handy rail with an indentation deep enough to rest your drink safely.  Cheap drinks (especially during happy hour), nice staff, quirky cute decor, and nice music - gotta love it.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
A hole in a wall bar

Tunnel Top looks a little sketchy from the outside and sits above the Stockton Tunnel, so... but don't let that deter you. If you are in the area for whatever reason, definitely stop in and check it out. Great atmosphere but very small but there is an upstairs. 

The upstairs balcony area is rather unique, and a cool experience if you can handle heights, and a nice view of the people below.

Depending on the DJ, can be fun or can put you off, depends on what type of music you're into. But the staff here are friendly. And the crowd is pretty cool/nice -- not a Marina yuppish hangout.
author: Carol Y.

description:
Definetely one of my favorite bars in Nob Hill. 

Try a basil or watermelon gimlet! Their cocktails are amazing!
author: Kaylie P.

description:
OVERALL:4.1   DRINKS:4   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:4.5   VALUE:4
I can't believe it's taken me this long to 'discover' this place.  The bombed out neon sign does absolutely no justice for this bar that's part rustic attic, part dive central, part euro-pub, part hip hop dance party, and 100% awesome.  Cash only bar means reasonable prices for some pretty creative concoctions ($6 watermelon gimlet!)...and is that a sultry French accent I hear...?

Walked in expecting full-on grime and the usual dive bar suspects...and was totally surprised by the quietly trendy bottle chandelier (like blue-collar Chihuly), chill crowd, unexpected wood furniture, live DJ/VJ mixing Jackson 5 & Kanye (?), and CLEAN BATHROOMS!

I think I'm in love!
author: Amy K.

description:
This is the place if you are staying on Nobb Hill and looking for some local dive bar flavor. 
Just outsdie Chinatown and right above the green door. Down the street from all the great hotels and shopping in Union Square.
I have a new spot in the area now!
Good job guys.
author: Steven F.

description: Its tiny, cozy and it can get crazy but I love this place! Usually theres good music rotating each day. Great drinks, awesome mojitos w/fresh fruit too. Really love this coconut drink I had last time here..it was all white? haha. The best part of all is that this place is literally 1 block away from my apartment!
author: Natassia S.

description:
Um, probably one of the best bars in town. Tiny, has two floors. On weekdays can sit upstairs in the cramped areas by the windows overlooking Bush and chat over a martini. (Their Olives are fantastic, I even asked the bartender for the brand. It's "Tesso"). On weekends, gets cramped but get there early or pre-party to get tipsy, then by the time you are there it won't matter much. Live music on weekdays. DJ on weekend plays awesome tunes (I know right?!).

So here is why I really, really like this bar. It has to do with the progression of the evening. 
(1) People get drunk(ish) early
(2) DJ turns up the music
(3) The upstairs area reaches an event horizon/terminal velocity/critical mass
(4) People just start dancing
(5) Place turns into a dance party celebration fiesta

This happened to me at least twice so far.

Had my b-day party, housewarming party, and school Bar Review there.
author: Dmitriy A.

description:
I hadn't been to Tunnel Top in years, but when I had some friends staying just up the hill at the Ritz (ooooh! fancy!) and the bar at the Ritz closed at 11, we had to find another spot close by. 

Tunnel Top is a perfect, divey spot in an area where there really aren't too many bars. The drinks are fast and relatively cheap (three drinks for $15 - I'll take it!). The place is on the small side with a small area in the front of the bar that is a little more open and some narrow space just alongside the bar. It's a casual spot to catch up with friends; the music wasn't so loud that we couldn't hear each other.

I didn't notice a particularly fratty crowd when I was there, but both nights I was there (Wednesday and Thursday night), it was relatively empty but a fairly energetic crowd considering.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I just moved up the street from this place.  I went in here quite a bit when I first started moving crap over here, but realized that as delicious as the fruit mojitos and pomegranate cosmos are, it's not something I can do all the time at $7 per drink.  Don't get me wrong, I think that's an excellent price for what one gets, but it's a little steep for it to be a go-to place all the time, at least for me anyway.  Besides, they're not open Sundays or on major holidays - great if I'm trying to go to sleep before the garbage and street cleaning trucks rumble by at 3am or some other ungodly hour, but otherwise it's kind of lame.  

All the same, it's still a pretty kick-ass spot, and the laundromat odor is sticking to its side of the street now.
author: Sus... B.

description:
- 1 star only because it is inconvenient to where I live and they don't take card though there is a ATM by the entrance.
 
Aside from that, one of the BEST HAPPY HOURS ever! Super chill dive bar with more seating upstairs. They also have different DJs and Bands for different nights listed on a chalk board to the right of when you enter, if that interests you.

Seriously, $3 for Snakebites (Guinness & Pear Cider)?! YUM! Trust me, it was delicious every time and I had about four of them. hahah. 

Tequila Sunrise, I think $5, which was good! I'm not a fan of tequila but the bartenders didn't mind me constantly coming back to get more limes!

Fresh made Mojitos, mmm.. a Bartender's most hated and we love it! So good! I think it's $6 of crushed mint leaf goodness!

It's a 1 stall ladies room and it's not too long of a wait.

Definitely will come here again if ever by the area!
author: Tiffany N.

description: Out of the way but really fun bar with good drinks and good prices. Walking distance to union square
author: John L.

description:
I had the most incredible fresh muddled watermelon martini here... 

With a great atmosphere, a variety of seating choice including an upstairs lounge area, and excellent happy hour deals, this is by far one of my favorite downtown bars.  

Like other reviewers have said, get here early!  It definitely fills up quickly.  You will want to beat the crowd and be two martinis in by the time it gets packed!
author: Susan K.

description:
Yes indeed...if I lived near that part of Bush Street I would love to call this place my "watering hole". 
-Great Music (you can spin tracks on a suspended case holder-pretty cool.)
-I like that you walk in like "man where can I sit? "Then you look upstairs and lounge is in full effect. If you're a single dude and know how to get your "Hefner" on, you're good.
-Parking is actually not too bad. The neighborhood parking scene mellows after 6pm...just be sure you move you don't get too drunk and leave your car. You have to move it by 2am;(
author: Bill M.

description:
Great little bar.

Crowd: younger people of all sorts (of age, of course).
Drinks: reasonably priced, neat selection of house cocktails, but knocked one star because my drink was not very strong, and nor were my friends'. :(
Service: fast
Ambiance: a contemporary take on divey with a delightfully imposing front door, love the alcohol storage behind the bar in the window.

Bartenders were lighting incense and sticking it around the bar while yelling to each other in French.  Mash this up with the spirit of San Francisco and you have Tunnel Top.
author: Kes D.

description:
Pros: Cool location and a nice dark red light atmosphere. Fast bartenders and good drink specials. $3 Fernet shots! No cover and plenty of different areas to sit or stand in such a small place.

Cons: Cash only and small so can get crowded.

Overall: Great bar to chill at if you're in the Union Square area.
author: Binh D.

description:
Small bar that packs a big punch. Went on a Friday night -- there were a lot people, but it wasn't overly crowded. Cash only bar. Good drinks -- bellinis were on special for $8. Mixed crowd. The bathrooms were surprisingly clean and I never had to wait in line (which for a girl is extreeeemely rare). 

And wow, I can't rave more about the music. Can't remember the name of DJ, but he played tons of 90s cuts, mixed in with some new and older stuff. I'll come back just for the music!
author: Patricia Y.

description:
Despite all appearances from the street of being a dive bar, the kind where dreams go to die, Tunnel Top is really cool inside.  A lot of wood.  Wood bar, wood floors, wood beams.... you get the idea.  It give the place a kind of relaxed vibe.  The candles and chandelier of wine bottles also helps.  And the floor is not all sticky with beer, which is pretty much a prerequisite for qualifying as a dive bar (that and the urinal smell, which can happen if you drink right outside the door in the back - avoid this drinking spot).  Huge windows look out onto Bush St outside.  The bar is kept cool and dim as to maximize viewing.  There's an upstairs area where you can sit at tables and just chat.  Bartenders are really relaxed and friendly.

My only complaint is that Chimay is not the same drunk out of pint glasses.
author: Jean K.

description:
This is a cool little bar, very laid back w/ a good crowd. 
Getting there was a little tricky , passing a lot of homeless but once inside, there it was a cute , cozy place.

I enjoyed it. They have a really good ginger mix drink (gosh i forgot its name, it is tropical, anyways..)..
I would not mind hanging out here w/ friends again..unpretentious place, a little small, but cozy.

Why not?, Chk it out.
author: C A.

description:
Hmmm, I've passed by this place for years but never though of actually coming in for a drink. The name of the joint adequately describes the location of this bar.

Dark and kind of gloomy I didn't think much about this place when I first entered. But as I went inside it was a cozy place to be (especially upstairs). This place is quite small so coming here before midnight is a must* Just an overall good place to hang out with small groups on a weekend to unwind.
author: Amy C.

description:
It's a dive...on top of a tunnel...what's not to love?

The dj spins from an open 2nd story floor that looks out onto the 1st floor.  This dive is small and the space is tight but people are mixed and drinks are good!  I had their special Strawberry Vodka Evening Glory that was so very tasty and refreshing!  Though it took me an hour to finish because the strawberry pulp kept inhibiting my straw suckage.  

I really like sitting upstairs towards the front of the bar next to the huge windows overlooking Bush St. - great for people watching.  Though the couches are good for lounging.  Then again, sitting at the bar minimizes time in between drinks.  Oh, I can't decide - I like this bar!

Minus one star is due to the fact that I'm a former smoker...and it's so very, very difficult not to indulge in life's perfect pairing of drink and smoke!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Win!

I came here for Happy Hour with a group of friends, and we all had a really good time. There really wasn't a crowd yet since we were there pretty early. Go us. Drink prices are really reasonable, and happy hour prices are even better. It's a relatively small place. It seemed like there was only 1 bartender running the whole place by himself, but he did really well. Friendly and fast service.

There's good group seating upstairs, so go on up after you grab your drinks. The music was also really chill - maybe some old alternatives and hip hop? Can't really remember. But it's not current Top 40s or anything. Good music to drink to.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Great place for an after-work happy hour if you're in the Downtown/Financial District area.

Their drinks are strong, well-poured, and they use fresh fruits for all of their cocktails. I literally saw the bartender slice and dice hunks of watermelon for a cocktail order, now that's service!

This place has a lively afternoon crowd that fills up fast. I'll have to come back later in the evening next time for a different experience. 

Note: this place seems difficult to find if you're coming from the south on Stockton Street, but just remember to take the stairway up right before the tunnel entrance. Tunnel Top is right at the top of the stairs on Bush Street.
author: David P.

description: Nice seating area upstairs. Mojitos are yummy.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Despite the looks of its rundown sign from Stockton St, Tunnel Top is a NOT a dive, in fact, it's as far from a dive as a hole in the wall can get! 

A quick climb up the tunnel stairs brings you to this dark-lit gem nestled at the crux of Chinatown, Union Square and Nob Hill. 

Dark wood throughout the bar give it a stylish utilitarian look, although I have to say my rear gets numb if I sit there too long. I love their wrought iron chandeliers made of old wine bottles, and the music is nearly always good. As many have commented the drinks are strong! But that's never a bad thing, just take a couple stiff sips and ask for more mixer. 

This is one of my favorite bars in the Union Square area, and the only reason it's getting 4 stars instead of 5 is that the the music is sometimes on the loud side, and the bar gets very crowded, especially for happy hour on Thurs and Fri, so it's tough to get a seat, or even a place to stand, and with just one bathroom the wait can be excruciating... 

That said, seems like all the good bars in SF are crowded at happy hour, which is what keeps them in business, so really, you just gotta put up or get out.
author: Rafael M.

description:
Stopped in here the other night at a friend's recommendation. When we got to the door, Tennessee from Arrested Development was playing. It's always a good sign when a song you love/missed is playing when you are just walking in the door. 

The place was small. 2 floors. Second floor is a wrap around balcony that looks onto the lower floor. The place is CASH ONLY so make sure you stop at your favorite bank first. They do have an ATM but it's $2.50 to take out money (on top of whatever your bank charges). The drinks were interesting, though. I had a watermelon gimlet. HOLLA! It was excellent! And it was $7. Not exactly high end city drink prices. LOVE IT! 

The dance floor was upstairs. Although small and cramped with a bunch of people, we still had an AWESOME time and the DJ was really playing some cool old 90's dance/RnB/hip-hop songs. 

My friend asked on a scale of 1-10, how much do you like this place? I said 8! Totally an 8! I danced, I drank, I sang, I had a JOYOUS time! I'll see you again Tunnel Top!
author: Amy B.

description:
If it's not packed full of Pepe le Pews on Bastille Day, the TT is a tres bon place to sip a  medium strong drink, stare at bountifully accessorized bartenders, and have sweet nothings whispered into your ear.

I like the no-nonsense loungey vibe to TT.  Chairs, Other places in the city could/should learn that throwing velvet pillows on uncomfortable sofas is way past cliche annd do not equate to being a bar that you want to drink in.
author: Joanna M.

description:
My friends and I call Tuesdays, "Tunnel Top Tuesdays" aka TTT...

It's nice to find a bar where there's good music and even better drinks!  On tuesdays, TT has great salsa and latin beats by Jorge.  Often times you'll see people testing out their dance skills on the 2nd floor.  It may get a little crowded up there but that's only because everyone can help but shake their booty!

Downstairs is where Ludovic, Michael, and Sasha work their magic.  Michael makes the hands down, most amazing mojitos you've ever had.  My friends prefer his gimlet, but I'm sure that whichever way you go, you'll be one happy camper.

This place is definately a winner!  Just make sure you bring plenty of cash (no CC accepted).  See you at TTT!
author: Janina R.

description:
came here pre crudo. they have happy hour i believe from 5:00-7:00 but it's all beer. I got the fresh blackberry mojito. it. was .awesome :] 
gotta come back next time later on in the night after reading all the good reviews.
author: Lynn T.

description:
This place is tiny but lots of fun. Recommend the upstairs area, especially if you want to get your groove on (DJ spins from about 10pm). 

Drinks are fantastic - had a mojito, a pomegranate something-or-other and a vodka. Friendly, unpretentious crowd the Friday night we went out as well.  

My tips? It's cash only... oh, and try not to have too many drinks in a short space of time. I was easily, crazily, wasted.
author: Lisette P.

description:
This place is awesome. Since we couldn't get into Eve on a thursday night, we drove through the city to Tunnel Top as one of my friends suggested. Pretty awesome location if you ask me. We took a little walk up the stairs and sure enough at the top of the tunnel was Tunnel Top. 

It's got a dark feeling to it, which is pretty neat. They had some old school movies playing on the wall. Not exactly the most uplifting type of atmosphere, but it really works! I immediately noticed they had a dark and stormy drink special, which is awesome because it's one of my fave drinks that they don't have at every bar I go to. My night was complete. We took a trip upstairs and there was a some room to dance and couches to chill on as well. Totally awesome. The DJ was on point with the jams he was crankin out, and even played some GangStarr (R.l.P. Guru). Another cool thing is you can scratch your name on the wall. Nice chill spot!
author: Alvin P.

description:
Overall, Tunnel Top is probably one of the better spots in the Union Square area and ranks high in my books.  

The Good - 
Diverse crowd, no cover, good music, two stories, comfy upper level lounge section, located near Union Square but hidden away from all the tourists.  I don't have anything against tourists but this place  seems to cater to the neighborhood crowd who does not want to get dressed up and pay $$$ on small serving drinks.  

The Bad - 
Like with most places in the area, Friday and Saturday nights can get super packed.  If you aren't into crowds, this place may not be for you during those nights.  In addition, the bar is cash only so be sure to bring some cash when heading over.
author: James M.

description: I had never been to Tunnel Top before and decided to include it in a spur-of-the-moment pub crawl. A great place in an awesome location, right on top of the Stockton tunnel. Cash only. Great music variety and volume, especially for an afternoon of drinking and socializing with friends. Not too crowded on a Saturday afternoon. It's divey (the lack of locks on the men's bathroom confirms this), but that is part of its charm. Cool place, I will definitely visit often.
author: Patrick L.

description:
My friend and I were visiting SF from Seattle and made Tunnel Top our destination for night two. 

Holy hell, what a night! This bar was hands down our best find while visiting. Heavy pours of Jameson for $5, delicious mojitos for pennies, a dj spinning upstairs, friendly and outgoing patrons and the coolest chandelier I've ever laid eyes on. Tunnel Top, adopt me!! 

The morning after the Tunnel Top was only missing a baby and a tiger. After eating a cup of noodles with a stir stick at 2am, my friend befriended a stranger in the lobby of our hotel and shared a slice of pizza before returning to our room and passing out. I woke up the next morning to find corn nuts in my hair and an empty hostess cupcake wrapper under my pillow. Our garbage can and an array of artificial sweeteners were in our shower and the ibuprofen was spilled all over the nightstand. So, in summary, it was a good night. 

It was at this bar that I became convinced and signed (scrawled a big E) a declaration stating that I would call San Francisco home by 2011. Way to woo me, way to woo.
author: Emily T.

description:
For a dive, it definitely exceeded my expectations.

The watermelon gimlet and various berried mojitos are to die for. The bartender takes fresh fruit and mashes it right then and there in front of you--the drinks are very very tasty, and pack a mighty punch. 

Prices are reasonable, and if you're hungry, Chinatown is steps away, along with a number or classier joints. Or just hang out inside. Upstairs, there are small tables for couples, and two lounging areas with L-shaped couches for larger groups. And the bathroom is clean. The bathroom is old school in its decor, but definitely well maintained--one of the cleanest bathrooms I've seen in a bar.

Bring cash, and get your fruity drink on! It's worth going out of your way for.
author: Sindy C.

description:
Got tired of paying $20 into fancy/classy club nearby, we stumbled upon this place and discovered one of our new favorite bars in the area featured reasonably priced drinks and good music.

After a big wooden door, there was a full bar and a few small wooden table/stools.  Unlike dive bars nor dance clubs, this place fell somewhere between the two.
