The atmosphere was pretty relax but the people did dress up and were not creepy nor smelly.  We were there on a Saturday night and the place was pretty full, but not too packed.  There was a little dance floor upstairs together with 2 sit down tables and 3-4 side tables with wooden stools.  There was a screen on the wall showing some gung-fu movie.

Pro:  I like all the songs they were playing.  Mostly pop, R&B dancing music.
Con:  Ordered gimlet but got a beer instead.  Seemed like the bartender failed on duty.  Also...it's CASH only.
author: Numrin T.

description: Cool, chill bar, with an awesome chandelier made with bottles! Music gets kind of loud, but that's expected. There's not a lot of room downstairs, but not too sure about upstairs since I didn't venture up there - but seemed crowded!
author: Michelle L.

description:
This is a pretty cool bar. I like the layout of it and that the second floor overlooks the first.  Kind of like a more fun version of Rickhouse.

Main complaint is how loud it is -- makes it hard to have a conversation, yet it is not like a dance club kind of place so... what else are you supposed to do?
author: Richa A.

description:
This lush has a crush on their Blackberry Mojitos...

Tunnel Top bar is conveniently located near Union Square.  I don't know how the parking is, I'm assuming it's tough since it's in the heart of the city...but it's the city..you walk here, don't drive!  Besides, if you walk, you can have a lil bit more dranky drank.

It's a great small "let's meet up" bar.  Definitely low-key, no snooty attitudes, no cover, great music, it's pretty darned awesome.
author: Joanne S.

description: This bar is quite a surprise.  Although they don't actually have a lighted sign, (it might have been lighted at some point) they seem to attract a lot of people all the time.  It seems divey because it's battered on the outside but inside, the people are unpretentious and nice.  I've had a really good time talking to people here, everyone is friendly and personable.  The downstairs is well equipped for talking and hanging out.  The upstairs has lots of seating and a small space that you can dance in.  They have drink specials with fresh fruit which is a really great feature.  Cash only, hit the ATM before you come out!
author: Eileen L.

description:
Phew. There's been a couple rowdy ones.

It doesn't matter if you ask the girl who spilt a FULL gin & tonic on her crotch, mid-conversation, and failed to realize what had happened for at least 30 seconds, or the kind gentleman who was doing his interpretation of interpretative dance on the upper balcony, we can all agree on a few select things:

1. Drinks are cheap.
2. Drinks are tasty.
3. Drinks are stiff.

Oh. The music was super dope, the atmosphere was unexplainably fantastically unique, even for SF, and I super appreciate the anti-douche low-key front entrance. 

Love this place.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Good deal on drinks. Good music. Diverse crowd. Can't complain. Not too big of a place, but it's a good size so you don't really lose anyone.

Bar downstairs with a good amount of space for people to hang out for a bit and order. Small and cozy dance floor upstairs. Liked the music so that's always good for me.

Advice to guys: Don't ever say something along the lines of "...because I'm a hot Asian guy?..." It's a turn-off that you're so cocky and think that your pretty face can get you whatever you want. No amount of alcohol could make me pretend I didn't hear that.

Minus: Only one men's and one women's restroom.
author: Anita C.

description:
This place was great! Hubby and I walked in because we had nothing better to do on a Saturday afternoon. I would definitely come in again.

Cash only, so plan accordingly.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Final call on the nights crawl trail was the Tunnel Top. We were admittedly a bit buzzed and Dave was flat out drunk. I do like the Tunnel. It has a great amount of space. Lots of room upstairs and downstairs to move and mingle, or in our case carry Dave and stumble a bit. 

There was a good crowd rocking to the beats. It was a little hard to get our drinks at first but after the first round we forgot to care as much. It was 3 stars for service and a nice 4 star SF atmosphere. But I can't complain. They let Dave hang out even though he started being kind of an ass to a few girls. We managed to subdue him a bit after a warning or two. Loved some of the throwback jams they started playing. 

I highly recommend avoiding the bathroom and always bring plenty of cash!
author: Nick B.

description:
Every time in I'm San Fransisco I have to stop here. This is where I was first introduced to bellini's and I can't get enough of them. Each drink I've had here has blown my mind in taste, quality, and service. 

I wish I lived closer though - I'd be here weekly.
author: Kelly F.

description: Cool spot. Whenever I visit SF I make sure to pop in for a whiskey and a beer (or 5).
author: John M.

description:
This is a really cool little place and when I mean little, it is little. 20x20 maybe? + stairs up to the second floor. The second floor is really just a ledge and a small couch area. Good thing it wasn't crowded. Loved the vibe of the place. Tunnel Top is one of the coolest dive bars I've been to. A good place to check out. 

*Cash only.
author: Minda w.

description:
The pull-up bar.

Given enough liquid courage, some friends and I are guilty of doing exercises on the beams upstairs. Do me a favor and tell me I'm an idiot if you see me doing any. Seriously.

My first time at this place I drank myself silly and had to have friends tell me what the hell happened. From what I can remember, drinks are well done, prices won't put a hurt on the wallet and the upstairs lounge is worth lounging in. We went on a Friday night and the crowd was...interesting. One of my friends claimed to have "battled" another guy. Everyone else says they were dancing together. A friend of ours said it isn't battling if the guy is grabbing your ass. In any case, no matter how you spin it, my friend lost. 

This place is a good time waiting to happen.
author: Ron E.

description:
This place is classy in a non-exclusive, comfy, divey sorta way. You know that rule where "the longer the girls' earrings are, the longer you have to wait in line"? This place is the total opposite.  It's like the perfect neighborhood hangout for mid-twenty and older folks who are beyond all the fuss but can still let loose without getting too sloppy.

(Note: This place is cool as is. Keep sloppy friends away. Thanks.)

The bar is great with $5 Jameson on the rocks and the DJ played dance music that would make the prudest of the prudes fist pump jersey shore style.  With two levels, the bottom for the thirsty loungers and the upstairs for the thirsty groovers, you can pick your poison and have a blast.

Parking seemed like no issue on a Friday night, and this place was a 10 minute walk (slight incline) from Powell Station.
author: Emerson L.

description:
SoooO much fun! This place is a hidden gem!

One of my gfs threw her bf's 25th birthday bash here and we all had a crazy good time. When she first told me the venue, I thought, why?? It looked like a cheap, tawdry Midwestern bar. Little did I know we would all come out so happy and drunk that it didn't matter. 

This place is definately a hole in the wall - wooden doors, unassuming exterior and a big tacky sign above the building. I felt like I was walking into a saloon. Inside, there are 2 levels that are both extremely small. It's hard to get around when the place gets crowded and there's no dance floor - you kind of have to shake your ass wherever you are or wherever you fall. 

Thumbs up: cheap drinks (most were around $5), pretty good house champage, good music, upstairs seating, no lines or waiting, no guestlist, no pretenses!

Thumbs down: the outside makes it look like a dump
author: Jenny T.

description:
I walk by Tunnel Top nearly everyday going to and from work. I never gave it much thought because it looks 100% divey mc diverson:  the big dark door which is closed most of the time isn't very inviting.

A few weeks back my hubby and i decided to pop in for a quick drink before going home. That quick drink turned into 4 bellinis for me and many pints of beer for my husband. Their happy hour is until 8pm (many stars for that) and their happy hour selection is tasty tasty fresh alcohol loveliness. 

Since that day, I've been back 3 times. I can't get enough of those $7 berry bellinis. Despite the dive exterior, the interior is very cool, kinda hipster chic without much pretension. It's small and gets busy fyi. Bartenders are quick with the drinks and no asshole attitudes.

A new fave - keep the bellinis coming :)
author: Kiristen R.

description: This place has always been close to my heart. I really enjoy the small space where you can go , have a drink and listen to some good music. by good I mean my kind of hip-hop with a dash of R&B. The whole place is just really chill. You have your few drunk individuals that are seriously trying to dance, but the're harmless.
author: Natalie F.

description: Dark 'n' Stormy + blueberry mojito + drinking on top of the Stockton Tunnel = happiness!
author: Kenny L.

description:
Ohhh Tunnel Top! I live within a block so I find myself at Tunnel Top a few times a month. It is one of the best kept secrets in the area. 

The atmosphere is fantastic: the lighting really makes the place feel intimate, yet cool (the bottle-chandelier is sick.) The music is almost always very good. I love when the DJ does a mix of throwback, current, and remixes of R&B, Hip-Hop beats. It is a refreshing alternative to cheesy/trashy clubs.

One downside: It can get crowded and the bar is a little too small, but the drinks are good and the staff moves quickly. Best case scenario is going with a group and getting prime couch seating on the upper-level, then sending a volunteers down in shifts to get drinks. 

I will keep going to Tunnel Top and recommending it to others.
author: Emmy L.

description: This is a really great place for drinks.  When I went on a Monday night, they were playing 90s hip-hop and R&B.  They also had a rando playing along with trumpet.  Great drinks, chill beer, good times.  What more can you ask for.
author: Roman A.

description:
I loved this bar. I am generally less of a fan when it comes to bars and more into the clubs. But this place is truly one of the best bars I've ever been to, here and abroad. 

The atmosphere is intimate, warm, welcoming. The crowd is friendly, diverse, happy. The bartenders are quick and nice. The drinks are tasty and affordable. This place is awesome! I'd give it 10 stars if I could! I wish I could put one of these in my house!
author: Ellen C.

description:
If I had to classify the Tunnel Top by "type of bar," I'd say it's a "jeans and flip flops" bar: no need for heals or fancy get-ups here, although I don't think it's a dive bar either. Located on top of the tunnel on Stockton (get it? Tunnel Top?), this bar is a small, two-story building with a dance area on the second floor. The first level holds the bar and some tables. We weren't in here very long, but the music was definitely danceable. 

It seemed like everyone there was PARTICULARLY trashed though...like unable to stand up, and considering that it was before midnight, that was kind of odd.
author: Emilia S.

description: This bar has a lot more personality than it leads on based on the exterior. Went on a Thursday night and there was some good hip hop for a bit, accompanied by the most random slide show I think I've ever seen. The upstairs seating is where it's at.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
One of my go-tos. I used to live two blocks away from here...oh boy did I come out looking like a hot little mess from here.

Fun music, good group of people *when its not some little girls birthday and she brings her whole pinoy family and then some* haha. 

Upstairs can get a bit stuffy... I try to work it out like I'm Britney in her Im A Slave 4 U vid but it just never happens ;)

The bartenders are hit or miss for me. It honestly all depends on whos working for me....

No covers, decently priced drinks, pretty good music depending on which night you go, I'm all about it.
author: Amanda S.

description: Beware this place is cash only but you will be handsomely rewarded with fantastic drinks and a cool atmosphere with a touch of rustic flair. The lounge area upstairs is a great spot to hang out in groups and the little mezzanine area is cozy for couples looking for a little privacy from the crowds downstairs. I highly recommend the Bellini with fresh crushed fruit.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Go! Go quickly to Tunnel Top! 

Be sure to get there before 11:00 PM to enjoy the understated beauty of a two story low-lit bar with exposed wooden beams and an unaffected laid back vibe. 

Be sure to order a sidecar because they take the time to do it right. 

Be sure to bring some cash unless you want the surreal experience of running over to the laundromat across the street to use the ATM. Bright lights Mogwai! 

Then leave! Leave before 11:00 when the DJ starts to crank up the music. That music acts as a Siren's song to the popped collar crew and all of a sudden you realize that you must leave and leave you must because this is not the same bar you entered only hours before. Who says change is good?
author: Michelle B.

description:
I can see and understand why it's one of Ace's favoritest bar in the City as soon as we walked in for a drink. It's quite intimate and cozy. It's a great place if you want to chill and just schmooze and catch up on talkstories with friends over candle tealight. 

I'd come back here again.
author: Mika D.

description:
I was reminded last Friday evening why I once loved the Tunnel Top. It had been a good 2-3 years since I had last visited and am now feeling a tad bit of remorse for having waited so long to revisit. 

The DJ was awesome, spinning some great hip hop. Lately I haven't been able to find happenin' bars that play hip hop so my brain automatically went in to "fun" mode when I heard those great beats. 

They have some really great and strong drinks in which they use fresh ingredients for. I ordered a raspberry mojito and was not disappointed. 

I love that they have an upstairs area as well. It's nice to be able to switch levels and enjoy a small change of scenery. I imagine it'd be great if you're trying to ditch somebody too...not that I would do that or anything! 

Good clean fun.
author: Julia N.

description: This place is tiny and cramped, but they make up for it with delicious, creative cocktails and funky art. I'm definitely going back.
author: Lindsay S.

description: Our first time visiting San Francisco, & found this cool lil spot! Loved the music & beer on tap! Our bar tender was really nice & made very good mixed drinks!!!
author: Marie E.

description:
Cool bar near Union Square. It's kind of small, but has a cool locals vibe to it even with all the shoppers hanging out in there. I dig the upstairs area, but by far the best part are the good cheap drinks. 

A Ketel One martini for $7? Yes please!!

Only drawback is they are CASH only. But they did have an ATM in there so at least your booze isn't too far our of reach!
author: Erik B.

description:
Dive but not a dive.

Like the different neighborhoods of SF this place has character. I know it cash only can scream high maintenance, but that is part of the charm. It's a place to hang with your friends in a lived in space that doesn't smell like a frat house basement. Drinks are cheap, mixed well, and tasty.

If you are looking for a neighborhood bar this place it.
author: Po L.

description:
This place is an awesome 4 star place when you catch it when it is in chill mode. It is a 2 star place after the DJ gets going.

This spot has got the right price for drinks ($6 per sidecar...made very well). Its got a chill, laid back mood w/ couches! You get some time to take in the sweet wine bottle chandelier. Some not so common liquors on the bar keeps things fresh and interesting (try out the Damrak gin if you are into lighter flavored gins). I didn't have anything off their specialty cocktail list, but it looked scrumptious (there was a watermelon drink!). My only complaint about this place as a chill bar is that they only had 1 bartender working on a Saturday night...(like, for serious?)

This place converted to a 2 star place as soon as the music picked up, and the douche crowd assaulted it. I totally didn't know how this happened with such speed and efficiency. Me and 2 mates are hanging out, having a chill conversation, and then the music got spontaneously louder. Weird. As I turn around to see why like 2 minutes later, I notice that the area behind me is packed to the brim with douche!! WTF!

Honestly, the only explanation I can think of is that they have a setup similar to Captain kangaroo somewhere. But instead of pulling on a string and getting a bunch of ping pong balls dropped on your head, the DJ pulls on a string and drops a bunch of hair gel, axe body spray, and sunglasses on every entering patron.
author: Sean C.

description: Nice place to go and have a few drinks with friends and pre-game. Bar was crowded, but didn't take too long to get drinks. Upstairs is nice to sit and talk. Crowd seemed pretty diverse, but didn't seem like the place to go if you want to pick up guys.
author: Olivia M.

description: For some reason, I actually enjoy this bar even though it's a bit out of the way. Dark interior but at least everything is spaced out so that it's not cramped. The music is pretty good and not too loud so I could actually hear the people that I was with. Plus, the wine wasn't stale which is really very nice.
author: Shauna S.

description:
So last night I was in the mood for some serious hip-hop, at any cost and after reading other reviews of this place having cheap drinks and great hip-hop I figured I'd give it a try...Major Letdown...

1.  The entire first floor smelled like piss and burger king onions
2.  The drinks were watery...and the watermelon martini was like being at a picnic...I literally ATE my drink there were so many chunks of watermelon...

So, since I was close to vomiting from the stinch on the first floor I made my way to the top and found easy seating for a Saturday night...
I also found that a girl had brought her stank @ss dog up in the bar and was letting it run wild on the connecting couches.  (I don't think there is any need to elaborate further on that...) 

The crowd was a bunch of frumpy weirdos...I'm married so I'm not in the dating game but I do like a little "Eye Candy"...but I ended up with an "Eye Sore" from this crowd...

Overall, the music was decent and the experience didn't kill me...Drinks were "Cheap"...Not just Inexpensive....I'd come back if I was fresh out of the gym, hadn't brushed my teeth or hair, and wanted a place to fit right in... :)
author: Sommer T.

description:
I came in here as the last stop of a bar crawl. I never would have come in here on my own. 

I was grouped up with a girl I met on the crawl and we came in here together. We walked in and the first thing we saw was a spiky blond haired dude wearing a super tight T-shirt that he probably bought at baby gap so he could show off the "gun show". I turned my companion and said, "this place seems kind of date rapey" and she laughed. 

We went in a little further and noticed they had one of those big boards of custom cocktails but they were reasonably priced, $6 instead of the usual $9-$11. An idea went off like a skyrocket in my head! I love green apple flavor and I'd wanted to try an Appletini for years. I rarely go to the kind of bar where they'd make one of those and wouldn't ever order something like that while out with my friends because they'd razz the hell out of me.

I ordered my Appletini and the bartender said "what?" I repeated my order and he made it for me but before he gave it to me he asked, "Is that it?" as if surely I wanted a beer and that girly drink was for someone else. As far as I can tell an Appletini is just vodka and apple pucker, it was alright, I'd just order it on rocks in the future to get it in a regular glass if I had the urge to try it again. The girl I was hanging out with thought the whole thing was hilarious, from me being insecure about ordering the drink to the bartender's reaction.

We noticed that people upstairs were dancing and the girl I was with wanted to check it out. I told her that I wasn't nearly drunk enough to dance but I probably could muster one of those 80's white boy dances, I showed her and she laughed some more. We went up the stairs and saw a group of the most rhythmically challenged people dancing away without a care to Reggaeton. If you want to dance but are concerned that you may look foolish this is the place for you!

This falls into the file of places I'd go if other people really wanted to but would never choose it on my own.
author: Manny F.

description:
As far as Union Square/Downtown goes this is by far the coolest and probably the only dive bar that I know of. I never hang out in the Union Square/Downtown/Fin District area unless it's for an after work HH during the week and I usually always try to push for Tunnel Top. However, they do play their music pretty loud so if you're looking for a quieter place this might not be the ideal spot.

But the drinks are cheap and there's plenty of room upstairs.
author: David C.

description:
Name says it all...it's located at the top of the tunnel.

Went to Tunnel Top for Happy Hour on a Thursday with a few friends about a month ago, yeah yeah...i know I'm late. My first impression was...wow, this place is pretty small. From all the reviews I've read, I expected more than just a narrow bar, and a narrow staircase that led to a small and narrow balcony. Nonetheless, it was still a good time with strong, yummy drinks, good friends, and glasses trail mix.  

Drinks to try:
Blackberry Mojito, Watermelon Gimlet on the rocks.

There were 2 cons. 

1)Tunnel Top only accept CASH and they don't have an ATM in the bar. I had to cross the street and get cash from the ATM in the laundry mat. The cash comes out in $10 bills which was different. 

2) They don't serve bar food...except for the cup of trail mix that I had to ask the bartender for. Nut shots....that's what they are called...hahah!

Would I go back? Of Course!
author: Mace B.

description: My favorite bar in the city by far. Get a watermelon gimlet. And then 12 more. The weekends are pretty crowded but its awesome for an after work mid-week drink. Really great vibes.
author: Aaron H.

description:
Little place that packs a big PUNCH!!! From the awesome music on Saturdays (with coordinated music videos projecting on the wall) to killer Mojitos. 

I was so pleasantly surprised considering I'd passed by this little jem at least 20 times when I used to travel to SF for business. Now that I live here, a girlfriend co-worker took me here on a Saturday. I was really hesitant but wow...we had such an amazing time dancing the whole night!!!
author: Becky O.

description:
It's very charming place, but it smells..... The restrooms are not very clean. Also it can be so packed and sometimes takes forever to get a drink. 
I like this place to hang out with friends casually, but not my favorite place to go.
author: Hyewon C.

description: Hell yeah. The staff deserves 6 stars. Great neighborhood dive bar, good prices.
author: Daniel F.

description: I completely adore this place. I've had too many fun and memorable nights here both with the people I came with and with the random crowd that loves this place. It's sort of divey but totally seductive.
author: Jane K.

description:
I went here after work yesterday for the first time.

Pros: My gin and tonics were cheap and delicious. Good music selection.

Con: Either the music was a bit too loud, OR I have super hearing. Either way it was rather difficult to carry on a conversation. I feel like it could've been turned down just a notch or 2 and made the experience much better.

Will I go back? Definitely at some point.
author: Brandon R.

description:
This is my favorite "dive" bar in SF... or at least that is how I describe it to my friends when we roll up here from visiting Union Square or something of that sort in the area. 

Either drinks at the bar, or up stairs in one of the cozy seating pits makes for a great night of drinking. Couple that with the fact that they make some mean cocktails, including a mint julep... who can go wrong?
author: Jordan Y.

description: I don't normally hang out in this part of town, but this is one of my go-to places when I do. Cool atmosphere.
author: Paul O.

description:
I woke up this morning with a debit card stuck to the side of my face.  Thankfully, it was mine, so I can still say I haven't sold my body for money - although there ARE a few Spring Break memories that remain debatable.

My arms were intimately curled around last night's drunken hook-up:  my laptop computer.

Sh*t.  I sleep-shopped again.

Tunnel Top is trouble with two capital T's.  Warm environment, friendly bartenders eager to pour drinks, music to shimmy to, and a cash-only policy that causes some (me) to tuck their debit card back into their purse shamefully and flirt with cash-carrying boys shamelessly.  

Market street is a downhill walk from T.T., which makes getting home a snap.  Last night (technically this morning), after enjoying libations with my co-workers and listening to an all-female DJ line-up, I teetered down the hill in my black patent heels and hailed a chariot (disguised as a yellow kidnapper van) in no time.

Bottom line?  I might have only spent $10 on cheap drinks last night , but evidence suggests I later blew $250 on jeans that are the same kind and SAME SIZE that Angelina Jolie wears.  

Thanks to Express Shipping (drunk Janney gets impatient), I'll be able to go back to this bar in three-to-five business days and say, "Tunnel Top, meet Muffin Top."
author: Janney B.

description:
I LOVE this bar.  It's definitely one of my favorites in SF.  It's pretty divey and you always meet interesting characters every time you go. I know that they used to allow cigarettes inside as long as you were upstairs (this doesn't necessarily matter to me as it's been exactly a year since I QUIT-woo hoo).  

They have a pretty good happy hour special and good comfortable seating upstairs.  They have a DJ at night, so it's pretty mint for dancing, etc with your girlfriends.  The drink prices are pretty decent, too.
author: Jenny W.

description: It's really hard for me to think of this as a dive-y bar because compared to South Bay bars, this looks pretty nice to me! However, it is small, with a small diverse crowd - no one was pretentious and the drinks (at happy hour) were cheap. We came here on a Saturday night during Halloween weekend and you could still get in the door, find a place to sit and get good service. Thanks to other Yelpers reviews I was able to find this place and glad that I did!
author: LuLu M.

description: I've been here two dozen times and I always have a great time. A variety of talented DJs, innovative drinks and a clubby bar vibe. The only thing that takes away from the experience is how small the venue is. It gets crowded quickly and soon it is hard to move around without spilling your drink or getting a drink spilled on you.
author: Chad T.

description:
It's Tuesday, I'm in my cubicle at work. As I pop-lock-and-drop it in my seat (yes- it's possible) to the tune stuck in my head from last Saturday, I reflect on how "dope" the place really was. 

I mean, honestly, I'm "on the wagon" this month and still had a blast there (if you've read any of my other reviews you'll know I'm quite a lush and if a bar can entertain me sober- it's probably a miracle). 

Wine bottle chandelier- I want one. .. or maybe I'll make one (good excuse to drink about 60 bottles of wine). 

Upstairs- fun lounge- I imagine a great place to sneak away and make out if/when you're THAT drunk and frisky. 

Wall carvings- they complain about it and ask people not to do it.. but I think it "adds character" 

Bathrooms- umm...... hover. And if you want to know what you look like when you pee... please- enjoy the FULL LENGTH mirror immediately next to the toilet... hrmmm 

Crowd- (BYOB: Bring your own boys) Also bring Pu-rel if you plan on touching any of the guys you didn't bring. Thank gawd I have a man.. I would've been bored ... with the dopey dirt bags. 

Drinks/ Bartenders: AWESOME bartender who poured me soda water all night with a smile on his face. Judging by how quickly my friends got wasted- he poured them stiff. Can't wait to get back here and really tie one on so I can do a proper drinking review. 

DJ... I'm still popping... locking... and brushing my shoulders off. Remind me to un-pop my collar before my next meeting.
author: Kaitlyn G.

description:
It's nicer than it was 2 years ago, but you can still come casual, or if you wanna dress up you can do that now and you won't look funny.

Same drinks, just a bit more loungey/club than before, but on a smaller scale since this is not a super huge club.  It feels more like a private intimate club.  

Same fun though, same drinks and I still love it!
author: Denise B.

description:
This bar is pretty dope.

Decent music/dj and cheap drinks.

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Gene A.

description:
I've been dying to go here. I love the two story atmosphere, that is until some jerk "spilled" his drink and it splashed all of us at the bar. But the bartender and bouncer were totally on top of it right away. No shenanigans here! 
The DJ wasn't the regular one apparently but it was still fun, you just have to really really want to hear "Womanizer" and "American Boy" and "Get Low" for 10 minutes each. "You're not getting low! I'm going to play this until you ALL get low!" 
Good times. Will definitely be back. I like the location, the view, the people, the atmosphere, the bottle chandelier.
author: Mary Ella D.

description: TT is a great Happy Hour watering hole. Earn your drink with the hike up the hill from Market Street after a day of work or shopping in Union Square.
author: Mel H.

description:
Oh. My. God.

What the fuck did I DO last night?

Oh, yeah....Illegal stuff. That's right. We wound up at this bar...How we got there...Look....Does that really even matter? Because I don't remember that part at all. But I DO recall walking in and wondering why in the hell this place smelled like a laundromat. 

But, hey....That's better than the typical piss/sweat/stale beer smell of most dive bars, right? And as the night wore on, I wasn't really smelling anything because my face went completely numb. All of my senses died....Which is probably a good thing, because I danced so much that, under normal circumstances, I would have collapsed in a sweaty heap. But I was SO "in the zone" that all I could do was dance. 

The bartenders here were so incredibly friendly, and the crowd was a pretty intriguing mix of bros, professional types, tattooed hipsters, and dancing sluts in garter belts and corsets (read: your esteemed reviewer).

You know you had a good night when you wake up the next morning and wonder just how many people you gave your phone number out to the previous night. Even better if you wake up and ask your friend, "So did I REALLY make out with that guy or was it a dream?"

Right on, Tunnel Top. Right on.
author: Pamela D.

description:
I feel like a Lego Man in a toy set dive bar w/ DJ.  

2 floors, little space to get your boogie on...  Tunnel Top a true listening lounge.   

And don't come here if you're gonna just text all night or you will get kicked out.   Nah I'm playin' =)
author: Abraham E.

description:
It's a dive, so my friend was actually surprised I'd suggested we try it out, but it's surprisingly clean!
Everyone is really friendly, from the guy checking your ID at the door to the bartenders. Great prices on drinks, good mojitos (I was pounding fresh watermelon mojitos...yum!) and the DJ actually played Mystikal at some point -- nostalgia!
author: Sandy B.

description:
Watermelon vodka shots,
Greyhound
Bros, hos, etc., terrible DJing. Eh.
author: Y K.

description: This place is fantastic and the perfect little hideout after a long day at work. The drinks are delicious and the bartenders are great. This is a must see if you are in SF.
author: Jenna B.

description: Blackberry mojitos + old skool hip-hop = maybe my favorite bar in San Fran.
author: Vonetta Y.

description:
So, I spent more time at Tunnel Top this weekend than my own home. Here's why:

I dig this place. It's the kind of place where dive-bar lovers and lounge/club lovers can happily co-exist. The bar is downstairs and feels like a typical bar. It has a nice beer selection, quick service and decent prices. Upstairs has a bit more class with candles and big comfy ottomans where you can hide out, sprawl out or make out (no, I didn't). And although there's no official dance floor, people always end up shaking their booties (yes, I did).

Home is overrated anyway.
author: Kathryn T.

description: You're where? The Financial District? Why? Oh whatever, I'll meet you at the Tunnel Top. They have some fine beverages in the land of suck.
author: Helena L.

description:
Sassy and I are in a very committed relationship.  That's right.  She is my Yelp Life Partner, and I her +1 Bitch.  

I rarely leave my house unless she is accompanying me.  Sometimes I can't even cross the street unless she holds my hand.  

Sadly, she has a piece of man mutton that takes up half of my "Sassy n' Me" time.  It's a damn shame too, cause as you know, I'm good in bed.

Wait, what?

So on Saturday night when she called me and told me her he-bitch was washing his hair that night, I jumped at the chance to have her all to myself.

It was magical.  We watched So You Think You Can Dance reruns, texted JT like 1200 times, talked and laughed, drank white wine and ate a bag of Goldfish.  I might have even tried to hold her hand... but we're taking it slow.  15 years and counting!

After calling the entire contents of both of our phonebooks and not getting a response from anyone, we decided that we needed to be WAY drunker and hit Rye for some major douche dodging...

After too many drinks and too many D-Bags at Rye, SOMEONE called us back (hi Eric!).  We met up at Tunnel Top, which I love.  Its dark (I am seriously pretty in the dark), its warm (I have poor circulation) and the chode to normal guy ratio is about 2:1 (it's about 16:0 at Ambassador on Saturday night).

Eric got there and I realized he was going to cockblock me all night long, as Sassy and he quickly started talking "shop" (ie. Yelp, blogs, Eric's resemblance to Sassy's manzilla).

If you know me, then you know I eat my feelings.  There was no food around, so I decided to dance.  

I danced for two hours.  By myself.  In front of Sassy and Eric's table.  Hoping that they would turn their attention towards me.  Which never happened.  I did however win the favor of a man who resembled carrot top and a small Mexican man named Juan (HOLA!).

Once Eric and Sassy FINALLY shut the hell up, it was closing time.  

As we were leaving Eric handed us a big chocolate bar.  A parting gift, perhaps?

Either way, I knew what I had to do.  I looked at Sassy and said, 

"You want some of this chocolate?"

"That chocolate belongs to Eric."

"It could be our chocolate."

"No chocolate will ever be our chocolate."

Needless to say, she didn't put out.  And she isn't THAT good anyway.
author: Rachel G.

description: Very small and you can smoke inside this bar. Good for cold weather and you like to smoke. Great crowd, great prices for alcohol, and great music. Those are three great things about this place. It's just really small. The neighborhood is somewhat hard to find parking and it is a little ghetto. A lot of drug addicts.
author: Hellen D.

description:
I was just in Europe, land of perpetual cigarette smoke, sexy boots, and American pop music circa 2006. Although I had a fantastic time, I longed for bars that wouldn't make my clothes smell like I washed them in ashes and that play music other then Justin Timberlake and Kylie Minogue remixes.

My good friend Rachel G., I like to call her Trainwreck, decided to accompany me out on the town last Saturday. We called and texted our entire phone logs and when no one responded and we admitted defeat and that we are indeed no-friend losers we proceeded with our lady date.

First there was Rye, where we hovered at the bar until we made people significantly uncomfortable enough to abandon their bar stools, drank $8 mini-drinks, gawked at pathetic tips left by snobby hookers, and drooled over a Jewish man we named "Ari."

Then, there was Tunnel Top. It was crowded. It was loud. It was dark and steamy. I like the dark part. It's gothic and pleases my tormented soul. I don't like the steamy part. I just got my clothes smelling like clothes again and now, after a trip to Tunnel Top, they smell like Kate Moss' dirty laundry. 

I wouldn't have minded the loud if the source wasn't coming from a three-year-old Pussycat Dolls song. Rachel, the tiny shorts-wearing dancing queen, rocked out to the creepy teen pop as I shouted at Eric W. about inappropriate compliments from across the table. It was aiight, but not the chatty vibe I was looking for.

Perhaps Tunnel Top would be more pleasing on the senses on a weeknight, but Saturday it seemed to be a little Bridge and Tunnel for my wannabe Euro-snob self. Maybe next time I'll just huddle in my smoke-free studio drinking wine and watching ironic foreign films as I grumble about kids these days and that noise they listen to.
author: Sammy S.

description:
Oh Tunnel Top...what am I going to do with you?  You are like the cute hipster girl that has so much going for you but one major flaw:

I love the fact that you are close to my house. 
I love that your dj spins awesome music.  
I love that I always run into someone there I know.  
I love your strong drinks.

I hate that you allow smoking.  

Sometimes love ain't enough.
author: phil h.

description:
tables and taciturn couches
teaming together to let the tall balcony 
triumph over the talkative bar. 

tunes tangling between tall-taled talks
of turgid traffic and tasty tamales. 

trance dance dance dance
thump. thump. thump. 

tasteful decor and treasured staff
total the trendy scene. 

tunnel top: tantalizing tomfoolery.
author: Jared S.

description:
This appears to be one of those places that people think is a "dive" for some reason I don't understand.

Because it's in the Nobloin next to a dirty massage place? Because it's small or dark? Because of the smoking thing (which seems to be mostly eradicated now?) What is it?

Because the way I see it, the Tunnel Top is clean and pretty with nice little decorative touches and a chalet feel, pretty much always full of rich kids and white-collar workers, and they serve blackberry mojitos. I mean, a decent place to meet some friends for a drink (except Friday happy hours, when you risk death by suffocation) but certainly not a "dive."

Oh, the ladies' room has a giant framed mirror next to the toilet, for your complete viewing pleasure.
author: Megan W.

description:
I like all things literal. Like, "Our bar is on top of the Stockton Tunnel, therefore, we will name it TUNNEL TOP." Excellent. Right up there with "Mission Bar."

You know what else I like? The freakin' mojitos at this place. They are SO GOOD. Good like my Grandma's home cookin', only sassier and more Latin.

They are the best mojitos I've found in this town. Admittedly, I don't drink a lot of mojitos, but that's usually because they SUCK. Sugar water. Ew. They suck in this town because who needs a cold, sweet, fruity drink here? Whiskey, I tell you. Fogtown = whiskey. But I will drink mojitos all night at the Tunnel Top. They are puurrrfection. 

And then I will go upstairs to the dance floor, where I will dance to Queen tunes and sing Bohemian Rhapsody at the top of my lungs and act out all the gestures as if I'm Freddie Mercury and I'm worshiping the fine on-stage moves of my friend Jane's Brian May. 

And then when some stupid girl manages to spill my fifth mojito off the rail that's specially designed to hold drinks because she put her purse on top of it (idiot!) and managed to create a mojito rain downstairs right where people are waiting in line for the bathroom (IDIOT!) and then she DENIES IT, I won't cut a bitch. 

Because I am a rockstar, and I have an image to maintain. 

Come on, Jane. Next performance is scheduled at the 500 Club in 20 minutes. 

500 Club. As in 500 Guerrero Street.
author: Lisa T.

description:
The Tunnel Top  is just far enough away from the Tenderloin and North Beach that it draws a crowd made up of refugees. Half from the squalor of the Loin, the other half slumming. Plus, it's just close enough to Union Square that you may get to enjoy the sight of the living archetype I trainspotted here last Friday night: 

An honest to god, stumpy semi-Kenny Rogers-looking rich old guy replete with a Euro prostitute on his arm. I shit you not. He was rolling all, "You whippersnappers tart yourselves up in striped shirts and I'm still up to my rolled-up blazer sleeves in totty!" My word! And she was just a straight up tart, the meter was running. What "Vianger" and a little cash can accomplish are almost inspirational.

What isn't inspirational are the drinks here. They're decent, but not if you're a total lush. I mean, I don't drink a lot, but I don't drink a little either. Sinatra said that. Sorta. And Sinatra isn't known for drinking beer, which I do when I come here. Which kind of wraps the whole thing up for me.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I have been here several times. Sometimes a weekday, sometimes a weekend, sometimes early, sometimes late, sometimes winter, sometimes summer. I like to mix things up.

So does this bar. 

The drinks: sometimes strong, sometimes weak
The crowd: sometimes strong, sometimes weak
The music: sometimes strong, sometimes weak
The bartenders: sometimes strong, sometimes weak
The air (smoking allowed upstairs): sometimes strong, sometimes weak

Hmmmm, maybe they don't really mix it up that much, after all.
author: Drue C.

description:
Divey place for Jack and cokes.
Went on a pub crawl and I remember it being loud and I think a DJ was playing CDs of thumpy repetitive drums that barely qualifies as music.
Whatever.  I see why some people like it.
author: Kev M.

description:
Yelp is enriching my mind.  
This week on the the 'Talk' boards I learned a new word "Frottage"

def: Frottage is (sexual activity without penetration that can include) any form of sexual rubbing, whether naked or clothed, for arousal or orgasm.

Well, ladies and gentlemen Tunnel Top is a promoter of Frottage.  Its a good size, but when the DJ spins ass shakin' music it doesn't matter that you're packed in tighter than sardines (although sardines get oil in those cans- hmm).  

The bartenders were quick---very good.  The layout lends itself to more of a lounge constituency but, every time I've been here its packed and in need of a dance floor instead of coffee tables bolted to the floor.

Great place overall.  Maybe they should supply oil at the door though.
author: R M.

description:
Wow, I'm glad to be the first to review this...or well, actually the 201st but whichever, or 202nd, ok, anyway. This bar, I totally would have missed it had the lovely Miriam W not told me to meet her there on her recent sojourn back to the city that misses her most.

That said, there we were and didn't this allow for a lovely time.  The decor is unique and fun.  An extra star for the dedicated bartender who was devotional in his pouring of water in my empty glass.  Here, here for not trying to get me drunk!
author: Sean S.

description:
Tunnel Top exists so that people who are around Union Square can escape the false seduction of marketing and materialism and get back to something real.

At Tunnel Top, it's all about drinking - standing and drinking, sitting and drinking, smoking and drinking, chilling and drinking.  Early in the evening it is relaxed.  Later it can get very full.  DJ's are good.  Bartenders are efficient and generous, if not overly friendly.

If you are going to sit upstairs, do not order anything in a martini glass unless you are an acrobat and excellent at balancing liquids while climbing up a flight of stairs in heels.  Or perhaps you don't mind sloshing Gimlet all over yourself, and in that case never mind.

Yeah, go hit up the Tunnel Top and get back to something real.  Real drunk.
author: Liz S.

description:
I dunno why I like this place so much. 

Maybe because I can't remember anything that happened there the next day, since I've been drinking a plenty due to there very reasonably priced drinks and dancing to the well put together sets that the DJ's spin over there.
Not flavor of the month top 40 BS and not even over played hits like Jump around or No diggity. But a nice mix up of well known and not so well known bangers.

It's dark it's cozy, has couches, and some girls who go there can actually dance a little bit.
-1 for not being able to smoke in there anymore. =(
author: Locks B.

description:
This is one of those "Twilight Zone" places.  The rundown storefront and gritty sign out front suggests that this will be your standard sad iron worker bar.

But step inside and it's all hip and shit.

I might take some of my more respectable friends here to show them this "hip find" that I located in the city.  But otherwise, I'll stick to bars in town that don't try to charge me $3.50 for a PBR.
author: Rocco B.

description:
If there is nothing i like more than playing with puppies, the sound of children's laughter, or a really good hug, its being amid controversy.  I love being the one that everyone is talking about the next day at work, and having to field the most ridiculous questions about something that so obviously didn't happen.  This was my morning.  

Arriving at 6:15 ish was key for last night.  We had a big group of co-workers arriving and needed the space.  We landed one of the two large benched areas upstairs which made for cozy sitting, close talking and rumors starting.  Apparently I am now making out with a co-worker.  Not that i don't love him to pieces, but a) he is not my type, and b) we were close talking cuz we were talking shit, and we didn't want the other co-workers to hear.  Oh the irony.

There is a pretty sweet upstairs that circles the whole bar, with bartops and stools lining the perimeter, and the one side with the large group seating.  I didn't take advantage of the ability to smoke upstairs till the majority of my work party left, but that was probably because i had a few more cocktails in me as well.  I started off with a pomegranate cosmo. After deciding that the fancy cocktail price of $6 was too steep at a bar like this, I stuck with my Vodka soda splash of cranberry, which were more in my price range and the less $$ spent per drink meant more drinks for me!

I had a good time, got to pee in a relatively clean mens room (they are single room bathrooms), and am now the lucky lady friend of a co-worker.  He is having the tattoo with my name on it removed this afternoon.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Although I am not a Mojito connoisseur, I have heard & am of the opinion that the 'top makes one of the best in the city. Something about the bar itself appeals to me; two stories, a little classy & all about good location. It sits above the south end of the Stockton Tunnel, and is only a block away from Union Square. 

Oddly enough, the magical mojitos have somehow brought various friends and I to this picturesque spot for deep drunken conversation until security kicks us out. Wtf, security dude? We're just chatting. I don't normally sleep in public places...

I find the crowd to be a little more blazer & boots than t-shirt & chucks, which can still be fun at times. From the handful of times I have visited, they are usually playing hip-hop...and it fits. If I wanted rock, there are plenty of other spots in the area. 

It's a good spot, i will continue to visit every once in a while...maybe for post-dinner drinks with a date or just general semi-classy debauchery with friends.

MOJITO!
author: matt m.

description:
This is a cool bar to meet up with friends.  Even if it does get crowded on Fridays it doesn't matter.  

Dope place and I love that you can people watch out the big window and see who may come in.

The bartender's pretty cool and quick.  

I dig it....also you can have a little privacy upstairs if you can find a table.
author: Jay H.

description:
Good music on a Friday Night.  90's and up hip hop that you can chill too...not much bootie shaking going on in here.  The DJ ends up playing the WHOLE SONG...which is interesting these days considering that after the first verse, im expecting the DJ to mix in a different tune.  

Drinks are Large, place is pretty crowded downstairs.  Upstairs you'll find all the drunkies lap dancing in the lounge area and singing at the top of their lungs to Mr. Snoop Doggs "Aint no Fun"

Good Times!
author: Gladys D.

description: low life place ...rude mean low class bartender who do nothing but talking about people behind their backs and he work there full time too !!!!!!
author: Inconnu I.

description: Drinks here are pretty cheap ($6-7 for a cocktail) until you realize that they water down your drink. Got the watermelon gimlet which I thought was quite refreshing. However, definitely don't have too much alcohol and tons of ice. The bar is pretty nice with a small upstairs that play jazz band and lounge/couch area + a few seats on the narrow balcony. It is literally at the top of the tunnel, hence the name. If the music were playing when I was there, would've been quite fun.
author: Joyce B.

description:
I believe at some point in the past, I compared a bar to the setting of Van Gogh's painting, 'The Night Café', only with happier people; Truth is, the tunnel top comes closer to that description than any establishment in recent memory; There are only a few differences:

There are two levels, with seating in varying degrees of light and remoteness so you can be at the center of everyone's gaze or be anonymous in the corner or anything in between. Even when it's still light out it's much darker than Van Gogh's café at Arles.

The bar staff is friendly and people are generally talking and laughing with each other than sitting hunched miserably over their drinks or glaring at you in judgement.

There's no pool table, I don't think. Drinks at the tunnel top are pretty cheap too, although Van Gogh's place couldn't have been all that pricey.
author: matthew r.

description:
I live right up the hill from here, so I've given this place quite a few chances to prove itself... When I first moved to Nob Hill, I didn't even know this place was a bar.  It just looked like a shitty old building from the outside.  It wasn't until I heard music blaring one night that I figured out it was a bar.  Since then, I've stopped by for both happy hour and late night bar-hopping... and I'm just not sold on it, which saddens me because I would love to have a great neighborhood dive bar one block from my apartment.  I think the thing I dislike most about Tunnel Top is that each time I've ordered a cocktail off the menu, they're always out of the ingredients.  So, I end up getting beer, which isn't a bad thing because they stock Chimay and Hoegaarden. 

The atmosphere is pretty chill, and at night they light tons of candles on the stairs and tables.  The bottom floor has the bar and bathrooms while the upstairs mezzanine has a few tables for sitting and chatting (if you can hear over the music).  It gets pretty stuffy on both levels at night.  Hanging from the ceiling is a massive chandelier made of beer bottles.  There isn't really one "type" of person that hangs out here, so you get a decent mix of people, which also varies depending on the night.

I guess it's decent overall.  Not my favorite place in Nob Hill/ Union Square, but I'll come back on nights when I'm too lazy to walk further to another bar.
author: Christy L.

description:
Great bar in an unassuming storefront.  You feel transported to a cellar but you are blocks from union square and there is traffic all around.

This was my spot for years when I lived downtown.  DJ is consistently putting out hip-hop, reggae and cult movies on projection.  

Bar is cash only and the upstairs is great for groups of 10 people or less.  The small cocktail tables upstairs are good for an intimate conversation in a busy bar environment.
author: Joel L.

description:
I don't know, the place just didn't do it for me.  Even though I think it's cool that it sits on top of a tunnel, and despite it's long history there's more cons than pros for this place for me.

The place has a hipster/goth look to it and the place is tiny.  I went on a slowish weekday night and we were holding our drinks in the air while brushing against many bodies just to get from one part of the bar to the other.  I can't imagine how you'd be able to move if the place was packed.  Also the lounging area is upstairs, and anytime you have to haul drinks up and down some flight of stairs, it just makes for a rather precarious situation.  Also the time I was there, (not sure if this is a regular occurrence) but I could smell the disinfectants from the bathrooms.  I thought that maybe we were right next to them but somebody told me that they were downstairs.  Huh?!  

I am sorry, if it smells like a urinal, right in the place where I am sipping my vodka tonics, then you are only getting 2 stars.  1 for the cool bartenders and the 2nd for creating an atmosphere where Marilyn Manson would feel at home.
author: D.wight L.

description:
Why do we clean our microwaves?  It's so the crap that splatters up on the ceiling doesn't fall into what we nuke a week later, giving us a bad case of the D.  Tunnel Top's chandelier needs to be cleaned, so don't stand under it.  If you do, cover your drink (probably not a bad practice anyway).

Tunnel Top is crowded Saturday nights with mid-20s trendy urbana sporting DIY haircuts and various striped shirts.  It's very small inside, has a mezzanine level where the DJ spins and people smoke (FYI - don't wear anything that is Dry Clean Only).  You can have a pull-up contest on the mezzanine or scratch your name into the faux orange patina on the wall. It's nice to sit by the windows, if you can manage to get those seats.  The chandelier is made from wine bottles and it looks cool from below.  When you get up top, it is covered with dust and other grime... the whole scene made me shutter to think what was falling in people's drinks.  It's a Cash Only bar, but there is an ATM outside.  The bouncer/barback/busboy (he does it all, folks) is frantic, a little wired and has a lot of babysitting to do.

Not one of my favorite places, but I would go back if it wasn't crowded.
author: Jessica M.

description:
They serve Kronenbourg 1664 and have a smoking area upstairs.

Even better, on some nights the DJ plays music at a low reasonable volume.

So that people can talk.

What a concept! :)
author: Justin C.

description: We ordered the Watermelon gimlet and although it was super cheap (around 6 bucks), I couldn't really taste anything but water. Think it needs more watermelon juice...or something. A two story bar is kind of a unique setting, there's a pretty decent view, but I think I'll try another drink elsewhere.
author: Samuel H.

description:
It has come long way from the old man's neighborhood bar I remember as I waited out front for the bus going to elementary school.

I DON'T CARE WHAT ANYONE SAYS THIS PLACE IS CRACKIN ON SATURDAY NIGHTS! And I LOVE this place. Plus I only have to walk my drunk a$$ 3 blocks home.

HOLLA
author: Christina B.

description:
Tunnel Top is a great place to go if you want to get your groove on dancing on top of a staircase full of smoke.  The smoky haze improves the ambience and leaves you with a light headness which can be best explained as a slight euphoria.  The people who I danced with were mostly regulars and it didn't feel like a "sausage fest/meat market" that some bars can be like.  My girlfriends and I went here after having to endure a horrible night with some guys who stiffed us with most of the dinner bill.  The music tends to be down tempo and the pomegrante martinis and mojitos kick butt!  Tunnel Top will make you want to take a seat back, put your feet up, and chill out.  

Note:  Changed my earlier review because I will be hatching my revenge on these guys when I see them next. :)
author: Connie P.

description:
Cheap drinks, good space, great friends....a recipe for a disaster...or a good time.

In this case a good time.

I've been to Tunnel Top before, but it had been a while.  I forgot what a great place this is.  While it does strike me as more of a happy hour place, it's still going after 9pm.  Just enough people to make it interesting, but not so crowded that you feel overwhelmed.

Definitely a place I'll have to check out more!
author: Melanie N.

description: I dropped in on the early side (10:30?) to start the night. The place was somewhat dead, very loud and the decor is divey. I've heard they have a good happy hour crowd, but this doesn't seem to be a good weekend spot...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Barreling through the metered lights on Bush street, you're bound to miss it. But part of the charm is that, well, you do. Tunnel Top doesn't announce its presence with a long bouncer line, or try to front as THE "hottest spot in the city," but well, it very may well be. 

Stroll up to the non-descript door and the French mafia dude icily checks your ID. The zero cover (you heard me right!) alone lures you in. When you pull back the dark heavy door, you're greeted by the sounds of quite possibly, your fave song. A mixed neighborhoodsy Cheers crowd is boppin' heads to DJ Tin One. No bridge-and-tunnel folk here. Upstairs the crowd is groovin' to Tin One's seamless transitions between Beyonce to M.J. to Salt & Peppa to "Take On Me" mixed to just the right booty-shakin' beat. You're there an hour, then 2, then more and you realize that he just doesn't quit. Every single song is a great one. Every single beat gives you no choice but to just move. You just haven't done the TT until you've been on a Wednesday or Saturday night, foot tappin' to DJ Tin One.

The whole formula here is just right. The cash-only bar is roomy. People are actually comfortably seated at the bar and like - actually talking to each other. The friendly bartenders mix up my Fresh Watermelon Gimlet good and fast. I mosey on up the stairs to the mezzanine. I dance through the open floor, pass a few couches, and make my way to the bar tops along the wall. Damn my drink is good, and so is this song! I peer over the railing and watch the diverse crowds of people mingle in and saunter out. 

The place: chillax. The vibe: just right. The music: slammin'. At the end of the night the lights come on and the blisters on my feet finally summon me home.
author: Sharon C.

description: This place is great! It's a 2 story place with nooks with tables/couches for couples or groups. They project TV shoes on the wall - the time I was there it was Wonder Woman. How awesome!! It's a hispter type bar that welcomes all types. It's dark and intimate. The drinks are good. They music is good - although the quality of the speakers is a bit rough. It's a nice place to stop for a drink.
author: Dusty S.

description:
Ended up here at the end of the night.  I was a tad tipsy and MAN...It was packed and the girl/guy ratio was way off. (More males than females.)  I think the music was good, but I didn't pay attention much.  :p  

The upstairs was interesting and even more packed than downstairs.  I wasn't all that impressed I guess, nothing that remarkable or special going on.  But being one of the few girls here was amusing, I had plenty of guys attempting to chat me up.
author: Mary R.

description:
After hearing about Tunnel Top for FOREVER, last Wednesday I finally got to see what the fuss was about. 

It looks like nothing from the outside, but inside its a great, unique space that is perfect for meeting up with friends for a drink or two. It's a little dark and has a cozy neighborhood feel, with a DJ spinning some mellow songs early in the night. Specials are written above the bar in chalk. I picked the blackberry mojito off the board, and loved it! 

I'll be back again, and soon. This time I'll have more cash - be warned, they don't take cards.
author: Kelly C.

description: Best watermelon gimlet ever. Amazing music. Funky ambiance and friendly people. What more could you want? Ok, maybe a cleaner bathroom but...
author: Anina T.

description:
ah the tunnel top, where i had my first sidecar!  in another life i had unlimited use of the worldmark timeshare right across the street and spent many a night here drinking it up.  i'd also always inevitably end up here after enduring the cruel and unusual punishment that is being drug all over chinatown by some visiting family member.  (the only thing worse is the hell that's fisherman's wharf, but i'd need more then a cocktail or two to counteract that.)

the bartenders here are great and although tunnel top may exude a little "dive" vibe, i assure you they use fresh mixers and top notch booze.  you can always find a place to sit and chat too, which is a total plus.

now that i'm old i still enjoy coming here, especially before and after bar crudo-considering bar crudo is beer and wine only.  it's also a nice way to knock the class bar down a few pegs and really throw friends a curve ball.  nothing says sophistication like following a lovely meal next door with some shots and bad dancing at the tunnel. (i like to keep people guessing- like as in when will my liver will finally fail and i'll have to resort to reviewing medical supply stores and my doctors at kaiser.  until then folks i'll keep the bar and bakery reviews a comin'!)
author: Jessie J.

description: I recently ended up here on a random Saturday night and had the best time. It's a small venue but the good news is that it's not over populated and the DJ is awesome! He played a great mix of old school hip hop with a few top 40 sprinkled in here and there. The bar is downstairs and the sitting area/dance floor is upstairs. If you want a fun, chill place to listen to good music, dance, and drink reasonably priced drinks, come here!
author: Ragni A.

description:
Yeah, I'm scratching my head about the Tunnel Top. It's not a dive bar by any stretch - it's a bar designed to evoke a dive-bar charm for Marina dwellers that have ventured down to Union Square for a show, dinner, or a drink before heading home.

Then again, the bar offers a buck off their beers (Leffe Blonde, Beamish Stout, Sierra Nevada, Stella Artois were all on tap if I recall) during happy hour and $3.50 shots of Fernet Branca... I guess that's sort of dive. Oh, and they're cash only, that's dive as well. Actually, the whole bar is pretty well an authentic dive bar, except for the fact that the crowd was pure hipster who wouldn't venture into the Lower Haight even on a dare.

The bar gets a 3 star rating. Nice bartenders, well constructed cocktails and a very small selection of beer on tap ranging from Leffe and Beamish all the way down to the drek that is Stella Artois, the beer any self-respecting Belgian would hesitate to drink. Bring an ATM card because it's cash only (but they do have a bank machine). Make sure you have a fresh bottle of yuppie repellent if you want to have a real dive experience... but beware, spray it on too thick and you might be the only one left there.
author: Avery G.

description:
Last night I had these big plans to spare my liver a little grief and to shake my booty to a little salsa in the Mission. But when my party-girl partner in crime invited me out for a little post-work cocktail, who was I to decline? I figured that I'd roll in for one, be social for a bit, go home and change, and be on the dance floor by 10. Plus, they were going to the Tunnel Top, which is a relatively short jaunt up the hill from home.

I'd forgotten how much I love this place!! When I lived down the street this was my neighborhood bar. (except for the winter when the place is cold as hell) The drinks are reasonably priced, the bar staff fairly friendly, and the view when you step out with your smoking buddies for some *fresh* air is pretty amazing. And I love the wine-bottle chandelier. Very classy stuff.

I usually prefer to sit upstairs at one of the window tables, but when I arrived, Kristin and her co-workers had grabbed the big table downstairs. Funny that they chose a spot so conveniently located next to the bar. Nothing wrong with that, right? Right. Well, maybe there was a little problem. Let's just say, that the fine balance between the Maker's Mark and ginger-ale, combined with the geographic desirability of the bartender foiled my plans for the night.

Foiled meaning that by 9 we were heading into game-over territory. 

So much for sparing my liver.  And salsa dancing at that point would have been tantamount to assault... Maker's + ginger + salsa = DANGER on the dance floor, my friends. Never a pretty site. Many toes would have paid a serious price.

Whatever! I have no regrets. I love the Tunnel Top and would gladly ruin perfectly laid out plans to hang out here again. Only, next time I'm sittin' upstairs. Much better to be a little bit farther from the bartender.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
What a pleasant surprise.  

So my final appointment of the day suggested that we go for drinks somewhere near the area.  We start walking ... irish bank looked a little packed, loud and bright ... I just wasn't in that kind of mood.  We continue to huff and puff it up the ridiculous hill (and yeah, steer clear of this hill if you're sporting the heels, p.s.)  where alas we arrived at just what the doctor ordered.  

Inside was dark, really dark ... borderline creepy ... dive bar yet clean ... a little too crowded from the post happy hour crowd but the main floor area slowly cleared out a little, leaving two friendly stools at the bar for my friend and myself to pounce upon.  The bartenders are adorable but a little slow on the service ... at one point, I had enough time to talk myself out of another cocktail and in my book, that's not really good bartending.  But hey, drinks were cheap yet strong, crowd was a perfect mix of professionals and everyday people ... not too marina, not too mission but juuuuuuust right.  A pleasant way to ease out of one long week.
author: Sarah K.

description: During my stay in San Fran for the night, my friend and I searched up and down for bars to have a drink, chat, listen to music. We started with this one, it was a bit early in the night so wasnt too much goin on, but we liked the atomosphere. nice bar downstairs, casual, cool bartenders, and upstairs was a lounge to sit, talk, and listen to music. We then ventured out to go to a few other bars but ended up coming back here. By that time they had a DJ, who was mixing some great music of all types together. The drinks were way strong, but hey, if thats the only thing to complain about cant be that bad! They do only take cash, and the bartender was so cool he even gave us one on the house when my friend went to pay with CC. We stayed until closing, great place! will definatley go back.
author: Mahoney s.

description:
Love their Mojitos!...I have some pretty cool memories of this place.  One being the first time i was here for happy hour, i drank 4 mojitos, a beer, and 2-3 shots of whatever was passed to me.  My friend paul wanted to eat afterwards but I ended up going home at about 8pm and barfing all over the toilet.  Good stuff!!

Oh! and on thursdays (i think) they play some chilled down reggae.  it was fun cuz up the stairs they have couches and a small area where you can dance =)
author: ShayShay G.

description:
This bar is great for happy hour--$1 off beers and it's right downtown! I usually only go here after work for a few drinks because every time I come later at night, it's been lame. The DJ's aren't that good and the crowd is pretty much all guys--creepy guys.

Make sure to check out the restaurant next door, Bar Crudo. YUM.
author: Cindy P.

description:
I have no idea why I haven't been here sooner, believe it or not I used walk by this place on a daily basis back in 2001 but never got around to grabbing a drink. Last Friday I finally managed to go here and I absolutely loved it, I arrived at about 9:30 and even though there were a lot of people I ended up getting a seat at the bar. The drinks were stiff and I could tell a lot of people were enjoying their mojitos (saw a lot of fresh mint getting prepared).

The decor is great, really liked the cool chandelier that is made from beer bottles. I also thought it was cool that I was sitting at a bar only steps away from where part of one of my favorite movies was filmed, "The Game" starring Michael Douglas and Sean Penn, in the movie Sean Penn runs down the Stockton tunnel steps.

There was a DJ playing a solid selection of tunes and it was neat that he was on the balcony and that there was bit of an impromptu dance floor upstairs. Tunnel top is definitely shooting to the top of my downtown bar list.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Good drinks, good music, very chill atmosphere -- I like it! Only downside -- can get hella stuffy upstairs. Gone here on Wed nights and Sat nights - theyll play hip hop Sat nights and more house/dance on Wed.'s.

Love the decor concept and location. Yay for tunnel top!
author: Tejal D.

description: The idea of Tunnel Top is stellar.  Let's open a bar on top of the Stockton Tunnel.  And let's make this bar two stories.  And give it some serious mixology.  And make it all clean planks of wood.  The reality for me was not as rewarding.  I got a Strawberry Mojito.  It was a gorgeous drink.  Anybody would want take this drink to prom in the fanciest limo with the most glamorous corsage.  Yet, it's taste was more Sarah Plain and Tall than Jenna Jameson.  I did appreciate their decent happy hour specials.  Almost every drink had some form of discount.  Despite my mojito let down, the bar itself has a great vibe and if I happen to hit up a bar near Union Square again, I'd certainly consider Tunnel Top.  Yet, like any good local, I almost never go to Union Square.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I was stoked to finally check out the TT, but I have zero plans of returning after last night.

It was unbelivably crowded, I'm sure a definite fire violation, to the extent where you really could not move without getting a little too friendly with the other people in the bar.

By far the worst thing was the smoke. Smoke makes me feel unbelivably nauseous, not to mention the frightening health risks. Forbidding smoking in public establishments is one of the best laws that this lovely state ever passed. It wasn't just 1-2 cigarettes... at least 25% of the people were lighting up. As one of the staff/bouncers came by, I tried to see what I could do...

Me: Is smoking allowed in here?
Bouncer: No, definitely not!
Me: Can you please ask all these people to stop smoking?
Bouncer: Oh, I already asked them not to.
Me: Can you ask them again?
Bouncer: They won't listen to me.

What is the purpose of a bouncer, may I ask? Aren't they there to enforce the bar's rules and regulations?

As we were leaving, the bouncer pulled me aside and said he apologized that those patrons "wouldn't listen." Too little, too late, mister! My nice coat, clothes, and hair all reeeeked of disgusting smoke. Totally not okay :(

I will not be back to TT until they put the smokers where they belong: OUTSIDE!
author: Jill M.

description:
Pros:
No cover.
Decently priced drinks.
Super awesome and friendly bartenders.
Space to hang out downstairs, space to dance in the loft.
Fun music from the DJ.

Cons:
Not close to any other fun bars! Makes bar-hopping an extended drunken challenge.
DJ does the whole MTV thing where he keeps changing the songs before you get time to really enjoy them.

Observations:
Isn't it sort of a not-great idea to put the bar counter directly beneath a balcony where drunk people are likely to spill stuff over the edge?.. Anyway, I'm just sayin.

Overall: Fun spot to go start at when you can't decide on a place.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Welcome to the presupposed notion that once you enter this bar, I felt like I was walking into an old basement bar located at the back end of an alley  complete with Basque influences.  Add in the creepy guy standing at the railing on the second floor, and my visit here was complete.

After catching a show at the Punchline, I was introduced to this bar and am happy to say that my experience here was positive, despite the smell of errant piss on my way up the stairs leading to a balcony area set off with lounge benches, small tables along the windowed area, and the DJs spinning off to the side (that night was questionable, since the music was mediocre and the beats not too infective....I'd have preferred smoother ambient music to offset the mood.  But overall, I enjoyed this layout.  For the busier patrons downstairs, the bar was a good place to mingle and get smashed right into the guy next to you for an appropriate introduction.  Upstairs was for groups of friends/couples to concentrate on their special moments of social exchanges and verbal interaction.  The creep guy at the railing kept on looking back at us and perhaps it was the larger expanse of the white of his eyes bloating back at me....I told my friend that he was creepy.

I had the Blackberry Mojito, which at $7.50 not a bad deal in that there were a bunch of peppermint leaves as well as a few of the tangy berries crushed in the traditional recipe.  Sweet.  Tangy.  Just what I ordered.  

Would I be back?  I just may have to, to see what else stirs in this little hole in the wall.
author: Miika M.

description:
Great location right down the street from a friend's place.  Everytime i have been here before we sat upstairs which is fun and for the voyeur, but tonight was a sittin @ the bar experience.

Bartender was stand-off'ish and had seen us but decided to take orders from two other heads that arrived after us.  Once we got our drinks i noticed something different about this experience from the past...and my friend noted it was b/c of all the smoke upstairs--yeah that was it.  
Music was cool and made us kinda groove on our seats, but we kept hearing this distressing BUMP, THUMP sound that sounded like a crazy drunk falling all over the place.  We noticed some hipsters dancing and one of them came over to order a drink.  

I smiled and told her their party was the life of this bar--she responded that it was b/c her boss finally took them out for their Holiday party...hmm.  They were definitely not asian and i dunno why they would be celebrating the lunar new year...to our surprise, she told us they all work at Bliss Spa and have been crackin so no time off till now.

Oh yes, you ask what about that loud sound we a heard--yes, that was one of the manager's of bliss doing the splits--ouch ^ ^
author: omar b.

description:
I ended up here a few weeks ago with the brides of March. I used to come here when I lived in Nob hill. It's a great neighborhood bar. The staff is friendly. This bar is generally crowded on weekends. I prefer it during the week or daytime. Drinks are strong. Upstairs is perfect for handholding and making out.
Bathrooms are scary.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Yay! This place is always dependable. The layout of the place is awesome. They really made good use of the minimal space that they have to work with. 

Drinks are reasonable. I have never gone here and thought - "this music sucks," which means I always leave thinking -"this rotation rocks!"  

If you're looking for a place to shake your booty with a large group of friends, this is not the place to go. You could try, but it'd be too cramped.

But if you are in the mood to end up in a chill, lounge-y feeling place, then plan your next double date to make a stop at the Tunnel Top!

p.s. i smoke cigarettes. don't tell anyone...they let you smoke inside.
author: MrBoomBastic ..

description:
My friend Holly and I were upstairs.

This place should be busy in the winter. It's so close to places downtown, people'd want to come in from the rain. It's a small area. Warm. Dim. 
A Tuesday night here is probably mellow.

Any bar is wound-up like a woman. It's mood depending on which day of the week it is or by the weather outside. 


"I wouldn't come here on a Friday. People'd be hanging off that balcony. It had to be someone cheeky who decided on the name Tunnel Top," I said.

Holly's got holly-berry size eyes. They're small and green. She's serious and political. Her shirt is a wrap-around with a bow knot, tight, says she's lonely and single. 

I guess she was being earnest by being so quiet.  

She only said, let's move to the loft. 
She didn't say anything when we left and no one talked to us. 
I saw the disappointment.
author: Jenny T.

description: Love this place. Gave it 4 stars only because it was extremely packed and they only had two bartenders and 1 bar. But other than that this place is so fun and perfect  for a night out in beautiful San Francisco. The watermelon drink is deliciousssss
author: Maya M.

description:
The first time I went there, I kept thinking it was called "tug job".  I could NOT figure out why anyone would call a bar tug job.  Well, it's not called tug job, but it was entertaining to see text messages the next day that I sent to friends saying that I was getting a drink at tug job...

This place is not my classic scene.  Let's not lie, I'm sort of a Marina girl, but a cool one, I swear.  I randomly went to Tunnel Top one night with a group of friends and really wasn't expecting much.  I always pass it when driving to the Sutter-Stockton lot, and honestly, it doesn't look all that cool from the outside.

The crowd is definitely diverse, there is a huge range of the types of people who frequent this place, I don't think anyone would feel awkward here.  It's really small and intimate with great DJs.  The coolest thing about this place is the wine bottle chandelier.  It is crazy awesome.  I want to make one for my house, although I'm sure mine wouldn't be as cool.

I think this would be a great place to rent out for a private party - just the right size (although I'm not sure they actually do that sort of thing...).  I wouldn't spend all night here, but it's the kind of place that everyone should stop by once or twice...
author: Caitlin D.

description:
After a year and a half of both living and working just one short block away from this place, I still can't figure out whether it's a blessing or a curse.  It's all too easy to kick off my heels, suit & panty hose (not by choice, people) after a long day and make the short trek to this oh-so-convenient watering hole.  The moment I let my hair down and slip into my comfy jeans & converse, I find myself with thoughts of the Tunnel Top dancing through my head.
