The ambiance is fun, the cocktails are decently priced (and strong!), and the DJ spins some pretty swanky tunes.  Yes, I'm the one usually singing along in the corner, oblivious to your annoyed glances.  

Deal with it.

I'd love to give it 5 stars... and I will if they stop allowing people to smoke inside.   It's just uncool to get home and strip off the evening's attire, unable to shake the Smoky McSmokster smell from my long locks. 

Boo on the smoking.  Yay on the drinking!!

Cheers, folks!
author: Whitney H.

description: What's not to love about Tunnel Top? From the hot Albanian manning the door to sexy Brian behind the bar. That's right. Hot Damn! He's good looking. And talk about the perfect place to fernet about all your worries. By far one of my favorite places to drink too much on a weeknight before crawling into work the next day with a pounding headache and the taste of vodka and fernet popping up in my mouth every 10 seconds (today may or may not be one of those days). I may be a glutton for punishment, but you know what? Just the happy vibe and good feelings (and fernet shots) at Tunnel Top make it all worthwhile. Oh, and the music doesn't suck either.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Wow, there are so many reviews of the Tunnel Top but because I just love this place, I want to put it in writing.  

Having a drink at the Tunnel Top, on Saturday afternoon is pure heaven.  I sat at the bar with my companion, looking out the window at people walking across the bridge, taking photos and thoroughly enjoying their day while we enjoyed our day from inside this cozy cool bar.  

This bar is sexy but not in a cheesy way.  It's understated and cool.  MC Solar is playing on the jukebox.  The most beautiful young French Mademoiselle was tending bar, and she was so sweet with cocktail mixing skills to match.  If you want to see the sweet bartender, go soon because she told a tale of a lovelorn art student aching for her boyfriend back in Paris.  She is torn between staying in San Francisco for another year of art school or returning to Paris in 4 days because she is in love.  Le coeur appelle. . . 

In the middle of the bar, hanging from the ceiling, is a huge chandelier made completely of old wine bottles lit from within.  You feel like you're in Europe but not euro. . .

. . .if you ache for a Europe fix but cannot make a trip, take a short trip to Tunnel Top.  Tres Bon!
author: James M.

description:
Great bar, although all the fruit and mint muddling can get the bartenders in the weeds with the customers who only want a draft beer. The bartenders have accents and names like Jean-Francois and Markus, although they might be theater students from Modesto for all I know. The crowd is hipster, although I feel right at home in my acid-washed Silver Tab Levis.

Otherwise, I enjoy the music and the vibe and the drinks. Last time I was there I met some random couple and ended up in the basement of a restaurant in Chinatown losing money in a dice game. What is there not to like about that?
author: Mack N.

description:
I have lived 50 yards from Tunnel Top for a year before I stepped foot into this place. The reason that I hesitated was I thought it reeked from the outside.  Finally when I did, the first time I thought it was dirty and left right away.  Second time, my friends weren't feeling it and found the drinks weak.  

Third time's a charm!  Magically, my preconceived notions that it were smelly and dirty vanished.  It was Monday night and my boyfriend and I wanted to go somewhere chill to grab a drink and chat.  I have a list of pros to report:
1) I often hear people speak of cool and friendly bartenders.  For me, until tonight, the concept has been hypothetical.  I didn't ask for his name, but I have met my first nice bartender.  By that, I mean, he didn't just make my drink and completely ignore me.  He looked me in the eye, smiled occasionally, and explained to me the different music themes they have every night.
2) My boyfriend and I could actually hear each other and have a conversation without screaming on top of our lungs.  The power of hearing also remained fiction until tonight.

Maybe my standards are too much below the curve, but I was totally amused to have these wonderful amenities within the same block that I live on.  This will become our new Monday night hot-spot.
author: Lily T.

description:
WOW WOW WOW! That's a strong drink yo! Thats what i said to my friends once I sipped my Long Island. I love the idea of getting my money's worth, but DAMN. . . .. . . tunnel top's drinks are strong like a mo fo. I can take my fair share of drinks/ shots and very happy for my $8 Long Island.

I thought it was a fluke how strong the drinks were, but all my friends had strong drinks too. Thanks bartender. As an experniment and already buzzed, I decided to order an AMF to test my theory. Yes, boys and girls, the AMF was also very strong and for $8. 

Nice place to go kick it. Not sure about the parking. gets kinda hard on the weekends. Good DJ spinning the 1s and 2s. 

One last thing, while we kept ordering drinks, our bartender messed up on a drink and gave it to us for free. For an Asian, thats like the best thing in the world, FREE! I love you!
author: David L.

description:
My favorite bar in the city hands down! 

It features the essentials for a solid SF bar: good music, eclectic mix of people, and Fernet. The downstairs bar area can be a little cramped, but you can make your way upstairs to enjoy your drink or the scene. The upstairs area adds a little twist to your bar experience. The benches along the wall provide a good amount of seating, while the walkways leading up to the dj booth also make it a great place to get down or just people watch. The crowd is generally energized, so you're definitely going to have a fun evening no matter what time it is. The DJs play a good blend of music, some nights playing old school hip-hop and other nights playing some funky house.
author: Neil R.

description:
A great place to go for happy hours with friends and colleagues.

I couldn't believe 4 beers came out to $15 tip included.
 Are you kidding me? Give me another 5 rounds please.

This is a cash only bar.
author: Tony N.

description: Wandered in here for a drink to decide where the night will take us...five drinks later. First things first, solid pricing for the proximity to Union Square and price hikes and a neat layout for the bar/building. The upstairs area had a nice atmosphere, decorated well, and comfortable.I can only attest to the beer selection but I have heard good things about some interesting cocktails. I will be returning.
author: Michael C.

description: My neighborhood bar! Great drinks, great people. Bryan is great! I wonder how 1 bartender can manage the entire bar...amazing..I kinda wish the lights were a little brighter though.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I may be biased because Tunnel Top is a short stumble from home, and any time I find a place where I can walk less than 3 minutes and have a cold drink in my hand, is just fine with me! I carried my stiff vodka soda upstairs and sat myself next to a chalk board, which, oddly enough, says not to write on it. Huh!? You put a chalkboard with fresh chalk 8 inches from my face and expect me not to scribble? Also, the movie on the wall was a nice touch, but "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles?" Oh well, did I mention, less than 3 minutes!? Stiff drink? Done and done.

Update: DO NOT GO ON A WEEKEND. I repeat NO WEEKENDS! How sad - TT turns into a crowded douche disaster. I'm seriously considering only leaving my apartment Sun-Thurs from here on out...

Update #2: DO go on a Tuesday! Bring your favorite dancin' shoes and sweat-absorbing clothing for a sweaty, sexy Salsa experience.
author: Valerie N.

description:
Shockingly pleasant...

I was a bit hesitant when I was coerced into entering the tunnel top. To my surprise I felt comfortable and at ease... The music was a Latin Jazz sound and people were doing the tango upstairs. It reminded me of a bar I'd find in Punta del Este (you cant tell, but that is where my Spanish father is from).Those Latin folks love to dance and where ever the music is they are dancing. It didn't look to me as a specific dancing bar, but oh how they know how to turn it into one. 

I enjoyed the diversity and good vibe. The bar was small, but not overly crowded. You might find me back here, but I dont know how many friends I'll be able to drag to this somewhat sketchy area.
author: Dee C.

description:
Do you want an awesome local bar with great service and cheap drinks? The Tunnel Top is your answer. Why would you settle for less?

Straddled on top of the Stockton tunnel on Bush Street, the Tunnel Top is filled with a mixed crowd. Hardcore neighborhood patrons, business yuppies, and hip young people but never douche bags. The bar is tiny with friendly bartenders that know how to pour and make a real drink.  They only accept cash but for the amazing prices of the drinks, it doesn't even matter. 

The Tunnel Top specializes in making mixed drinks from mojitos to martinis - ranging from $5 bucks to $9 bucks. But what makes this place special is the fact that they play good movies on the screen across the bar ranging from Hitchcock (the creepy, "Vertigo") to Kubrick (the creepy, "Eyes Wide Shut"). On the top deck of the bar, their are couches for bigger groups and on certain nights, DJs show up later in the evening and spin some good tunes. Even when you're drinking after work, the play list is usually playing something good.

Libby - the bartender is super sweet and friendly. She knows how to make a killer drink. Her reason? "I make my drinks the way I'd want to drink them." That's when you know this is the kind of local bar you go to. My strong Jameson and ginger ale - which they used real ginger ale instead of watered down sprite/coke was only $5 bucks. 

The Tunnel Top makes a good drink, so bring some good friends and you'll find nice place to hang out. 

(Bonus: There are hooks under the bar to hang your purse/coat. That's ultimate when you are drunk and too tired from caring your personal items.)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Amazing location, great bar, relaxed feel.

Drinks are served at a reasonable price, and you can find an array of tables, couches and chairs upstairs if you're in the mood for something a little more intimate. Seating upstairs next to the window overlooks the street, a great place to people watch if you're in to that. Enjoy the atmosphere with that special someone or with a group of your closest friends.

My only negative criticism about this place is that the men's bathroom didn't have a lock on the door. How am I supposed to do my business with the fear of being walked in on? Normally I'd use my legs as a kickstand to prevent the onslaught of some inebriate trying to enter, but even my lanky legs couldn't reach the door. A little privacy, please?
author: Matthew M.

description: They have a dj every night starting around 10pm. They don't serve food, but will let you order, or bring in your own take out. It's true that it kind of looks like a dump from the outside. I was pleasantly surprised, especially with the upstairs area.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Good drinks ( at least the scotch-and-soda ).
Good seating ( some will disagree ).
Good atmosphere ( if you like dimly lit ).


There's a DJ on weekends, and loud music. Since I go to bars to
meet people and talk, the presence of loud music on weekends makes
this place strictly weekday-only.
author: Max R.

description: great happy hour spot- I love how the bartender uses the ice shredder for the ice in the drinks. Also, the urine smell in the stairway and the massage parlor sign are very unique
author: Jim B.

description:
Tunnel Top contains the following:

1) A chandelier made out of wine bottles
2) A mezzanine level that surrounds the first floor of the bar, where if you feel like smoking, they will look the other way.
3)  Also on the mezzanine level,  a large screen where classic movies such as "Bullit" and the occasional Japanime-type flick are in constant rotation.
4) A laid-back, unpretentious crowd
5) Good music that is neither the standard juke-box fare found at most dive-types, nor the annoying House muzak that every lounge-type bar in the city seems to play.
6) Good bartenders

Why am I not drinking there right now?  I'm not really sure.  Maybe because it's Monday?
author: Andrew E.

description:
Oh snap, I'm cross-posting! (See sister review of Amber.)

Dude, I come here for the smoking/drinking combo. That's it. This either means Tunnel Top gets an A or an F depending on who you are so I need not say much more.

Perhaps the most irksome thing about Tunnel Top is the fact that it's a member of the C.O.D.C. (Cash or Die Collective). Seriously, when are bars going to get a clue? Haven't they heard of that one study where researchers found that people who use credit cards tend to spend exponentially more than those who don't because it happens to be way easier to charge a piece of plastic than it is to part with cold, hard cash? Oh wait, I forgot. Bars are totally not in the business of making money.
author: Jenn W.

description: Dont be fooled by the dive-y looking exterior! I live a stone's throw away & went here for happy hour a few weeks ago & it was a good time. Decent drinks, good service, cool crowd & places to chill & hang out.
author: Lily R.

description:
For someone who doesn't smoke, I'm amazed I am giving the Tunnel Top 4 stars - cuz it's a smoking bar, but whatever...

Go to the Tunnel top for two reasons:  The bartenders know how to pour a drink (read: they are generous but not ridiculous, the drink you'll get is perfectly strong and worth the $) and the MOJITOS.  WTF, you are probably saying, but I swear, they make an awesome mojito!  I love to come here early, before the smokers get here, like after a Chinatown shopping spree, around 6pm and sit upstairs at the window drinking a delicious mojito.  Yummers!  

The Tunnel top is a great after work place too, if you work downtown.  If I was a smoker, I'd probably love this place late, too...I've had a few late nights here and it's fun but I don't dig the smoky clothes the day after. What can I say, for a NY girl, I've been in Cali way too long....
author: Jessica B.

description:
5 stars for being hip.
5 stars for the ecletic crowd
5 stars for the smoke. though i don't anymore.
5 stars for cool factor.
5 stars for music
5 stars for whatever's playing on the wall.
5 stars for keeping it dark...cause i sure as hell don't want to see what it's like in the light.
author: benjamin c.

description:
Since it's right down the street from Masa's, we decided to check out Tunnel Top for a drink (or two) after dinner. I'm glad we checked it out because it's definitely a bar worth coming back to. 

It's small, but has two floors, so appears to be more spacious. Upstairs DJs spin some great dance music and it's more of a dance club atmosphere, while downstairs is your typical SF bar scene.

It's not pretentious or super fancy, just a local neighborhood joint that happens to be right off of Union Square, although it seems like it should be in a true neighborhood. 

My best friend accidentally mistook a $20 for a $100 bill and didn't collect the change from the drinks she ordered and didn't realize it until after we left. We figured $80 in change was worth going back for, so we showed up 45 minutes later and the bartender had put the money aside and gave it to us. Now that's an honest bartender!
author: Lee H.

description:
Went to Tunnel Pop based on a friend's recommendation while we were in SF for the Outside Lands Fest in Aug.  We went there on a Thursday night and it wasn't too crowded or anything, but there were still a good amount of people there.

I enjoyed myself very much while we were there.  The drinks there are dirt cheap compared to most bars anywhere.  4 drinks only cost me 20 bucks is allllllriiight w/ me.  The only downer is that its a cash bar only, so I had to go downstairs to Stockton to this liquor store to get some cash.  Other than that, Tunnel Pop is an awesome place to go to get some cheap, STRONG drinks and chill out.
author: Danny S.

description:
I never really understood the appeal of this bar. The name is awesome, but it's always over crowded, and the DJs blast everything way too loud.

Not a good place to meet new people imho.

The drinks are good, but with all alcohol it eventually starts tasting like water anyway.

My advice is go elsewhere!
author: Jonah R.

description: A great little bar and easy to park close by. The best thing are the prices...totally reasonable for a cocktail, about 6-bucks.
author: Scott M.

description:
I loved the Tunnel Top. Location is fab, and so is the joint. It's dive on one hand, and sort of classy gothic on the other. A typical French underground hangout (as the owner/bartender is French). Their music selection is also pretty good connected with the ambience : Massive Attack, State of Bengal, Moby.

It's pretty cosy too.
author: Sav B.

description:
for my 50th review, I wanted to review something special. So it's a review for my favoritest bar in the world.

I used to come here all the time; it was the only decent place to get a drink after work; back when I was in the financial district. 

Justin was often the bartender and he was just the best ever! He made super great negronis and they use dried cherries in their old fashions and manhattans (this was before Rye and Bourbon and Branch was around). Sometimes, my friend Danna and I would bring fresh fruit (peaches, pears, etc) and Justin would make special drinks for us using the fruit. 

I came here so often, they let me play records on the dj set up upstairs. Super fun! I love forcing people to listen to Grant Green, Roy Ayers and Brand Nubians. 

They always play good movies too...the Warriors, Suicide Club, Ichi the Killer. 

I haven't been here since I quit smoking, but one of my favorite past times was coming here for a dirty martini and a Parliament Light.

I love this place.
author: Leslie Ann R.

description:
Tunnel Top is a great concept and such a cool little tucked away spot. You feel like you've been let in on a little secret when you're there. The inside is dark and sultry, they have a bunch of good, reasonably priced drinks and the staff is friendly. The strawberry mojito and the mint julep were both stiff and tasty.

One of its best features is that they have DJs spinning every night of the week. The hip-hop DJ who was spinning the night I was there was great and played a nice mix of music. 

Overall a great spot to check out after work or for a few cocktails before a night out.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Yummy mojitos... a must try.  

We stumbled upon this place and kind of freaked out since it's so close to the Green Door Massage parlor and went hmm... what kind of place is this?  But upon going inside, I realized it was pretty nice and the crowd wasn't too bad.

The DJ was so good.  I mean it's loud, but he plays Justin Timberlake all the time so I know we'd form a good relationship.  I just love JT!  

The place was a little hot and crowded, but I kind of like the balcony area.  I did get dizzy going down the stairs after drinking those mojitos.  oh so good.  I would say all of our friends enjoyed that place and probably had too much to drink there.  

The worst part was seeing that girl wear the too short skirt.  so not flattering.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Don't let the incongruous liquor store-like sign inhibit you from entering this not-so-dive bar.  In fact, if you consider it to be so, you're better off dropping $20 for cover at a place like Ruby Skye.  The lower level is a dark tavern, but if you trek to the upstairs balcony, the scene changes to a Euro-style lounge.  Try to score a window seat around the corner from the dj booth.  This way, you'll not only be entertained by your conversation partner, but also by the view of a fight being broken up by the 5-0 as well as that of a homeless junkie getting his first fix of the night.

Pros: chill music, interesting decor, mixed clientele, stiff libations, view of Bush street from balcony
Cons: smoking allowed, view of Bush street from balcony
author: Momo R.

description:
I had my heart broken in this bar, and I *still* love this place. With nearly 250 reviews, it's not hard to tell that there are a lot of fans of the Tunnel Top, and I'm one of them.

Cold Stella Artois and - frankly - generous shots by the bartenders make this a place where I generally remember arriving but rarely remember leaving. The dark interior, odd proximity to the Stockton Tunnel, upstairs tables and candlelight all add to the intrigue and allure of this Nob Hill stalwart.
author: West R.

description: Bam !!! It is what it is.  A great dive bar on top of a tunnel in SFO.  Low prices. Great location, good beer, crappy furniture . Love it.
author: Douglas F.

description:
If you want to meet a wide range of people - this is a good spot. Tourists, EBers, locals, etc all come to this lively bar. I've been there for happy hour and for late night partying. You are all crammed so close together it's impossible not to make new friends!
It's cash only and the drinks are mid-priced ($5-6?). Bartenders are cool - the bouncer is hilarious. The music is always good!
author: Elsa E.

description: Good thing they have an upstairs area, otherwise I'm not sure how many people they can really fit into this bar. I liked this bar because it actually felt like one, diverse people, small and homey feeling, and nice drink menu.  I settled with a blueberry mojito and normally I don't like them, but this was delicious.  Not too much mint and the fresh blueberries on the bottom made it taste delicious.
author: Rachel L.

description: I enjoy Tunnel Top especially during happy hour. I love the granola on the bar as bar food too. The upstairs level is really fun with comfortable seating, movies on the wall, and fun music. This is a very chill bar where I could spend a lot of time. It usually isn't too packed because I think it's still a bit of a secret. I celebrated a friend's birthday here too and they let us bring in our own cake which another friend (a pastry chef) had made and was amazing! Very cool bartenders and patrons and a great place to stop by!
author: Meghan P.

description: I had heard about this place a bunch of times, but only recently stopped in. Tiny, but not cramped, reasonably priced beers, super mellow, upper level with good people watching spots, not too loud...my kind of place. Note: I wandered in on a weeknight...I'm sure it's packed on a weekend.
author: Karena Q.

description:
Scenario: Friday night and out with a friend for drinks.

Product: Drinks were slightly over-priced around $6-7 for something decent.  The blackberry mojito was unique, but average in terms of flavor.

Service: The bar was crowded but the bartender served us quickly, so brownie points there.  He seemed pretty attentive.

Atmosphere: Comfy at first and it's great if you can get a seat at the bar or upstairs on the catwalk.  The seats are shaped a little odd, almost like they want you to sit sideways at the bar.  The bathroom line can get confusing with multiple doors and standing areas.  The music got loud as the night went on, though I've never been a fan of music so loud it makes you shout convo with your friends.  To me, it should just be background noise.  There is a parking garage nearbye.

Uniquity: It's above the tunnel.
author: Robert R.

description:
I found myself in this bar to meet up with friends a couple weeks ago. Just a note to the other reviewers, dive bars don't have DJs and movies projected onto walls. That's not to say that the Tunnel Top isn't hip or a neighborhood joint - it's both of those things; it's just not a dive. Superpremium alcohol was available, and the well liquors were good quality.

The upstairs wasn't crowded when I visited, but the couches/chairs weren't really comfortable. Take note that when reviewers give it five stars and mention that you can smoke here, they're giving it 5 stars because you can smoke there, not because it's one of the best bars in San Francisco.
author: Timothy O.

description:
A coincidence that this red-lit red bar that plays sultry cuts and serves turbo-strong drinks is located conveniently next door to a "massage parlor"? 

I think not.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
I frequently find myself at Tunnel Top because I'm waiting for my table at Bar Crudo. 
I love grabbing a beer and sitting upstairs looking out the window, this bar has a nice vibe. 
I like that they try and use fresh juice in their drinks, so when I'm in the mood for a blackberry mojito, for example...yum....
author: Bianca L.

description:
I have always liked Tunnel Top for its fun crowd and well-made drinks, but a recent Saturday experience has raised my estimation of this bar even higher.

My friend J. and I met here to begin our Celebration of Giving Two Weeks Notice (yes, that was the official name of the evening). We settled into a spot upstairs with our mojitos and proceeded to enjoy our drinks, people watch, and bounce to the music. It was still early-ish, and the DJ was making us want to dance so we left Tunnel Top in search of a club that would suit our dancing needs. Two hours, three clubs, and one slice of pizza later we were back at Tunnel Top dancing upstairs and kicking ourselves for ever leaving such perfect music.

In my opinion, Tunnel Top has the best of all worlds: 
1) Plenty of places to sit, talk, and meet people 
2) Great drinks
3) Great dance music
author: Abigail R.

description: Tunnel top is a casual bar in SF that has that local feel. I actually like bars that are dark and this is one of them. The drinks were pretty good, the staff was friendly and the crowd was cool. We met some Irish pilots there so we ended up drinking more than planned but we had a great time. The bar has been here forever , and I hope it stays that way.
author: Emily B.

description: Absolute worst bartender.  I asked for a Batida w Malibu he made it wrong  i sent it back & said he didn't here me. But took 3 other orders before he re made my drink. Not good. I'm a bartender if I made something wrong it would be my first priority. 0 star if there was. I would have posted it. My friend just ordered anther for me & the same, wrong!!! Uhhhhh really?????!  Monday night bartender needs to be fired.
author: Evette M.

description: I came here with a small group of people late on a weekday night, maybe between 11 and 12. We proceeded to take over the upper floor. It wasn't very crowded around this time. I'll have to come back because I remember liking the atmosphere.
author: Ken L.

description:
Ah, one of the best "dive bars"/"neighborhood" bars in he city. My honey and I took yesterday off to recover from Folsom, so we shared a bottle of wine in Union Square to cap off the afternoon. Afterwards decided that before our dinner plans, we would hit the Tunnel Top.
Granted it was early, so we missed the big crowds that make up this great happy hour.
Pomegranite Cosmo's, Lemon Drops and more for $6, all beer $1 off...cheap drinks, great crowd (even when slow) and some of the best bartenders in the city. 
I especially love it when the Parisian girl is working and plays some rockin' chill and house music!
author: Jason D.

description:
Tunnel Top is a nifty little place to grab a drink. It's location has potential for being a low-key, off the beaten path kinda joint but I don't think that's always the case. I've heard of some pretty rockin' crazy nights there.

I've know of Tunnel Top for years and just checked it out for the first time. I was quite impressed to be honest. For some reason I expected much more of a dive. 

It's a small place with just bar seating downstairs. Upstairs is more spacious with tables and lounge seating.

The bartender was friendly, attentive and made a good vodka gimlet. The scene this particular night was nice and mellow which is totally my speed.
author: alexa c.

description:
Good drinks. Cool atmosphere. I liked the stools. 

I wish I could remember more.
author: Erin F.

description:
Tunnel Top rocks.

Great music.  Sometimes there's a DJ spinning.  Sometimes there's some random '70s Jamaican film playing on the wall.

Drinks are pretty solid.  No complaints there.  I'm not sure what city policy is, but the place is pretty smoky (buyer beware).  Nonetheless, its good for variety.

I wish the place was a little bigger.  I know, but then it wouldn't be as intriguing, but que sera. 

This is the prefect place for a drink with old friends that are in town for some sorta bizarre Organic Chemistry conference being held downtown.  Or maybe a first stop before heading out for the evening.

Definitely a good vibe with this place.
author: M S.

description:
Personally I would not consider this a dive bar.  This is a Great Bar, with Great Music, a Great layout and a Great Vibe.
I went for the first time this Friday and would have gone back on Sat, had it not been St Patty's day.
The drinks were strong and cheap and the layout reminded me of the French Quarter in New Orleans.   I enjoyed the lounging seating upstairs and the make-shift dance party and sing along.
I would recommmend this bar for small groups...and even though I've never been after work...it seems like this would be the place to be.
Can't wait to go back.
author: Whitney K.

description:
Tunnel Top! Perfect neighborhood dive bar for me - a movie playing and a mojito in hand, it's comfy and the bartenders still know my face after a few years of not coming. It's _my_ Cheers bar, where the drinks are yummy, and there is always a sweet kiss on the cheek.

Mojito alternative - Ginger Rogers. :)
author: dj z.

description: This place will always hold a special place in my heart as I spent a lot of time here when I lived in SF.  Two stories, dark wood, great drinks, great music, indoor smoking tends to happen by accident I'm sure... all in all, a great place to lounge out with friends while have some cocktails.
author: C. H.

description: One of my favorite places to drink in the entire city.  From the outside it looks a bit shady, but once you are inside the atmosphere does a complete 180.  Great place to head after dinner.  Good selection of top shelf liquors and no cover.  Just go.
author: Luke D.

description:
My ultimate barfly bar is the Tunnel Top. It's the type of place where you can immediately become friends with all the bartenders and regulars (mostly TenderNob locals). At the same time, the place will fill with random Bridge and Tunnel gawkers, tourists and out-of-towners (how do these people find this place?) It's kind of like a cross between Cheers and Studio 54.  

When I feel like going to a bar alone, this is the one I prefer.  I've never had an issue with the customers and the staff and security take  good care of me. Sure, there's lots of people hooking up, but it's also a place where you can have an interesting conversation with a total stranger and not get creeped out . At least 10  regulars I met at the Tunnel Top  blossomed from random drinking buddy to my best friend. 

It is truly a unique space- so check it out.  The smoke and the volume of the speakers upstairs are too loud, but the staff is awesome.

 Oh, and ladies- be warned, if you have a short skirt on, don't stand along the railing upstairs, everyone at the bar can see your granny panties.
author: Lisa R.

description: Even though Tunnel Top is just a short ways away from my apartment, I hadn't been there in years.  I had an old friend in town and it was close to his hotel so it worked out that I was able to check it out again.  I went for happy hour and getting a draft beer for $3 tastes great no matter where it is but the bartender was friendly and on top of his game even though it was just him in a crowded bar.  The atmosphere is cool and the later it gets the more folks come in and becomes more lively but even right after work it's a cool place to chill, have a drink and unwind.
author: Blake B.

description: Cool bar...but call ahead and check what's going on the night you're going. Can be pretty hit or miss. Went on salsa or tango night and it was a sausage-fest. The girls in our group were constantly pestered.
author: Rich W.

description:
People always talk about this place and I never had a desire to check it out because it seemed really out of the way and kinda ghetto.

While nearby miscreants do urinate on the steps of the Stockton tunnel, this place is really a gem. The space is very open for a neighborhood bar and it's no frills. I love the way the inside looks like a ship's saloon - everything from the conspicous wooden cross beams to the ornate cast-iron chandelier hanging from its high cielings.

Drinks are moderately priced and the music is just loud enough to drown out the other table's conversations while you are able to have a great time with your friends. Excellent spot to "make your own"

I really had a great time here and felt an instant rapport with the establishment. I took one star off for it being CASH ONLY -  that's annoying in 2009, cmon..
author: Peter K.

description:
WOW, this place is TINY, but very cool.  I chose to have my birthday soiree here with about 11 friends on Friday.  It was SO MUCH fun:)  Love the vibe and the crowd.  Drinks were fairly well made, sometimes too strong. 

The bartenders were nice and pretty quick for a packed bar.
Always had a clean table, free of empty glasses and shot glasses!  The atmosphere was dark and the music wasn't too loud.  But you know how the octave rises when a bunch of drunkards get together while having a good time?! 

A FUN time with good friends and DON'T forget your CASH.  It's a cash only bar:)
author: Kat M.

description:
I had walked by this place a million times and was always a bit intimidated by the neighborhood. It's kind of sketchy to walk up the stairwell under the Stockton bridge late at night by yourself. However, after dinner last week, my date asked if I (a) wanted to grab a night cap and (b) if I liked funk and old school hip hop and pop. Ummm, seriously? Is that a real question?? We walked in and scored a seat at the bar. Drinks are pretty cheap, the bartender is not only cute but friendly and they played any entire block of Prince music. This is my new fave dive bar.

The only down side is it's absolute insanity on weekends with tourists. I recommend checking it out for happy hour during the week.
author: Lynsey C.

description: OMG This place has gotten WAY TOO CROWDED!! Stop Pushing me!!
author: Karen T.

description:
"They've made some good changes since I was here last. They've improved the unwieldy layout as much as one can, but it still is frustrating trying to get a drink if there are more than 30 people present. They did replace the skanky, god-knows-what-has-happened-on
-these couches with a crowd-friendly E shaped banquette upstairs, and the movie screen is a nice touch. 
I spent some time mingling with the rookies here on New Year's Eve and can say with confidence that I did not have a miserable experience. I even learned a couple of lessons:

When a friend who has been doing the MDMA jitterbug for the last hour begs to be your "wingman", give him a big hug, throw something shiny on the floor and make your move while he is distracted.

and...

There is NO sexy way to say "spelunking.""
author: Big S.

description:
After hitting up the First Thursday at 49 Geary my friends and I were trying to brainstorm cool bars close to Union Square.  Then it hit me... Tunnel Top! I haven't been there in a while.  You can smoke upstairs, usually have a pretty cool dj, happy hour goes until 8, and has a weird dirty euro vibe.

So this time I noticed no one smoking inside, maybe they changed their policy (or lack there of).  But they still had an awesome happy hour with a lot of options and I love that you can sit upstairs and look down at the bar or out onto the street, very good for people watching.
author: Katie M.

description:
My friend was buying the next round so I told her to surprise me (even though I normally hate surprises), and she got me a watermelon shot.  Best surprise ever.  Sweet, smooth, and refreshing...I might as well have been downing watermelon juice.  There was even some seeds floating about in it.   I'm not real big on fruity drinks, but now I am ALL about the watermelon shots.

As for the bar scene, it was decent.  Crowded and sweaty, not surprising for a Saturday night.  But even if the crowd had been super lame or extra douche-tastic, I would still come back for the watermelon drinks.  Next time I'll have to try to watermelon martini.  Or maybe the watermelon gimlet.
author: K P.

description:
This is one of, if not my absolute, favorite bar in the city. I've never had a bad time here.

First, hit up the ATM because they only accept CASH. Then order your first drink and notice how strong and cheap it is. They also always have blueberry vodka, which I love.

The bar has this awesome chandelier made out of wine bottles. There is a hanging DJ stand and an upstairs with a couch and some chairs and a balcony with seating that looks over the bar. It can get very crowded on certain nights but even when it's crowded, the crowd is pretty cool. 

It is literally located right over the Stockton Tunnel, but don't try running down the stairs to make-out with someone in private because it always smells like urine down there.
author: Jackie G.

description:
This is a coo spot. Always end up coming here when the original plan has failed miserably...good music, strong drinks, and the upstairs lounge is pretty tight.  I DON'T KNOW WHY WE DIDN'T COME HERE INSTEAD OF LITTLE BAOBAB LAST WEEK RISS!!!

Next time I'm just gonna suggest we make this the destination instead of just when something else hasn't worked out. No more Broken Record. No more Little Baobob. No more Skylark!
author: EJ S.

description:
I'll stop in here every so often for a quick drink... it's right down the road from my place, and it's located right atop the Stockton tunnel stairs, making it a prime place to grab a cab to continue the activities elsewhere.

As for the place itself, there's the downstairs with the bar, and the upstairs with some couches and tables. It's nicer on weekday nights when there's a good chance of actually grabbing a seat, but that's of course not something unique to Tunnel Top.

I dunno... I know some people who really like this bar, and others who can't hold back their hate. I don't especially feel one way or the other, but if you're in the area, I'd give this place the ol' recommendation.
author: Chris M.

description: I am always on a mission to find a bar that serves ginger beer for my not so popular "dark and stormy" fix and I finally found one just a few blocks from my office.  Score!
author: Phon H.

description:
Epic!!
cheap and yummy drinks!
the mojitos are amaaaaaaazing
and the bartenders are really nice!
The upstairs area is fun to dance and there is a seating area if you have a big group!!
The only down side is it's cash only, but I guess getting out cash and only using that helps to not spend that much money? haha

anyway tunnel top= amazing
author: Laura R.

description:
My favorite bar in the city.

Don't call it a dive bar.  One of the few places in the city where every neighborhood is well represented.  Marina kids, mission hipsters, soma whatever-they-ares, and cool kids in general are all well-represented, as are the smattering of tourist who got lost trying to find union square.

Points for lighting and the bottle chandelier. Double points for having cool movies and sights on the projector.  Also, the beer selection is small, but well chosen.  any place where you can get good belgian beer and a pbr is alright in my book.  

The only thing that subtracts a star is the smoking policy.  People tend to smoke upstairs, and despite me thinking that adds to the charm, I've had a few friends want to leave right away.  bummer.
author: james s.

description:
Wow, I didn't realize that 165 folks have reviewed this place so far.  I only expected a handful of reviews since the outside of this place looks like a tavern that only alcoholics with no life would go to.

Inside, the place is a decent looking bar.  Went on a Tuesday.  It was Salsa night and the place was full.   Crowd was a little of everything but mostly White.  Its not very big inside, but it feels intimate, not cramped.  Folks were dancing upstairs and it seemed like everyone was having a good time.  The place is a "come as you are" type spot (I was wearing my workout clothes and fit right in).

If you live in the area, this place seems cool to just drop in for a drink on a weeknight.  You might even find someone looking to "hook-up"...well at least maybe a cougar, a girl who's high on something, or a Middle Eastern man on the prowl.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
I've been coming here for many years but it seems like I only now go on Tuesdays. Tuesday night is salsa night and the music is always pretty good and the scene is fun. The dance floor is kinda small and it doesn't help that a bunch of tools just stand around the dance floor while people are trying to dance.  However, the ladies always come in packs and are always ready to dance which makes for a great scene.

On another note, the prices are  good and bartenders always do a fine job.
author: Roger H.

description:
I went last Friday for the first time. Soon as I walked in the door I knew that this was gonna be one of my spots. I heard ODB playing, looked up to the Dj booth and saw Dj Madison was there and he was doing a video dj set. I've seen him play at a few other spots so it was a pleasant surprise. They have a projector there that plays all the videos of the songs that are being played. Not sure if they do this any other night but after speaking to Madison he said that he does video sets  every Friday night. The place was full but not too crowded and I didn't have to wait long at all to get a drink. I'm 35 so I was happy to see that it was a very mixed crowd. I didn't feel outta place like at some of the bars/clubs around the city. I can't stand the cheesy "Ultra Lounge" places that seem to be 25 & under. After a great night I ended up stumbling out at closing time into a cab that took me to my burrito spot.
I'll definitely be back.
author: Craig G.

description:
Went here after a rehearsal dinner...had a couple of strong drinks...seemed like a pretty cool place. I'd go back since it's fairly close to home and an old favorite of a few of my friends as well. 

Sorry this review isn't more exciting. Maybe if I go again there will be more to say!
author: Diane S.

description:
I really like this place.  

Pros:
1) The bartenders are fast
2) The atmosphere is unique.  
3) The music is usually good.
4) Drinks are strong. 

Cons:
1) This bar gets HOT.  
2) Not ideal when crowded.
3) Cash only.  BOO.
author: Shawna S.

description:
I'm unhappy with myself for not writing a review for this place as it's been over a year since my first visit. This place is a great hangout for a group of friends who want a no-frills hangout with good music spinning. Good bartenders making good drinks but like any popular bar it can be difficult getting their attention through a large crowd. Once you get your drink, wander upstairs and check out the scene in the loft area or look onto the main floor from its balcony views.

One thing that I remember is that this place often has people smoking in it so if that's something you want to avoid then be warned. Also, empty glasses and beer bottles tend to build up at the tables upstairs. I hope they have added more staff or improved their efficiency in terms of keeping the bar clean.

This is a cool bar and a great place to cut loose with a group of friends.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I'd never expect this place to be as chill as it was. You can pass the boarded up door and would never think that this is where all the cool people hang out. Conveniently located next to Sutter/Stockton garage makes it easy to meet friends. It's a tad small, but that's what makes it so cozy - a neighborhood bar of sorts. 

Price wise, cheapest liquor I've seen around town. $5-6 for jack vs $8-9 you'll see around town. Can I get a hell yeah! 

This place is a girly girl place. That is, similar to Cantina, these guys can whip up interesting cocktails. Gonna have to come back on a regular weekday.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Since I'm at work all the time, this would be my other local. You'll be fooled by it's humble facade, but once you're through the old fashioned wooden doors and under the wine-bottle chandelier that is it's centerpiece, you know you're in for it. The dim lighting, communal upstairs seating, friendly bartenders, just enough room for an intimate dance party AND cool tunes make this place great for everything from date night to hanging with the crew. 

I recommend popping in after 10pm on Wed-Fri nights if you want something different from the usual. I was there one night and hung out with some local salon stylists out for a work party, art school kids from the academy and waitstaff from Cafe de la Presse celebrating the beginning of summer. I swore I fell in love like 15 times that evening.  

Don't miss:

- Bruce on Wednesday nights. Un-f*ckingbelieveable Hip Hop and Reggae DJ. 
- Watermelon martinis. What can I say? They taste great. 
- Bar Crudo, the restaurant next door. You can try 'Italian Sashimi' here. Their chowder ain't bad either..
author: Andre L.

description:
No cover charge, great inexpensive drinks, friendly bartenders and good music...need I say more?? I went to Tunnel Top on a Saturday night just to grab a couple after dinner drinks. Once the DJ came on we ended up staying until midnight! The fresh watermelon martini was super tasty...and I'm not even a fan of watermelon. 

The only cons are 1) It's a cash only bar and 2) The upstairs lounge/dance area gets REALLY crowded. Overall we had a great drunken time:)
author: Krystal C.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SF. My husband and I had our second date here and closed the place down. There was a DJ, the atmosphere was great and the drinks were strong :)
It was fun. We have since been back a lot of times for drinks with friends and co-workers and it has always been a great place and it's downtown which is why we go after work.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
It's all about the music that sets the vibe of the crowd at this place.
The last time I was there it was funk, old school hip hop and reggae - pretty much all the music I want played at my funeral.
We danced and swayed upstairs most of the night.  Some out of towners pulled up beside us and had scored some local pot.  Seeing as how it was smoker friendly they decided to roll one right there and smoke it like it was Amsterdam.  I don't get high much anymore these days but when the perfect opportunity presents itself you have to remind yourself that you're alive, man.  I did and we did and it was and so it goes.  The TT turned into a little slice of Amsterdam that night.  The music never sounded so good.
author: Vic P.

description: There's nothing like your neighborhood bar. I used to live down the street and this was my go-to place with friends. I've been here more times than I can count and always have such a great time. Friends and I agreed that a night at Tunnel Top can never go wrong. The bartenders are great, especially Jean-Michele (who wouldn't want to be served and chatted with by a handsome french man?!). The doorman looks like a tough guy but is a big sweetheart. So if you ever find yourself having an off night, head to Tunnel Top and everything will be right in the world again.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Great dive bar! Service is great, love the decor.  Cash only - so be prepared.  And no kitchen/food service ... which is still somewhat of a relevation to me in bars! Bartender is great .... friendly but not in an "all-about-you" kind of way.  We've been there twice now, and a third time will be in our very near future.  While I probably wouldn't wait in line or stand there for a drink, it's the perfect place when a seat is available to have a drink and some good conversation with friends.  Definitely try the Hi-Lo at least once.  :)
author: NewtoCali M.

description:
Even though I was only here for an hour or two with my friends before dinner, I really liked the vibe of this place.   Not only was it right next door to Bar Crudo, it was a perfect place for us to talk and catch up.  We arrived around 7-7:30 on Tuesday night.   The atmosphere is fun, friendly, cozy, and non-intimidating.   

After dinner around 10pm, the place was packed when we walked by!  I would definitely come back again.
author: Vivian W.

description:
In Nob Hill--somewhere between the Tenderloin, Chinatown, and Union Square--a neighborhood dive is thumping on a Wednesday night. You figure you can cover the first round, since you're waiting for your federal tax return.

You get inside, and it looks a little like a club, a little like a lounge, a little like a dive bar, and a little like a living room. It's too dim to make out the details, but with the lights up, the Tunnel Top would probably be elegant, a grungy kind of chic.

So you send six of your closest friends upstairs to call dibs on one of the loungey sofas, probably one near the back, putting a little distance between the table and the kung fu movie screening and DJ. But before they go, you write their drink orders down on an old receipt. Ten. Ten different drinks. Three friends wait behind you, ready to help you carry ten drinks upstairs.

So you go up to the bartender, and you list 'em, ten drinks. You cross them off as she places each glass in front of you. She remembers every drink, no peeking. You are astonished.

You and some friends carry ten drinks upstairs--a huge round will cost you $40 before adding the necessary tip--and everyone clinks glasses. It's a little loud for conversation, though, so everyone splits into twos and threes. The bouncer, a burly man, swings by every so often to clear the table away.

But when you're ordering the next round, the bartender messes one drink up. One. She realizes her error even before she puts it in front of you. She won't let you pay for it. She gives you that drink, and another drink, free. When she isn't looking, you pay for both anyway.

The bar politely shoos you out near closing time, and your entire gang waxes poetic about how fun it was. Everyone's a little hesitant to leave, though, and that's the mark of a night well spent.
author: Jenn X.

description:
Oh man.  I have only been here once.  With the two skeeviest (in a bad way!) coworkers a girl could ask for.  I must have been wasted, because I threw up in the garbage can in the bathroom, then came back to see Mr. and Mr. Douche scheming on several variations of skank.  I had had it.  This place blew, and some weird Filipino dude was asking me if he could take me to Ruby Skye.  Nay to the nizzle.  I ran the fuck up out of there to a TL bar where way too many people knew my name.  

Skanks, douches, and people who go to Ruby Skye.  That's who comes here.  Oh wait, group number 3 is composed solely of groups 1 and 2.  I guess, 5 stars if you happen to be a douche or a skank.  Zero stars for the rest of us.  Sorry dudes.  Not even the ability to smoke upstairs can make this place tolerable.
author: Coco D.

description: An overcrowded spot with a mixture of scenesters and potentially violent meatheads.  The drinks are priced reasonably, the DJ was solid (excellent, danceable hip hop), and the overall visual vibe of the place is pretty damn cool.  My guess is that Friday and Saturday are the worst nights -- the place would be sweet with a little room to breathe.
author: Greg W.

description: Awesome dj, atmosphere, & crowd. Decent prices & good pours. (Maybe too good -- I had to dilute mine.) Would've been two stars just because the half-empty-drink-stealing bartender was such an ass. But the dj and the atmosphere made up for it.
author: Sari H.

description:
If I was a local I'd be here all the time. $6 strawberry or blackberry mojitos?! $7 watermelon gimlet? Not even happy hour!? Badass cheap drinks, great ambience with a touch of diveyness. I usually don't sit at the bar, but my girlfriend and I had a few drinks each and hung out for a couple hours. Even made some friends in the bathroom line. 

Cliff notes: 
Cheap, strong, delicious drinks
Non-pretentious crowd
Great place to kick it
And yes, the bottle chandelier is awesome
author: Marc S.

description:
A dive bar for people that dont like dive bars - and for people who do.  Went in on a wednesday night and saw the most diverse bunch of characters i've ever seen at a watering hole - and that says ALOT for san francisco...It had its fair share of drunk bum-looking guys, couples on dates, drunk sorority-type girls, suits and fashionable mid 20s-30s characters.

The drinks specials were out of this world - especially the watermelon martini w/ fresh mashed watermelon.  The only thing that kept this place from getting 5 stars was the bathroom - which was absolutely hideous... I would only go into the bathroom again after a couple shots of patron....
author: D S.

description: We drove into downtown San Francisco looking for a great night out on the town. Our jaws dropped when we found a plethora of parking spots (unheard of in LA) surrounded by cool bars. In the mood for a mojito, we Yelped "mojito" and the second place to pop up was Tunnel Top. We walked in, got two seats bar-side and ordered a plain mojito. It was exactly what were looking for and didnt make my wallet weep. Suddenly our adventures began. Some random man paid for our drinks and asked us what kind of accents we had (that pesky Russian accent creeps up on you when you least expect it). A couple nearby overheard us, and we instantly became friends. People here were so friendly and outgoing, and the bartender was very attentive and down-to-earth. We ended up having a fantastic night, and even had the chance to laugh at the scantily-clad populace dodging the rain on their way to nearby clubs.
author: Lida M.

description:
This turned out to be the perfect spot for an early Saturday night drink. 

Conveniently and inconveniently, close to the madness of Union Square -- but the "tunnel top" location must keep the tourists away, at least on this particular visit.

Everyone in our group was pleasantly surprised by the inventive, fruit-centric cocktails and GREAT prices (pomegranate cosmo = $6)!  Rather chill but not too chill, dimly lit, good ambiance -- spacious with high ceilings (there's a mezzanine upstairs level).

The DJ wasn't playing quite yet, so honestly, I can't remember the music, but would love to return for Friday night (dub reggae) or later on a Sat night (hip hop). 

The few drawbacks: cash only and bathroom was nast (according to a friend). 

Still, five stars because I WILL be back. Close enough to the FiDi that it has potential to become my new HH destination of choice :)
author: Daniel P.

description:
Beware the Ides of March OR the Brides of March!

100+ of us invaded this bar dressed up for our 'special day' with our consorts and grooms and yards of white Tulle, and the bartenders didn't bat a lash.

They served up great drinks, helped up those falling off their heels and from upstairs I had a grand view of it all, esp the amazing wine bottle chandelier. 

Not exactly huge but can accommodate a friendly crowd, women's bathroom is clean and well appointed.

Excellent short walking distance to Union Square activities. 

Really excited by the fun and willingness to support this crazy event! They get my kudos and repeat business for sure!
author: Miel H.

description:
The Tunnel Top is charming with good drinks, decent music, and has a really nice view.  But for those calling this place a dive, it's time for an income bracket reality check, cuz when me and my scrawny salary thinks dive, I think of places like the Hotsy Totsy in El Cerrito.  Let's do a little comparison, shall we?

Tunnel Top: Next door to critics darling, raw seafood haven Bar Crudo
Hotsy Totsy: Next door to the Sizzler.  Raw seafood, but in the contaminated way

Tunnel Top: retro signage likened to a former Rat Pack hangout
Hotsy Totsy: retro signage likened to the Confederate flag, and by the looks of the patrons when you walk in without being white or straight, it's intentional

Tunnel Top: low lit bathroom, funky old mirrors
Hotsy Totsy: had a sign in the bathroom that shouted, "WHEN YOU FLUSH MAKE SURE TO GIGGLE THE HANDEL!!!l!"  Now at first glance, you might think that I might be some sort of pretentious grammar snob, but that's not it.  My issue is that it was taped up with a bandaid.  A BANDAID.  Yes it was clean, but you think I'm gonna give posh points for that?

I hope I've made my point here.
author: Nic B.

description:
I love the Tunnel Top. It's great neighborhood bar, far enough away from the heart of the FiDi to avoid the yuppie explosion on Friday nights, and grungy enough to appease my bar sensibilities, which tend to be "dive-lite". 

Friday night I somehow ended up talking to the DJ about God. No idea how that happened, but let's just say my friend put me in a cab home not long afterward.

Minus a star because it is a bitch to navigate this place sometimes, and I really don't get the logic of placing the DJ in the most remote, difficult to access part of the bar, so they have to climb over people, oftentimes with lots of records, to get where they're going.
author: Angie R.

description: happy hour is so great.   cheap cheap.  we had amazing  time . Its a small cozy dark place.  people so friendly after a couple drinks. Dj music is muy buena.  easy to make a new friends here.  This is my new place to hanging out with my friends after work.
author: Cesar E.

description:
Great spot.

Located pretty conveniently between the downtown club district and Russian Hill/North Beach areas.  Always a pretty decent crowd, reasonable drink prices, and a nice loft space for dancing or chilling.
author: Doug W.

description:
So when I first went into here it was Mid 2000 and it was hot.  My buddy who tended bar at Enrico's gave the barkeep a clear plexi-muddling rod, drinks were nice, and they had some kind of samizdat spy cartoon going on the back wall --- a whooping happy hour was had.  I went back in 2003 one night after work and it was an overly loud DJ, with Mr. Stripped Shirt humping every leg in around.  What's a drunken lad to think?  Not wanting to deal with the paradox I stayed clear.

Went back last night before dinner and say its a little worse from the wear, stripped shirt's little brother (embroidered white shirt) hides in the corners scanning for legs, the drinks are still fine, and the decor excellent --- it's a paradoxical evening in the offing.  A bar that gets it right but can't transcend it's clientle.  Perhaps the Tunnel Top can still be redeemed?
author: Gustie L.

description:
Went here on the Friday at the end of the recent Bay Area heat wave looking for a refreshing and delicious drink, and I was not disappointed by their mojito.  Minty as hell, fresh and soothing but with a nice cool kick, it was a perfect drink served up quick and cheap. 

The place is great, too.  Hip but homey interior, great staff, excellent vibe.  I'll be going back here for the months to come.
author: Keane N.

description: I like this place because I can go out with friends who only go to dive bars and still get a decent drink.   Don't expect the cocktail menu from Rickhouse, but if you know how to order, Brian will make you pretty much whatever you want. And who needs happy hour when you can drink top shelf all night for $6 a pop?
author: Sven E.

description: Great crowd. Good drinks. Inexpensive drinks. Good 90s music. Friendly bar tenders. What more can you ask for? Seriously, I cant think of anything.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
I've heard some great things about the Tunnel Top, and reading the other reviews it seems that most people love this place, however, I can't say that I feel the same way.

First of all, it was extremely packed, packed with girls wearing dresses and skirts that are showing off way too much of what we don't wanna see. If you're fit, by all means flaunt it, but come on...no one likes to see cellulite.  Granted, it was a saturday night, but it still doesn't excuse the fact that i could barely move. 

My friend ordered 4 drinks but had to run to the ATM so he asked me to watch out for the drinks while he went. After he left, the bartender handed me the drinks but since there were 4 and I could barely get away from the bar since it was so packed, I stayed up there with all 4 drinks. 

An extremely drunk girl gets up on the bar with her heels on and risqué dress and starts dancing all over the place. After a few moments of this she grabs my head and bends down to shove her cooch in my face. I'm sorry but I think that's just tacky and disgusting. Once she was done embarrassing me in front of the whole bar, she kicked over my Jack & Coke and it spilled all over my jeans and shoes. A girl next to me offered to get the bartenders attention and replace my drink, but when she explained what happened he made her PAY for the drink. WHAT THE FUCK? I think that's ridiculous.

I might go back just because it was my first time there and I'll try anything 3 times. However, i definitely will not go back on a weekend.
author: Jeremy V.

description:
I love this bar, but, the other night (Friday) I went in and was treated to these four songs consecutively: 

Big Poppa, Humpty Dance, Rapper's Delight, and Sir Mix-a-Lot's Butt song. 

Could a play-list conceivably be any worse?

Unfortunately every time I go in it's largely the same, enough to where I'm on Yelp whingeing about it. Most people in there are in their mid-late twenties and thirties, which means we've heard these songs thousands of times. Give us a little credit for being somewhat sophisticated, rather than pandering to east bay kids with fake ids.

Come on Tunnel Top!
author: Nate L.

description:
I've passed this place a million times fully thinking it was a dive bar for the depressed and lonely.  Don't ask why--the outside is so deceiving!  I should learn that in San Francisco, everything looks like a mess on the outside, but it's what's on the inside that counts (also my pep talk before a blind date).

It's low key and nice inside.  My girlfriends and I came for happy hour and we sat up top talking and laughing and discussing our less-than-exciting love lives.  All in all a really great atmosphere to catch up!

There's no pressure to pay, the bartenders are nice and they load up the drinks with extra alcohol... I am the one shot wonder and that was all I needed to get myself squared away for 30 minutes.

Would come back!!  Would come back more often if I worked in the city.
author: Steph M.

description:
Tunnel Top is the best.

Or maybe it's Emily and her super sunny personality that turns any given Saturday night at the TT from merely good to transcendentally awesome. Truth be told, without exaggeration, her drinks are almost a religious experience.

Bad day? Get a drink from Emily.
Celebrating something? Get a drink from Emily.
Need to find God? Get a drink from Emily.
You get the idea.

Yes. She's that wonderful. I'd marry her if I could, but for now, I'll just settle for getting a drink. From Emily.
author: Derek L.

description:
I'm at the tunnel top right now. Thank you blackberry. The mbgitw is djing tonight. 

I have always liked this place. Its proximity to downtown can attract the finance crowd but its always a good time. I love the chandalier and the upstairs lounge. They usually play some cool distracting movie on the wall and the DJs are good. 

 Definitely a cool place for a drink and some people watching.
author: Zac H.

description: Happy hour is cool and late night is cool...in between is ehh. No Sunday fun day here...but it's a go to in the Union Square area. Won't find too many touristas here. Good drinks, and usually a seat upstairs. Not sure I'd go all the way across town to get here. But you might be able to twist my arm.
author: Marianne s.

description: Hey, it's the Tunnel Top; a dive bar with very nice patrons, decent drinks, nasty upstairs layer of second hand smoke, and casual vibe. A little interior design work and ventilation for the upstairs area (my favorite seats) will earn this fun dive a fourth star.
author: Michael G.

description: Pretty darn tootin cool. Feels like a New York bar, in a good way. Climb to the second floor to feel like you're going to a hideout, try to score a seat at the table by the window.  Music is great, you can also spy on people below. The pomengranate martini, though oh so very girly is delicious.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I'll give it credit for having a witty name-it sits right on top of a tunnel on Stockton so ha ha. You look at this place after a hike up Bush St. and think to yourself, "goddamn this place is just the joint for me to get a refreshing beverage." Indeed.
Only if you're okay to succumbing to a hot sticky over priced jungle music blasting orgy. Oh so you like orgies do you? Then you'll like this place. Walked in one night for a going away party and luckily we secured the loft spot so I quickly squeezed through the crowd downstairs where the couches were crammed full of our peeps and coats and purses and backpacks and this place has nowhere else to put them. The upstairs view was pretty nice and the dark lighting makes you forget how really gross this place is. $12 for a Long Island that didn't even make me come close to getting a case of "flushed Asian red" is pretty pathetic. I wouldn't come here again.
author: Jessica K.

description: Yummy fresh fruit muddled drinks!!! Music was pretty cool too ..
author: Miranda L.

description:
Zero to cocktail in 30 seconds or less. Seriously this place is right across the street and not only is the bartender adorable, she can whip up a cosmo quick!
So whether you had a great day that needs celebrating- or a bad day that needs weathering....you can get your drink on here pronto. 

cash only
limited seating (cuz its on petite row)*
dim lighting ( that can be good)

* petite row: area between Union Square and Nob Hill on Bush that is the home to tiny yet impossibly busy bars, restaurants and hair salons :D
author: Melissa B.

description:
Takes courage to walk in here if all you've seen of this place is in the daytime on lunchwalks.  I mean, the Green Door "Massage" parlor is right next door, and is a few steps up a dirty shady tunnel entrance.  Of note, and I know most people don't care, but if you know me I'm going to drop the trivia any-freaking-way-- the alley to the right of the entrance is Burritt Street, which is named after the man who was done in by the redhead in Dashiell Hammett's the Maltese Falcon.  There's a placard at the entrance-- impress someone or depress them with your dorkiness.

More things I dig about this hole.. drinks are never ever weak, their chandelier of (looks like) Fernet bottles, the projection of campy sci-fi and other cult films, their loft and the tight squeeze to the front-- great for overcoming fear of heights and inappropriate "accidental" touching people. Kidding. Sort of.
author: Marjorie B.

description: This place is great for a fun drink with a couple of friends, without the inflated prices. It has a kick-ass vibe, that's chill and yet sophisticated.  Happy hour gets crowded, and the music is a bit loud. But it's great.
author: Roxane W.

description:
sucks.

BAR: this place was supposedly happening on mondays, but it was bizarre & rather dead when i went. i instantly wanted to leave. the space is odd, & there's nothing to redeem the griminess.

BATHROOM: n/a

OVERALL: ew.
author: miss b.

description:
I love this place.

I remember being upstairs huddled on one of the benches with my friend Jordan who was squatting in the bar during a racous game of assasin.

I've smoked more cigarettes in this bar to garner some lung cancer.  I've drank more beers and spilled even more over the top ledge upstairs to garner an asshole award.

When I want to feel classy, I go next door to Bar Crudo.

When I want to feel gassy, TT it is.
author: Jen I.

description: ok ok ok ok. i also like the watermelon gimlet.
author: Susy C.

description: On the weekends I think this would be a great place if I didn't mind extremely crowded places, in my 20's and looking to get hammered or laid. But I do dig the chandeliers!
author: Sally D.

description:
You know, I read the reviews on here before I was dragged to this place and rolled my eyes, because, yet again, I was going to another 'divey' bar in the city. I was pleasantly surprised, it was a little schwanke inside with some charm and a cool atmosphere. I wasn't too stoked on being crushed against the bar, but I guess that's what you get on a Friday at 10. I was with a bunch of fussy ladies and we all had different drinks, and the bartender didn't get pissy or anything, which I wouldn't have blamed him for at all. 

I was a little too inebriated to try going upstairs, but I wanted to. I guess that means I'll have to go back. Maybe much later.
author: Paul W.

description: Nice little bar, Def a good place to start your night. They also pour their drinks really stiff here as well.
author: Pol S.

description: We were actually looking for another dive but walked into here instead..it was about 6ish so we thought it was drink time, or actually time to refresh the great buzz we had already acquired. Found a nice spot near the bar and the tender hooked us up with a couple of great drinks..my usual of Patron, no wheels with a ice cold BR and the wife partook in a stiff 7&7..interesting crowd provided entertainment so we just people watched enjoyed a couple rounds, realized we were hungry so we left..all in all, the Tunnel Top made it to our list of regular jaunts when we are in town as they are near the hotel.
author: David S. Y.

description: Okay this bar/lounge is pretty cool. I would consider it to be in an ambiguous location but I guess that's why the name of this place helps.  Stepping inside, it's like a charming sort of tavern with a dim candle-lit and lofty atmosphere. It's a two story place. They also had a random projector displaying video on the wall and while you could order drinks downstairs you could dance or just listen to music upstairs to music that sometimes a live DJ is mixing. This place is definitely worth experiencing at least once if you're in the area.
author: Brandon H.

description: Haven't been for late night, but I've always had fun here meeting up with friends after work.  It's a pretty small bar, though there is an upstairs as well with couches.  I recommend the watermelon gimlet.  So delicious!  After you finish the drink, there's watermelon leftover to snack on.  Yum!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
This place is by far the most local feeling bar I've been to... Its divy and kind of qwerty but the place is way nicer then an actual dive bar. My favorite e part is the balcony over which looks over the bar. Get place to people watch and be watch... i know you all love it too... and the other great thing is the wine bottle chandelier... very creative... i love places that think creatively in decor...very resourceful...
a must hang out for any SF-ite who's tired of the trendy modern clubs... oh i didn't mention they have a DJ who plays good tunes...
author: Ravi R.

description:
My biggest complain about this bar is they allow people to smoke inside. You always get someone here lighting up a cigarette. The bouncer who is a kewl guy, but very casually over looks it. This has happened every time i have been here.

I understand people need to smoke. All I am saying just take it outside. After you get out of this bar, I promise you that u will stink of cigarettes. I avoid this place, but sometimes i end up here ...

In fairness to the owners of this place, if you get rid of the smokers who smoke inside here, this is a fantastic bar with a great crowd.  I love their Chimay ...
author: Amlan S.

description:
Awesome dive bar, with extra points for the hip hop music. It gets really crowded here on the weekends but it's usually not too hard to find a spot to hang out on the second floor. The overall vibe is extremely chill and the dim lighting is perfect. 

Close proximity to Union Square means you can either:
1) Have some cocktails then go drunk shopping (three cheers for credit cards!)
2) Shop first, then drink away any existing buyers remorse
author: lindsay w.

description:
A true hole-in-da-wall bar with an unpretenious, diverse crowd.  The drinks are alright and the vibe cool. The location is nice when you're already around downtown. The only problem the upstairs gets frickin' hot on a sunny day. Science 101: heat rises. It feels like you're kicking it inside a greenroom! Frequent trips downstairs for fresh air required.

p.s. Shame on you gang of girl-smokers upstairs. It was bad enough because of the heat...
author: Ezduzit S.

description:
Went here with some friends on Saturday, which was an odd day for me to go since I'm usually there on a random weekday. And instead of discovering a half-empty bar, it was semi-crowded and they had a DJ upstairs.... and people were dancing, too! 

And that's the funny thing: I didn't know there was an upstairs area. So when I looked up I saw a whole bunch of people just peering over the railing... and now that I think about it, the whole place looks like a church. A church of alcohol? Maybe. Quite possibly.

But my friends and I found a spot at the bar and we had a good time just sitting there and having drinks. It wasn't so loud where we couldn't hear each other, either. And while I'm perfectly fine going there on a quiet weekday, I kind of prefer the weekend now. The crowd is a lot livelier and all the people I talked to were pretty cool.
author: Caroline L.

description:
This place is my new favorite bar in SF. I went here with some friends and I loved it. The upper floor has comfy seats, however the walk way was a bit small. The bar has a very romantic setting with candles and the perfect amount of darkness. 

I also love the beer chandelier and the porn projected on the wall was interesting  :)
author: Michelle C.

description:
I actually enjoyed my time at Tunnel Top...they played GREAT music.  my only issue with this place is that its full of tourists...which makes total sense since its right in around union square.

I would definitely go back for a quick drink and the good beats!
author: lasok o.

description:
I wouldn't quite say that T.T. is a 'dive' anymore, it's getting pretty hipster (not in a bad way).

Strong drinks, good peeps, and good D.J. music pretty much every night.
author: Dpb T.

description:
The drinks are tasty, even when the hot bartender with the forearm tats cuts me off and makes me drink a soda water concoction to sober up.

I love the red, smoky atmosphere and thick wooden bar...anytime I go there I don't feel like I'm a block away from the hectic downtown area.  
The upstairs area is a nice option especially if you want to fall off the wagon and light up a cancer stick to go along with your stiff drink.  

I think its neat that you're encouraged to write on the bathroom walls...definite words of wisom....and a couple of phone numbers....One downside is that sometimes on fri/sat the music  is a bit loud and I feel like I need to text the person sitting next to me...oh and don't forget cash.

Did I mention the bartender is hot!  From what I hear they call him the Captain....hmmmm...Captain of what I wonder?
author: Lisa Kim J.

description:
The Tunnel Top is a precious gem. One reason is that bars like this are an urban rarity: that is, it's very odd that the customer to bar size to bar staff ratio works. Here, it does, mostly because the bartenders are very efficient (and manage a good pour, I might add.)

The upstairs is cozy and the open wooden beams make it seem like you're hanging out in a friend's attic. Of course, despite the apparent flammability, people are allowed to smoke in friends' attics (which I personally loathe, yet endorse in a libertarian kind of way...after all, it's keeping my home state's economy alive.) Sometimes it can get a little cramped/hot/smoky up there, but that's part of the dive-y vibe. If you can't take it, maybe you're not a diver at heart.
author: Mary R.

description:
Seriously, go there! You'll love it!

This is a small 2-story bar located above the Stockton tunnel.  Despite of its size, this place has such a warm character, that you know that you'll love once you pull those full-height heavy timber doors.  
You can hang out downstairs for a quick drink with friends, or you can  go upstair for casual lounging area.  This is not a "see and be seen" kind of place, it's a super comfotable & friendly, sort of "neighborhood" type of bar.

The drinks are fairly priced and they have enough drinks to make you happy, very happy indeed.  

Go there and be happy! Viva la vida!
author: N. C.

description:
Drinks are made well and priced just how I like them.  The bar is nothing you would expect in Chinobsquare (Chinatown/Nob Hill/Union Square... can you do any better?).

I had fun. Maybe you could too. 

Just drink some 209 gin.
author: Lee M.

description:
My favorite bar by Union Square. Not only is Tunnel Top next to Bar Crudo, but it has a laid back vibe of a dive without sacrificing cleanliness and coziness. I've been here for drinks after dinner on a weekday and a few weekend nights. Each time has been relaxed, even when the bar's been crowded.

Arbiter of taste? One night here, I met a Bourbon and Branch bartender, serious Manhattan in hand, who gave Tunnel Top his stamp of approval. 

Every drink I've ordered here has been reasonably priced, fruit-based, and yes, undeniably girly. Hey, that pomegranate cosmopolitan was damn good. And the bar's special strawberry juice plus vodka plus crushed strawberries concoction? I'm not a cheap date, but I was done after that one.
author: Kari M.

description:
this is by far my favorite bar in San Francisco. There will be some mainstream rap music bumpin for a bit but as soon as the DJ throws on some Bel Biv Devoe its on and crackin from that point on. The crowd is usually a mixture of hipsters and hip hop heads, and then the people who really don't fit into any category.
The bar staff is great, Jean Michelle makes those drinks that sneak up on you... and believe me, everytime I go there, I get snuck up on. Not many proud moments in my life... but the drinks are delicious!
Last time I was there I did have some moron spill his drink from the top floor, the glass didn't drop thank god, but if you get in good with the bouncer, the jerk upstairs will get hassled or thrown out! That is what happened to the jerk in this instance.
author: Latisha W.

description:
I really liked the crowd, the space, and the music.

Our female bartender (I usually find my experiences with female bartenders are lesser than that with male ones) was excellent and gave us a great pour of Jameson. Though it was crowded with hip 20-somethings, we were able to grab a couple of stools along the wall upstairs. I'll definitely come back.
author: Caroline C.

description:
