If it walks like a duck and quacks like a duck then baby you are in a dive bar. Set atop, yes the Stockton tunnel looks like a dive bar from the outside and the inside doesn't disappoint. They have good drink specials during happy hour and the crowd is a good mix. It gets pretty packed in there but then again why would i want to hangout in a bar with no one around. Especially great place to grab a beer or five while you are waiting to get a seat at Bar Crudo next door which is AWESOME. But that is for another review. 
Stop by an ATM before you go as they only take cashola.
author: Stephen K.

description:
Some of the best drinks I have ever had.  The bar tenders serve you quick and are friendly.  

The place is packed but you can easily get around the place still.  If it gets too packed you can just go upstairs and chill up there with the DJ.

This is a great place to kick back.  Plus they had a skater movie on a projector.
author: Shawn L.

description: Was there after a tasting event at The Fairmont on a Saturday...so was pretty much BODd by the time I walked in. Not much of a selection of beers on tap. Upstairs seating area was nice ..there were about 10 of us and we were able to capture one of the L-couches for ourselves. The wine bottle chandelier is cool. Did not try the food. Music sucked.
author: Deepak K.

description:
The Tunnel Top is one of my favorite local watering holes!  The interior is super fun - equipped with a beer chandelier and they are always playing old movies on the wall. 

When you go make sure to check out the upstairs as there is more seating and you can hold a conversation a bit better!  Each night they have a different DJ. We went last week for my bday and it was 80's night (can I really ask for much more!). 

The drinks are yummy and reasonably priced, but it is cash only so make sure you hit up the ATM before going
author: Summer C.

description: This place is great for happy hour/drinks! I used to pass it all the time, but didn't actually walk in until yesterday to meet a friend for drinks. I love the vibe - very cool decor, cozy seating upstairs, clean bathrooms, great happy hour deals, long happy hour, friendly staff, fun/chill music, and good location! Only complaint is that it's cash only, but with such cheap happy hour drinks, it's not a huge deal.
author: Buster B.

description: Great little spot. It's quickly become my favorite happy hour destination after work. The watermelon gimlet is super tasty. Any drinks that include fresh fruit, I'm sold.
author: Allison B.

description:
I came here again on a recent Saturday and found it more enjoyable going in with the right expectations. This isn't a place to chill and talk with friends, but more to get your groove on and listen to sweet tunes. The DJ played a long list of varied, high-energy music and the dancefloor had cute, friendly girls to dance with.

I'm much more of a dive bar kind of drinker, but when the mood hits, I'll be coming back.
author: Jay U.

description:
I once asked a friend What's your favourite bar in the city?. Tunnel Top was the answer. Personally, I don't think it's that good, but Tunnel Top is a pretty cool little bar.


 The main thing that stands out in my memory is that you could smoke here, even though indoor smoking is completely illegal in California - they just didn't seem to care.
author: Alistair H.

description:
Oh wow, what did I do last night and where are these bruises from? 

From the outside I didn't expect much from this place but the night was almost over so what the hell! There was an amazing chandelier made of wine bottles and the specials were written on a chalk bar above the bar. The downstairs gets relatively packed and is your usual bar scene while the upstairs loft is somewhat used as a dance floor or lounge area. 

This place had a great crowd that was a mix of hipsters to booty shakers! The DJ did an amazing job with his song selection ranging from indie-rock to 90's rap. My friends and I danced all the way til closing! 

The drinks are decently priced too. Mojitos and tokyo teas were served in generous sized glasses packed with alcohol for only $7! The bar is cash only though so come prepared. 

I would definitely become a bar fly here!!!
author: Nicoletta F.

description:
I've been coming here for over a year and love it so much I have the tendency to introduce other people from my circle to the Tunnel Top experience. Mind you, I've only been there on Wednesdays for 80s night and Saturdays to get my dance and hiphop on so my review is limited to that. 

I'm kinda bummed they no longer have the crushed strawberry and vodka drink and getting a bit over the blackberry mojitos but aside from that the service is great. I'm served pretty quickly and if they're packed, the bartender makes good effort to acknowledge you if he/she doesn't take your order then. Yes, it is a cash only spot.

I also pretty happy with the crowd as you can get a whole mix in one spot and Tunnel Top NEVER lets me down. No cover, strong drinks, music to keep you dancing. 

Good times were had by all...

and DJ Tin One is awesome!
author: Rachel C.

description:
the best mojitos ever. the best. (and the cheapest!). the best.

also just about the coolest spot. come around 7PM on a week day. Non douchy crowd, really really good music . love it.
author: Katie T.

description: A total disappointment. The place was small and the bartenders was just busy preparing for the night rush. I had one drink which was the blackberry mojito and left.
author: Sandy C.

description: Went for a friend's birthday on a Friday night and had a blast!  Got there early, ordered a watermelon martini ($6... woop!), and was able to snatch a couch spot upstairs.  Three watermelon martinis later and a few bites of decadent delights resulted in a memorable experience.  The music was mostly hip hop yet, "Don't Stop Believing" made its way in the mix, and we all went dance dance crazy!
author: christina y.

description:
I like it. Good drinks, great atmosphere, although a little jammed. People dancing. Two floors with a nice layout.

But the five star rating is definitely due to the fact that you can smoke and drink upstairs. It's a little weird - smoking area is not separated from the rest of the bar. Love it.
author: Senya T.

description:
I thought nothing would get me over the loss of the legendary 7-11 Club.  Let's face it, folks; the downtown drinking scene is, er, lacking. You've got the suit bars in the Financial District, you've got Sutter Street Station, which is ok, Dave's and House of Shields which are great but get overcrowded too quickly...what's left? A walk up the stairs to Tunnel Top is what's left. Great drinks, cool crowd, solid bartenders...love the Top. 
I just wish they took plastic - what's the point of having the boss take you out for drinks if he can't PAY for them?
author: Hugh G.

description:
I've been here twice now. The first time, I got a Jack and Ginger, which they made the good way, putting in some extra ginger flavor along with the ginger ale.

Last night we came in here and I got a beer. A bit crowded but fun. The bartender, even though it was crowded, was very prompt with the service.
author: Stu M.

description:
After a nice birthday dinner with friends, we were in search of a place to lounge and have drinks. So we walked around Downtown and came upon this bar. There were a lot of people already standing at the entrance so we figured this place couldn't be too bad. My friends bought me a drink for my birthday - which was the pomegranate martini. This drink was strong. I was feeling tipsy after having one. But then again, I'm a cheap date. The drinks were decently priced (most drinks were $6/$7). I had a taste of the strawberry mojito, which I will definitely order the next time I'm in the area. 

I walked up the stairs to find a whole bunch of small tables on the side with 2 stools each and an area with booth seating and tables. There was plenty of room to sit once people got up to leave. The DJ was kickin' - he was playing songs from the '80s to the current. I think I heard Justin Timberlake every other song. The cool part was how the DJ was able to mix the old in with the new. Everyone enjoyed the music. There wasn't a formal dance area but there is space along the railing on the 2nd floor if you wanted to dance. It's a good place just to hang out. The dress code is casual. 

Thanks Joanne for the drink!
author: Candace F.

description:
This a great dive bar.  I love it!

Character, character, and more character!  Music is awesome, cool down to earth people.  You will see me here again.
author: Andrew N.

description: Cheap drinks and good bartender.  Interesting mix of people, dancing upstairs and couches for lounging. Must try the watermelon gimlet next time.
author: Maryellen P.

description: I have been walking by this bar for more than three years since it's near my office.  Thinking it was a smokey dive bar filled with crusty patrons, I didn't bother to try it out.  After reading lots of positive reviews, my friend and I decided to give it a go.   The inside is much nicer than the exterior will lead you to believe.  The happy hour prices are killer, and the bartender was so sweet and friendly.  She gave my friend a sample of one of the drafts she was thinking of trying, as well as trail mix which goes oh-so-nicely with a cold frosty glass!  Will definitely be back soon.
author: Marika A.

description: My crew and I came here under a friend's suggestion and it didn't disappoint. It was a Friday night so it was crowded yet we got lucky enough to sit at the couches at the upper level where we chatted it up with some transplanted girls. It looked like they had a good variety of beers and they made my Captain & Diet strong. I'll probably come back here if I'm ever in SF again.
author: A N.

description:
Tunnel Top has probably got to be my favorite bar in the city. The drinks are excellent, the DJ always seems to be spinning the perfect loungy/techno beat and there is room for a couple to snuggle in the corner, or for a group to hang about a large couch.

Ok, so they make good drinks, but they're also super cheap. I'm not usually into fruity drinks, but the Watermelon Gimlet, Raspberry Mojito and Pomegranate Cosmo are off the hook! The proximity to Financial District and Union Square certainly helps. Always loved this place..its a high bar to stand up to for so long, but I do hope the love affair continues.
author: Ripple K.

description: Love this spot! I used to go here since it was 3 buildings down. The bartender is very friendly. Not a place to want to dance too though. More a spot to chill, have a drink, talk and listen to the dope beats. I'd recommend this spot if you want a chill lounge.
author: april j.

description:
nice joint.  good drinks.  kind of a sausagefest tonight but the talent was perky

music is a hodge podge
author: Spanky M.

description: I almost don't want to write a review, because this place can't take a much more packed house. Tiny little bar, looks divey on the outside - but is one of the most welcoming bars I've been to in the city. Fun music and a nice crowd - nothing pretentious or snobby, and super reasonable drink prices - not to mention that those drinks are delicious. The blackberry mojito alone ($7!!) is worth going back for. This is going to be a new favorite.
author: M E.

description:
I'm not sure I would have ventured into the Tunnel Top if it weren't the regular happy hour venue for my office. I'm not much of a bar fly, but the Tunnel Top is small scale and tame enough that I felt comfortable there. It appears a little seedy from the exterior, but isn't so bad inside. Just dim and crowded and loud, like a bar typically is. I've usually sat upstairs (careful if you've had a few!) on the couches, which are an awkward seating arrangement for really large groups, but for a few people could be quite nice. Drinks are pretty reasonable and there seems to be a good variety. I had a pomegranet cosmo there, which was quite nice. Not a bad little place to de-stress on a Friday eve, post work.

PS - We discovered that Bar Crudo, next door, will export a plate of edibles to the Tunnel Top, so you can nibble on raw Italian delicacies while you drink.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Whoever considers the Tunnel Top a dive must have been raised in a Manor House.   Far from being a dive it is a fantastic, warm bar in a great location -- just look out that window for an urban perspective.   Or look up, a wine bottle chandelier, cool wooden ceiling with beams, or an upstairs area that wraps around and from which you can see the patrons below.

The DJ helped keep the place lively and a movie was running against one wall.  Just like any good dive has . . .
author: Uber U.

description:
Bars that let you smoke in them are sort of a rarity... At least in San Jose.   Whereas at first, I was perfectly happy, puffing away on the second level, after a couple hours, it gets old.  Maybe if there was better ventilation I could hang??? Not that I'm knocking the place.  The drinks are reasonable and I noticed they even make mojitos!  I didn't try one (it's not the best bar drink to order - I end up feeling bad because it takes so long to make them!) but I count that as a positive....  

Back to the upstairs. Really small walkways... You definitely want to get a seat somewhere out of the way because otherwise, you'll be getting up every time somebody has to walk by!
author: soy y.

description: Cool dive bar but man it takes forever to get a drink.  Sat at the bar for over 30 minutes before we got our first beer served to us.  Granted, it was very busy and other customers were ordering complex mixed drinks, but get another bartender in there. After finishing our first beer, the second beer only took 20 minutes to get but we had to order it from the door man.  The only thing he knew how to pour was a Guinness (literally -- I first asked for a Porter and he said, "I don't know what that is."), so that's what we got.  On the plus side, beers were only $4 each (cash only).  Seems like a fun place to hang out, but it's hard to have fun when you spend 50 minutes out of 120 trying to make eye contact with the bartender.
author: Dr. J.

description: One of the coolest bars in SF.  Stiff cheap drinks, good beats, cool vibe.  I have had some really good times at this place over the years.  It can be chill on some nights, and on others it goes off.
author: Jonas C.

description: Good ass vibe and reminded me of an East Coast joint. I am definitely gonna be back to chill even more. Good music, but where was the ODB (big baby jesus)??? Chill...
author: Dennis M.

description:
This place is pure money.  

It gets 5 stars for no other reason than it's the place you want to be when you really want to get dressed up in black and go to the most scandalous bar you can find.  I guess it's considered a dive bar, but it's not at all one of those dives that are inhabited by 50 year old drunks that have been there for years.  

It's a hip crowd, difficult to tell whether or not everyone's drunk or on coke.  The second floor is an open balcony with a few seats - you can smoke up there, so beware that this is a smokers bar (though only on the second floor).

The place is cash only, so don't bother to bring the credit card.  Prices are surprisingly steep for this kind of place, but it's nothing that doesn't resemble the rest of San Francisco.  

Also, it shares a wall with the Green Door massage parlor, if you're into that kind of thing.  Good food nearby, close to downtown.  

I'd recommend it, if you're looking to go out with the lounge lovers/club hoppers and get hammered, relaxed style.
author: Adam C.

description:
went recently while awaiting a table at next door's Bar Crudo - all the chef/cooks came in and did shots around 6:00pm before heading back to their stations...

Our bartender was a newbie and strugged with some classic cocktails.  I'm down with that but he was a real "short pour" - barely a one count.  I'm embarrassed I didn't call him on it but didn't want to expose myself as even more of a lush than I am.

Nice enough scene and I'd go back, though hopefully when another barkeep is on board.
author: David P.

description: I'm sure it would have been better had I been able to get a drink a little bit quicker.  Loud, but everyone seemed to be having fun.  I'll have to check it out again when it's not so busy.
author: Forrest G.

description: If you want to see celebs and cool people this is the place hands down. Best place in San Francisco. Good drinks reasonable no overpriced cosmos and down to earth people . No snobs well maybe if your blond just kidding. Serious though a lot people knock dive bars. This upscale Nice cozy little dark bar is the place. You can see who your talking to. Go here before you go any where else to drink. I wish someone told me. Enjoy Happy drinking
author: Robert D.

description: Happy hour lasts until 8!!!  Huge selection of cheap drinks 9beer and cocktails), and they use a lot of fresh fruit.  Watermelon gimlet is a must.  Looks small from outside, but plenty of stools and standing room downstairs and up.  Perfect place to booze and chat with friends :)
author: s m.

description: Hands down best bar in the city. If you think you're man enough or woman enough, have a Libby shot. It'll make you a believer.
author: I D.

description: Modern, artsy two story bar.  Crowd is always mellow and intelligent.  Good place to make movies in, still a good place to meet friends at.
author: John C.

description: Good spot to have a Chimay Red ($6). Seemed like more of a fun hang out than pick up scene in a Friday at 7pm.
author: erica u.

description: Cozy place on top of the Stockton tunnel.. yesterday was my first time here, and I definitely like the atmosphere. Got a watermelon gimlet which was reallly strong. Not bad, but a little difficult to drink when you keep sucking up watermelon chunks. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Jade S.

description: I went here on a Saturday night after dinner with my girlfriends.ordered a Mojito and i should say the reviews about their mojitos are true!!i love beer but their mojitos are good.i like it a lot!! i can't wait to go back to TT!! good music,good vibes,good times : )
author: Ces T.

description: I always have fun here.  You can actually carry a conversation with your friends and get a good drink.  it's very small but a good place to launch from.
author: Rayna A.

description: Tunnel Top never fails to satisfy me. We went here again for the husband's birthday. This time it was supposed to be a low key happy hour.  As always, the drinks at TT never fail us. All of us were nicely buzzed and a few were sloppy drunks.  Again, I love their prices. $7 for a strawberry mojito. Beers were only $3. How can you not love Tunnel Top.
author: Mary L.

description: I gotta admit, this bar truly is a magnet for unspeakable acts of public intimacy, especially upstairs...just be sure not to do anything raunchy by the stairs, where your shadows might reflect onto the movie screen on the wall. And trust me: bring cash.
author: Ramon T.

description: Small place to grab a drink but great ambience. They're always playing old movies and their DJs are usually top shelf.
author: Chris B.

description: friendly mixed group of folks....fast efficient bartenders....good music in the background....small..but 2 stories....decent bar to hit up on a crawl....
author: Hen A.

description: This is such a great bar for almost any purpose, a date, hanging with friends, having after-work drinks, etc. It has a busy downstairs and a sort of wraparound loft upstairs where with couches and tables where you can have a nice conversation. The lighting is really good, and it is cozy but not claustraphopic. Good prices and nice bartenders.
author: Cyrelle D.

description:
ting a., circa 2000:  'manny, we've known each other for years, and we've never drank before...  ...and i'm going to be in italy next year!!'  ...7 shots of tequila later, i regret opening my mouth.

8 years later, i find myself at tunnel top for mary l.'s husband's bday celebration.  ...w/my drink of choice, a cranberry grey goose, retailed at a low price of $6.50.  ...  this is definitely going to be a loooong night, folks.  

the shots start to get passed around.  my liver starts to twitch when i take a sniff and realize that it's tequila.  mind you, i've never had patron, but my stomach started doing flips, regardless.  thank the liquor gods that tunnel top employs the kind of bartender that will give me free chasers for my shots.  

speaking of things twitching, so did my ass (in a good way), b/c i was fortunate enough to be in the presence of a dj that played songs by a tribe called quest.
author: Ting A.

description: Fun, fun, fun! Nice atmosphere, trendy, college type clientel with some late 30ish to early 40ish. Loft type bar. Dancing upstairs... Great, inexpensive drinks! Worth every dollar! If I had anything negative is the line for the restroom. Only one toilet...
author: Ken V.

description: Great little local dive bar. Good people, good times.
author: Travis R.

description:
What is there to say about the Tunnel Top?

1. Not a dive bar, unless the phrase "dive bar" has been recently re-purposed to mean "urban-hipster hangout."
2. Great location - very nice view, interesting perspective looking out the windows kind of onto Snob Hill, kind of onto Union Square.
3. Good ambiance - dark, woody, places to sit, I love the tables in the upstairs balcony area - reminds me of a coffee shop I used to go to when I was in college.
4. After 7pm?  Impossible to find a place to sit, crowded with pretentious urban-hipster-assholes whose conversation often revolves around how much they paid for their jeans and/or purse and/or sunglasses and/or car and/or you get the idea...
5. After 9pm?  Fucking packed (and, keep in mind that Tunnel Top is a tiny little bar) with a dumb ass DJ spinning music so loudly that you have to shout to be able to be heard... seriously, folks - lose the DJ - some nice ambient noise in the background would be much better for your atmosphere.
6. After 9:05 pm?  Asshole urban-hipsters start SMOKING upstairs... which drifts down onto the main floor and pollutes my asthmatic lungs and makes my hair smell not pretty anymore... meh... fucking smokers, I don't care if you want to smoke - that's fine - but, please take it outside where it won't be ventilated into my lungs via downwards drift, etc.
7. Drink prices, eh... alright - kind of high-ish.  I've only ever had a glass or two of wine at this bar (as it is usually a post dinner drink stop - since it's close to my apartment)... which was about $6... my brother, however, paid $10 for a single shot of Grey Goose over some ice w/very flat tonic in it.

Overall - I WANT to love the Tunnel Top for it's unique location and general ambiance (sans the DJ, urban-hipster assholes, etc)... but, at the same time I WANT to hate it for it's crowdedness, high-ish drink prices and the fact that I always leave there smelling like (and, feeling like - *cough, cough, cough*) I smoked a pack of Marlboro Reds.

It's a love/hate relationship -- check it out for yourself... maybe it's just me.
author: Kate R.

description: I liked you when I could smoke. I only tolerate this place on occasion because, goddammit, you still make me melt with your sexy French self.
author: Emily X.

description: Great value (four stars) but it gets really crowded and I don't like places where people fart as they walk (minus one star)...yes, that's awful (total three stars).
author: Cat T.

description:
I'll have to agree with some of the other reviewers here; dive bar this is most definitely not. For one thing you will run into one or two yuppified patrons, but don't let this put you off, the crowd is mixed you will find a few locals, people on their way to a club, maybe even a tourist or two. There is a DJ upstairs, as well as a  couch and a handful of tables for your seating pleasure. I love this place because it feels like an  escape from some of the more rowdy, annoying union square bars. 
This is not to say that it can't get loud or crazy in here, but the energy and vibe say San Francisco (with a touch of Europe) to me, and I guess this is why I love coming here. If you go, I recommend heading upstairs, and keep on  walking towards the windows. This is the place you want to sit with your well earned beer, or cocktail, and companion. You get a view of passersby, some fresh air, and comfortable seating, all tucked away into a little alcove of a space.
The cocktails are good and strong, the way they should be. I got a pomegranate martini which was delish but almost impossible to drink upstairs without having it spill on me,hence the need for a table. My favorite time to go is on a lazy Saturday afternoon, it isn't as packed as it is at night, I can grab a table by the windows, and spend a pleasant, leisurely weekend.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: Who says you can't go to a bar alone?! Well, this is one of those few places where you feel ok being on your own in a bar.  People are nice, neighborhood is central and it is an all around comfortable setting.
author: Sandy S.

description: I've only been here once.  It's kinda small, kinda hipster, and they don't have bud light (as if that gives them some kind of "cred").  I don't think I'd ever catch myself saying, "Hey, let's go to Tunnel Top!"  but I probably wouldn't protest if my friends wanted to stop in for a drink or two real quick.
author: Luis M.

description: It's kinda dirty ... it's kinda loud ... it kinda dangles over some mighty seedy massage parlors below on Stockton ... but it's way more than just kinda cool!
author: Gregor G.

description: This bar is so close to me that I call it my "Cheers" Bar!  The bartenders serve the drinks well.  Good amounts of alcohol and it still tastes great!  Good prices too.  I love the upstairs dance floor as well!   Great dive bar in my opinion!
author: Limzer L.

description: Monday nights are a soulful treat to a reggae beat for the most part. A great place to marinate and let the music and mojitos take you somewhere nice.
author: kevin m.

description: Fun place for happy hour.  Chimay, cool lighting, cozy space.  Cash only but that shouldn't stop you.
author: Bianca R.

description: Great neighborhood bar...with dj music...the view and bar balcony  makes this place singular and welcoming...lots of people on weekends...but a bar of choice to meet up and start the night!
author: Arissa C.

description: I hate bars where you have to scream to your friends and lean in real close to hear them scream back at you. Might be your thing but it just annoys me after a while. They need to turn the music down a notch. Still, I really liked the atmosphere and can imagine it can be a fun place. But letting people smoke in there? Yuck.
author: margot b.

description: If it's not crowded, this place is great.. Awesome drinks (they use fresh lime juice, and fresh ingredients--- fresh watermelon gimlet, anyone?), old barn type setting...I'm sold. When it's packed though, can't imagine it being as fun.  Minus one star for cash only...
author: Sonia S.

description: The venue itself is cool. I like it. But I would prefer it more during happy hour time than Friday night at 10/11pm. At that time it gets obscenely crowded and hot. You can forget about getting a drink, let alone finding a place to stand. However, for some reason, during happy hour, it's more tolerable. The gimlets are good, so are their martinis. It's cash only, which can be kind of an issue if you're planning on having more that 2 drinks. I'll go back, but only during times when I know I can 1) get a drink and 2) actually breathe.
author: Veronica W.

description:
The second I walked into this place, I got hit smack in the face with the aroma of urine. Not like the bathrooms were in heavy use, but like everyone had just pissed themselves, or like someone had just been too drunk to make it to the bathroom so instead they just pissed in the corner. Either one works for this review.

The bar was busy, but not the kind of packed you'd find in somewhat similar bars. We ended up sitting right at the bar for most of the night, ordering $4 Newcastle pints until around 1:30 am. The bartender was pretty nice and didn't mind when my friend decided to order 4 buttery nipples one at a time because his co-workers who couldn't stop talking about their stupid jobs liked them so much.

The DJ played a lot of hip hop, which was alright. Wu-Tang was a plus.

People seem to drop their glasses or spill their drinks when they're standing on the upper level, though. Twice someone dropped their drink, spilling on someone below. That was definitely not cool, especially when glass came raining down like death from above.

I'd probably come back to this place once or twice and I'll end up giving it another star, but only if they make everyone upstairs tape their drinks to their hands and if the place doesn't smell like urine. Otherwise it's a great place!
author: Alexis C.

description: Cool place to have a fun night. No cover, cheap drinks, good music. Slightly small, but not too crowded (maybe a little upstairs).
author: Eddy N.

description: Not down with the indoor smoking. Not down with "cash only". Not down with watery (yes, yummy) strawberry mojitos. I'm paying for alcohol, not sugary club soda. It was an okay place to pre-party but I won't be going out of my way to return.
author: Jen S.

description: Gotta love this place.  I like the fact that it's the kinda place you can just relax and have a drink at.  No pretentious faces, no weird suits gawking at you from the other end of the bar, just a nice friendly crowd looking to chat and have a few beers.  Its quaint, casual, friendly and nicely priced;)
author: Joella A.

description: Ugh!  The place reeked of bleach and/or solvent.  We were there for happy hour, so I'll imagine that the stench wears off as the night wears on.  The bartender was great though, so because there aren't many others like it near Union Square, the Tunnel Top is a'ight in my book.
author: Kyla B.

description: Went here on a Saturday afternoon when I was craving adventure, having spent the entire day at a comic book convention (um, who wins the prize for best girlfriend ever, that'd be me!).  The bartender, who was charmingly doing his laundry at the place across the street, mixed a FINE long island iced tea. Would def. visit again.
author: Maria D.

description: Egh, it alright!  It's your usual tattered, miniature dive bar.  The people appear to be friendly.  The drinks are not costly.  The music was corny.  Tada, review done.
author: romeo b.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco, and has been for years. It is always such a relief to escape the tourist melee of Union Square through the pissed drenched stairway to the bar's perch atop the Stockton Street Tunnel. It is small, dingy and unassuming on the outside, but inside it is a funky space with cool music and peoples and great drinks served by excellent bartenders. There happy hour consists of some very well priced cocktails, including some expert Mojitos. I have spent many an elongated late afternoon chilling here and if you stick around til the evening things pick up quite a bit with fun and funky music and tight-knit party vibe.
author: Daniel B.

description: Very cool bar and right up my alley. Small and simple. Great place for meeting up with people before a big night, or any other time. Liked goin upstairs and there was a dj up there playinig some good music that wasn't house or techno. Just a cool spot and there is couches upstairs........ It is cash only but theres an atm across the street.
author: Mike P.

description: OK, there's something about this place, maybe it's the music, maybe it's the groovy space, but I keep coming back. In spite of the gaggles of screechy girls, lost suburbanites and tourists. Somehow, through the annoying fog of all of that, there's still some pretty interesting people, good drinks and great vibe to the place.
author: Pierre K.

description: This place is great. I came here on a Saturday night and was totally impressed. Cheap drinks, great music (the DJ played my request instantly), lots of people but not too many, and no cover charge. I'll totally come back here again.
author: Julie F.

description: Um, this place hurt my head!  Ouch.
author: Poochie M.

description: This bar kicks ass.  Good music, good interesting crowd, great drinks.  Many enjoy the blackberry mojitos.  I stick to Hoegaarden on tap but it's a full bar and reasonably priced.  A great place to spend time with friends.
author: William G.

description: I like this place. I would like it a considerable amount more if it didn't smell like a freaking porta potty. Now, after 10 minutes the smell dissapates and you can enjoy yourself...but those first few minutes are ROUGH. With that said, I do like this place. The bartenders are really nice and attentive and the music is generally pretty good. I heard they have salsa dancing on Tuesday night...but I haven' t checked it out yet.
author: Jen G.

description: When it's not overrun by frat-tastic partiers this place is really cool. Really good ambiance with a cool chandelier made up of old wine bottles and pretty good deejays. Unfortunately on weekends it tends to be either ridiculously crowded or dead. Also it's cash only.
author: Cathy T.

description: I love this bar!! It's totally a little divey but a little chic. The drinks are strong and fairly priced, the crowd is chill and super cool, and the music is great. It's the best non-scene scene. I heart it!
author: Roseanne W.

description: Why this is styled a dive bar is beyond me.  Looks great, is great.  Love the wine rack chandelier and stairs, and it remains one of my favorite bars early in the evening.   (Never like the B & T crowd anywhere, and never liked the crowds anywhere late, so every where I like, I like it when it's not crowded.)  Perfect place, too, for a pre-Bar Crudo drink.   The watermelon martinis are good and generally, they mix a mean cocktail.
author: Laurel B.

description: This place should be called Debauchery Top... seriously I don't know what it is about this bar but it never fails that when we end up here it ends in debauchery! The crowd is always decent and the music is always really fun = silly dancing.
author: Rachael Z.

description: The Tunnel Top: Don't go here stone cold sober. Go after a few beers and wander upstairs to snag one of the coveted sofa seats. After you've made yourself cozy, make your friends battle the bar downstairs and buy you drinks while you get down to some old skool hip hop. They pour them strong and the next thing you know, you may be grinding on the make-shift dance floor. This is a true dive bar because anyone and everyone can be found here. Bottoms up.
author: E. N.

description: I'm surprised no one has mentioned how this place is mostly European... the bartenders speak "french" (although def. not the same french I grew up speaking) and most of the clientele seem European, a la hostel-inhabitants... this makes for an infinitely fascinating atmosphere, and I definitely enjoyed my night here. The drinks are very good (yes, mojitos), and the DJ was 80's-excellent... I would definitely come back, esp. now that I've had time to soak everything in.
author: Elishevah G.

description: this is a cool spot to meet with your friends and grab a few drinks...it's very cozy, warm, and intimate. Bartenders were nice-I liked the atmostphere....I dig the location and thats it's 2 stories....I'll be back
author: Dessa R.

description: There is something intrinsically romantic about Tunnel Top...the soft darkness...the candles leading up the stairs...the chandelier made of colored bottles...the 70's porn projected on the wall...  Well, maybe not the last one.  This is a pretty cool joint, though, with the advantage of amazing architecture.  It's small, but the "upstairs" doubles its square footage and has comfy seats, small tables, chairs, and a view out onto Bush Street.  Its name also lends the bar a unique and quirky charisma.  Why go to any old bar when you could go to one on TOP of a TUNNEL?  Right?
author: Natalie S.

description: I love this bar! Have been here a few times now and it does not disappoint. It's got kind of a Euro feel that I really enjoy. They've got a great Happy Hour that lasts until 8pm, which is key if you work any later than 6pm. I love the lounge upstairs. There is lots of room to cozy up with your closest pals. This is the place to go if you're in for a chill evening with good company. This is NOT the place to go if a.) you want a scene b.) you want to dance c.) you don't want to smell like smoke upon departure. I'll be back!
author: Jenny S.

description: On top of the Stockton Tunnel. Lived one block away from TT for ten years, before it was the TT it is now. I live nine blocks away now and it's still my favorite. It used to be a neon-lit bar for Asian men. Now I'd like to live there if this place weren't a bar. Great mini loft with dim lighting and cool glass-bottle chandelier. Really really good DJs (male and female) and interesting thought-provoking art that rotates. A few tables and lots of couch space upstairs. People get away with smoking upstairs too. Even did a New Year's Eve here once. Kudos to Ludo, the owner.
author: Bronwyn G.

description:
no cover, good drinks, salsa on tuesdays. and the bartenders aren't douchebags wither. whats not to love? 
just simple, 2-story place with a cool view if you're sitting by the window.  fun international crowd on tuesday/thursday.
i wish they had a few cheaper drink specials though, im just sayin.
author: Natasha F.

description: A friend took me here a few weeks ago and I was thoroughly unimpressed.  First of all, those of you that are calling this place a "dive bar" or a "true hole in the wall" seem to have no grasp of the concept.  This place was PACKED with hipster "look at me" people that wouldn't be caught dead in a proper dive.  The drinks were nice and strong, but it took forever to get one.  They do get one extra star for turning a blind eye to the smokers (I'm no smoker, but smoking bans for bars are unholy).  All in all an average at best bar that reminds me of all the generic bars on 6th street in Austin, TX.  Yeah, they can serve a decent drink, and yeah you might find yourself here when out drinking with friends, but it's not a place you'd ever actually choose to go to.
author: Joshua W.

description: Great mojito! Nice ambience - the only problem i have with it is the smoking. Kinda reminds me of the Hyde Out on California & Hyde.
author: nic t.

description: Average bar. I went for happy hour with a friend and we snagged two bar stools. It was pretty chill, but nothing special. Convenient location though.
author: Priyam D.

description:
i like to test bartenders. i test them with the request for a snakebite and watch them either stare at me blankly or usually incorrectly make me a black velvet. for some reason american bartenders have this mindset that a snakebite is the same thing as a black velvet. google it. you're wrong. i'm right. let's move on...

so, everyone goes to the tunnel top. no, not at once. but that would be interesting.. but yeah, this place doesn't really have a specific crowd except during happy hour. at that time, it always seems to be full of the type of people who look utterly destroyed from sitting in a cubicle all day long, staring at spreadsheets, but later, the crowd diversifies and becomes more interesting. favorite person i have seen there to date was an immense guy, by himself, wearing a t-shirt that read: "i support single mothers" with the silhouette of a stripper. pure. gold.

the service isn't bad, considering it's such a tiny bar. maybe i get better service because i'm willing to flash my tits for a beer. who knows. the upstairs gets smokey - shhh, don't tell the fire marshall. it's also a damn tight fit if you want to sit along the bannister. and i'm just waiting for that night that the candles on the steps really become a fire hazard. sometimes they have a dj, or maybe i only pay attention some of the time.

this is a good bar to set your drinking debauchery off with. if you're staying downtown, that is.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Three stars is being generous.  The friendly, overworked staff could not make up for the lame a*& crowd and the smoking.  I'm feeling sweet, and everyone has a bad night so they get three instead of two stars.
author: Amme P.

description: The Tunnel Top is my center of my equilibrium when it comes to local bars in San Francisco.  Can't admit I hit up this bar a lot, but when i do its always  good times with the friends!  Its a bar that everyone knows how to get to (even my dyslexic ass!)  If  you can make it up the piss scented Stockton tunnel stairs ur guaranteed a good time.  So order up a Vodka Tonic and enjoy the company of good people.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Eclectic nightlife
Atop the Stockton Tunnel
Smoking tolerated
author: HaikuReview X.

description: This bar is in a cool location (right about the Stockton tunnel) and the set up is awesome - the upstairs is a perfect place for chat and cocktails! They had unique drinks that all hit the spot. Definitely work checking out.
author: Anne A.

description: As a local bar situated only 2 blocks downhill from me, I enjoy it.  It is an odd mix of travelers, city folk, and weirdos.  The bar itself always has rad DJ's but sometimes the dancing queens just need to stop.  It is difficult to socialize with a large group unless you are lucky and snag one of the 2 large booths upstairs which are fabulous.  The gay male and straight female bartenders make it challenging for a lady (or 3) to get a drink.  You can always count on the Tunnel Top for a lazy and fun night out.
author: Michelle N.

description: To be fair, I didn't spend much time here and it was the last stop before heading home... Nonetheless, I had a good time, decent drinks, and the atmosphere was pleasantly casual. The music was a bizarre eclectic mix of tacky 90s hits, but that only added to the quirky vibe. Definitely not the highlight of a night, but great for a couple of warm-up drinks before moving on or a feel-good night-cap.
author: G. J.

description:
good happy hour until 8pm, nice layout.  they use empty bottles to fashion a chandelier.  i like recycling.

every time i go here i have fun and the crowd is always different.  great bartenders, friendly and attentive.  good prices

let them know if someone is being creepy or rude or both.  they'll take care of it.

they have free trail mix but you have to ask for it because its behind the counter in a closed container.  as a germaphobe this is how they won my heart.  i may be there too much, the bouncer and bartenders remember me. whatever,  don't judge me, i moved to san francisco because of the bars

tuesday is salsa and if you head upstairs you might be lucky enough to find someone to teach you how!  Good times.
author: kiki b.

description: I am embarrassed to say that I didn't know about Tunnel Top until last night.  What great spot!  I love the ambiance.  It's just the right size, not too cozy and not too large.  The upstair-seating along the walkway are cute.  The pomegranate cosmo special ain't half bad either. A perfect spot to get a drink before/after a play.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Lame music/DJ but pretty chill and friendly crowd.  But the music is loud and reminiscent of a bad suburban strip mall bar/club.
author: Joel M.

description:
great bartenders. cool crowd. and some kickass music.

sssshhhhh, smoking upstairs. yeah, it's cash only but you can use the ATM in the store next door to get cash.
author: Angela N.

description: This was our 3rd (?) bar of the night - so I don't really remember walking in or walking out of it. BUT, I remember admiring the look and feel of the place, and having a really great time chatting it up with friends. While that alone would give this place a good 5 stars, I can only give it 4 because my foggy memory only proves that I had somewhat of a beer goggle thing going on at  this point in the night.
author: Ro D.

description: Excellent Bar with a fun atmosphere and good music. Went there this past Friday with a group of friends and the dj was playing great music, they have fresh squeezed grapefruit juice for greyhounds, and the upstairs set up allows for dancing and  an impromptu game of charades!
author: Kaitlin O.

description:
We have always had nothing but a good time at the Tunnel Top.  It seems that their bartenders are all just a bit more friendly than bartenders at comparable establishments.  We often order Fernet shots when we come here, and this last time our nice bartender gave us a complimentary taste of Averna, an Italian bitter digestif, because he thought we might like to try it.  Very cool!

It has a dark atmosphere and a cool vibe.  Another plus is that we can go there and not feel like we're too much older than everybody else.  

I also like the fact that it's perched almost precariously above the Stockton Tunnel-- hence the name Tunnel Top.  It's above the infamous Green Door, right across the street from the Sutter Street entrance to the Sutter Stockton garage, and really just steps away from Union Square.  It's right near all those touristy places, but yet literally above it all.  A great place.  Just note that it is NOT open on New Year's Eve, as we found out this past year.
author: Dave N.

description: Tuesday night salsa!!! 'Nough said, this place offers some great music with an excellent selection of salsa partners!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Doesn't quite do it for me. I wouldn't say no to a drink here but I'd rather go somewhere else. A bit too crowded, a bit too professional, a bit too drunk.
author: patrick g.

description:
It depends on what you're looking for.  On some nights, when I'm in a clubby mood, this place has loud and good music coupled with relatively cheap drinks.  The problem is, the upstairs "dance" area is small and extremely crowded.  Expect to get drinks spilled on you.  On a weekday night like Thursday, it will tend to be a lot more quiet.

Overall, I've used this place most often as a place to preparty before heading out to another bar or club.  It's not within walking distance to anywhere, so expect to cab.

Also, I was disappointed by their watermelon shot.  While it is only $4, it's not strong at all.
author: Sylvi Y.

description: On my first visit to Tunnel Top on a random Saturday night, I found a cozy, & funky space, good drinks that don't break the bank, and good r&b, soul, and hip hop jams bumping from the speakers.  The beer bottle chandelier is cool and the watermelon martini - made fresh on the spot with *gasp* real watermelon - was the most refreshing, hydrating cocktail I have ever had.  I was bummed to have to leave early because of the people I was with - but I'm already planning a return visit to the Top with my homies.
author: Deborah L.

description: Great location, not pretentious, always fun, fantastic specials.  Good DJ's when they have 'em, free nuts, friendly staff.  A classic bar-room bathroom that's worthy of a Tarantino/Slasher film.
author: Christian W.

description: I just discovered this bar when researching a massive pub crawl and it is amazing. With two floors and a sleek red interior, this is a wonderful bar to accommodate large groups of thirsty patrons. Their expertly mixed mojitos are refreshing and delicious but anything here is good because it's moderately priced and served up quickly. Thanks Ludovic for a wonderful stop on our crawl!
author: Jessica M.

description:
salsa tuesdays, saweet. sometimes they have a good DJ. Booty shaking is always fun. $3 fernets can't go wrong. This place draws a big Industry crowd, which I'm always game for. Not a fan of the smoking ciggies indoors though. Makes my hair smell.( lose a star for that one-sorry)
I think I've actually been cut off here, nope not here, that was the other place. Tunnel top loves me
author: t f.

description: Pretty much my favorite spot on a Saturday night. Both Friday and Sat night they have a DJ pumping the jams.  Not crowded. Nice people and space to chillax
author: All About Town ..

description: If you just want to kick back and have a drink. Low key. Cash Only.
author: Loren T.

description: I think they used to have a cool funk night or something 4 years ago. I don't generally enjoy pushing my way through tons of people staring down their noses. This place is way too crowded all the time, and frankly, I don't see what the big fuss is.
author: Katie R.

description:
Pluses: Upstairs area is interesting, music is usually really good. Good meeting spot/warm-up bar.
Minuses: Can get crowded to the point of impossible movement. Bartenders have shitty attitudes. Drinks are expensive for a basic bar.
author: Jonathan M.

description: The bottle rack chandelier - an ode to Duchamp - sets the tone here.  charmingly quaint, the two-story bar boasts a balcony level with chic lounge seating and little tables that offer a voyeristic view through warehouse-like windows onto the busy street below where patrons are coming and going.  I don't think tourists come here - good riddance! You are not cool enough. Great service, music from the DJ spinning upstairs, films projected on the wall.  The austerity of the city mingled with the charm of a farmhouse or irish pub.
author: Katie H.

description: They have two of my favorite specialty gins,  Hendricks and  209...oh, AND a giant  Spanish caste iron and bronze crucifix..so yeah.
author: audrey w.

description: A very cool bar that I "happened" upon after dinner at Bar Crudo.  Funky interior, stiff drinks and a nice local crowd...I've never even heard of this place until now.
author: Laurence H.

description: I love the vibe here. It's beautiful, it's an interesting space, and it's an interesting location. I need to go back more.
author: Monika M.

description: Had a couple beers here last night.  I've always wanted to go, but it seems to keep weird hours... or maybe I just like to drink at odd times... i.e. 2 p.m. on a wednesday, or hung over on new year's day...  any case, 1 star off for two failed attempts to drink atop the tunnel... but third time's a charm, am I right?  the place was cool, i didn't really look around too much, but the beer bottle chandelier was rad, and the red lighting made me feel like I was being deliciously naughty...  Would have liked to have gone upstairs to explore, but there was some kind of frat party (or something) going on up there... and I'm not in college anymore, so...  I knocked the second star off because the dj only played one verse of "umbrella" but played that stupid new alicia keys song all the way through... and I can't abide that.
author: Caleb D.

description: So I've walked by this bar a few times and never thought much of it.  However, after work on Friday a bunch of us continued our mid-day drinking by catching a cab to Tunnel Top.  I really liked the atmosphere and the drinks were pretty cheap as far as San Francisco goes.  There also seemed to be a lot of other architects there, although I'm not sure if that's how it usually is.  I'll definitely be going back to the tunnel soon!
author: Nate V.

description: I'm am a fan!  One of the fanciest dive bars I've come encountered with in a while.  Cheap, stiff drinks and there's 2nd floor which is great for people watching.  Can't wait to party here again!
author: Ty H.

description: This place is fairly small and gets really crowded, but it somehow holds my heart for both meeting interesting characters and the effort my bartender took into squeezing the fresh watermelon into my mojito...It's an easy walk from downtown, so catching a cab home is fine...nice place to go on Sat. night if you want a noisy bar scene w/ pals but w/o obnoxious drunk kids..More of an older, work crowd and plenty of single professionals..
author: Heleena H.

description: I've been saving my yelp cherry for this place, and tonight's the night that I break out the candles, incense and ambient music to get it on.  I basically moved into my apartment because it's within stumblehome distance from this bar.  As other folks have written, it's an interesting mix of people.  Financial district types, hipsters and proto-hobos all mingle happily here.  The barkeep-folk are sweethearts and the music is usually pretty excellent.  I heart you Tunnel Top.
author: Matthew L.

description:
i really liked tunnel top. its a nice spot right over the tunnel, hence the name. there's a second floor, that's super open an you can just look down at the first floor where the bar is. it's pretty dark, but has this redness to it and the window allows light from the buildings and street outside. 

got a bit crowded, but met some cool people that night. the dj was good. people started dancing upstairs towards the second half of the night. oh and drinks are surprisingly cheap.

only down, parking isn't so great. but loved everything else
author: Natalie B.

description: After spending a few more nights here, I need to edit.  The crowd is great...Friendly, fun-loving and not pretentious.  The staff is awesome and the music makes you want to move.  The vibe in this place is so upbeat and high energy, it's easy to find good strangers to talk to.  Bring your cash...There is an ATM machine right outside though.  Initially I gave it 4 stars, but if every time is a 5-star time, why underrate?
author: ellyk E.

description: I totally dig this place for the low key kind of vibe.  Although, when I went here for a "low-key" night, they started playing some really loud house music, that I wasn't into, but it also was a weekend night.
author: Mitch A.

description: I've been going here since I moved to sf.  good drinks, chill atmosphere and smoky - couldn't ask for anything more in a bar.  They screen movies on the wall and it is a good place to catch up on your Bruce Lee trivia - since thats all they play.
author: o o.

description: I hafta say that I was in here for that last two Wednesdays and I am really diggin the Vibe and the Old School beats..  After just getting back from Philly, it felt really good to be feelin' and doin' it and doin' it well...
author: Rose C R.

description:
i love me some tunnel top. introduced to me by the one and only maria, last year, it is now my plan b bar, if not plan a. it's always a good time.

the drinks are reasonably priced. the music is always good. there's a movie playing on the projector screen in the back ground. 

the downstairs area is cool but if it's not crowded, you should head upstairs, there's better seating up there.

for you smokers, you're allowed to smoke inside.

the best part for me is, the blonde bartender guy knows how to make a red-headed slut. it's a delicious shot. we were sluttin it up that night.
author: Tatiana D.

description: A really great bar with surprisingly a lot of room inside and a great atmosphere! The balcony is a great place to grab a small table or stand, there was some people groovin' to the DJ. I really liked the feel of this place but it's hard to explain why. They definitely had the mood lighting thing going, the DJ wasn't great but he spun some decent hip hop, and the drinks are reasonably priced. The only downside, they were allowing people to smoke upstairs so that made for an early exit by us.
author: Kristin D.

description: This place is AWESOME!  A great bar that has good drinks, great staff, and a really good DJ on Friday nights with videos playing.  There is an upstairs section with some couches, tables and small dancing area.  If you like good drinks, dancing, and dont want a club atmosphere this is the place to be!
author: Margaret B.

description: I'm finding the loft set up for establishments here in the city more and more common place.  Not that I'm dissing or anything, I like to people watch from a throne like stance.  Tunnel Top does not disappoint.  Interesting, possibly deadly wine bottle chandelier is kinda kewl.  The bathroom is set up strangely, there's like an pre bathroom atrium area, which unfortunately cuts into some serious square footage of what could have been a decent sized lavatory.
author: Sam N.

description: The Tunnel Top is great.  A funky dive packed with a diverse group.  A decent DJ was spinning everything from house to old school hip hop.  Drinks were all very affordable; I would have liked to have tried a organic mojito but ended up sticking with beer.  The Bartenders were fast and efficient.  The environment is great.  The concierge at our hotel said he'd personally buy us a drink if we could spot any tourists at the tunnel top, and he was right. If back in town soon I would absolutely return.
author: J. N.

description: I was here for happy hour with some co-workers and there was a really small earthquake. All I could think was "My mom is going to be so disappointed when they find my body at the Tunnel Top."
author: Carson H.

description: They got the drinks and prices right , and I like the location.  But it's always cramped and hot, so it's pretty rare that I would choose this over the nearby dives.
author: Joseph N.

description: This place is awesome. Awesome bar. Awesome music. Awesome crowd (typically). Alot of awesomeness. I work in Union Square and Tunnel Top is the best place to unwind,kickback a few and cut a rug if you must.  Plus CHIMAY! This place can get full of euro touristy douchbaggery really quick which at times keeps my visits short
author: Jedi H.

description: This IS a cool bar.  You yelpers are right on, I love Yelp.  The bartender was so super nice.  We parked it upstairs, which was chill.  However, it smelled sort of like the bathroom.  Other than that, good times.
author: Sarah F.

description: Good deals on beer. Gets pretty crowded. Ok music. No line, no cover.
author: Steve C.

description: what else do I need more to say? - you can smoke and drink upstair at the same time. Perfect for me!
author: Flora H.

description: I like the vibe, the strength of the drinks, the service and the space.  Granted, I got totally dissed by the dj when I tried to make a request, but maybe he just really liked his stuff and didn't want suggestions.  Other than that, the drinks are reasonably priced, some good beers on tap, and though it  gets pretty crowded, people seem to be in good spirits!  Hmm, maybe I know where I'll be going after work on Friday!
author: Lauren H.

description: i used to come here once in a while when i worked down the street. it's a fun place to meet friends or just chill after dealing with crowds in union square. even though it can get crowded, the bartenders have always been attentive and friendly. i've always have a good time at TT and it's got a great interior and unique setup that makes it a fun place to throw down a few.
author: Art O.

description: Remember to tip the bartender. My 6$ drink was made oh so strong due to a hefty tip. And they remember, like all good bartenders should, who the big tippers are. My drink was so strong, that i would not even pour it that strong in my house, even if I was trying to get bombed fast.  92% makers 8% coke..........that strong.......God bless you!!!!
author: Scotch B.

description: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G, amazing!!!  Saturdays are like a club and filled wall-to-wall with straights!!!  Which, normally, wanting to be around my gay community I am not a fan of but tonight was great and the music is awesome!!!
author: Steven K.

description: Hey! What happens at the Tunnel Top, STAYS at the Tunnel Top, okay? I plead the 5th so I can't tell you the deets. All I can say is that I always have a fun, memorable experience here.
author: Stephanie I.

description: TUNNEL TOP! My gf and I have been wanting to check this place out for quite a while now and we finally made it there on a Thursday nite. I guess it gets really packed for happy hour b/c it was all assholes and elbows trying to move through the crowd, but that was when I was trying to take a leak. The upstairs loft area is decent sized w/tables and chairs and a catwalk like area around the rest of the bar. Drinks were pretty cheap and they have DJ's rotating throughout the week. I'll be back again.
author: Gary T.

description: Wow. My divey tunnel top got a makeover, and a good one at that! Used to be a bit dark inside, a place where you go for happy hour.  But now Tunnel Top has a bit of a loungy feel, with the chandelier and the deep toned reds.  Maybe a bit more help on the mojito drinks..the mango, rasberry still taste like a mint...but nice job ;)
author: Kris O.

description: I wish there were more places like this around Union Square.  A two-story dive bar perched over the Stockton tunnel with big horseshoe-shaped couches ideal for large groups.  Plus, they bring in DJ's that spin eclectic music, often with some random film projected on the wall.
author: Rego S.

description: I got 2 pints of cider for $2.75 each during their happy hour. Totally worth it. The atmosphere is not divey but not upscale either. It's probably the most straightforward bar in the vicinity of Union Square.
author: Annee T.

description: Tunnel Top is almost everything I look for in a bar.  Cheap, strong drinks, amazing music, good set-up inside, a chill crowd, and not overcrowded.  I came here on a Friday night and the minute I walk in, the DJ is blasting "The Message" and I know I'm among friends.  I only had 2 drinks that night but that was definitely sufficient.  The first was the largest mojito I've ever had and the second was a drink special called the Evening Glory.  Holy mother, that thing was STRONG and GOOOOOOOD.  Fresh strawberries crushed under ice with vodka vodka vodka vodka vodka vodka.... and soda.  It was like an alcoholic-smoothie-enthusiast's DREAM!  As the night went on, the crowd never got rowdy, belligerent, or obnoxious and the music just kept getting better.  And... What?  Is that Bonita Applebum I hear?  I'm in heaven and they serve strong mixed drinks.
author: Grace K.

description: Cool bar-- divey without being a dive. Has a rock 'n roll vibe.  Great mojitos.  Grab a seat upstairs, by the windows overlooking Bush Street, and do some serious people watching over cocktails!
author: shoba d.

description:
cool space.  the ladies always seem to enjoy the cocktails with the super fresh fruit.  i've only had sips, but they seem to be pretty awesome.  i also managed to hit on a married woman (FORGOT TO CHECK FOR THE RING...) so you know they pour them drinks strong.  

whoever was spinning that night was going old school and had a sick mix going on.  major props.  great place to just chill and have a drink without the overly done up club hos all over the place.
author: Steven C.

description: This place is awesome. I have fond and foggy memories of Tunnel Top. What more can I say that hasn't been said. I enjoy a drunken wander home as much as the next guy but it's nice to know you can just about always get a cab out front. Man I love Tunnel Top.
author: Klik W.

description: Atmosphere was chill and thumping! I'm not a big fan of smoke (smoking allowed upstairs so one star off) but the drinks made up for it! Decently priced drinks and strong like a mofo. Bartender was a sweetheart. The crowd was very eclectic and friendly. I was dressed down in my green chucks but it didn't matter since no one could see my feet anyway. DJ played some classic hip hop. Overall, great chill place to start your night of bar hopping.
author: Christina Y.

description: This place is great!!! Very laid back, great music, you can smoke on the second floor which sorta reminds me of Vegas and the good old days in Manila. Different crowds each night but also the set few who come to this joint and call it their living room.
author: Jose S.

description:
theme nights dot the schedule of this place - music and atmosphere are immense. despite the fact that some of the decor is kind of cold and dungeon'esk, the place brings out the sexy hedonistic part of most people. wait, no, that actually makes sense...

you can smoke on the second floor, and gain a good vantage point from atop as well. 

people tend to get dancing once the clock starts nearing a decent hour, and if youre there with a group, itll be cramped, but chill. 

and where else can you hit the head and rock your head back and forth to the rhythmic steps of the dancers above you as you let loose?
author: Darrell L.

description: TT's #101 review and my 300th review of a bar...I'm not going to read into that too much. These guys are great. I had been before and it was an ok experience, but yesterday they opened on their day off to take in the overflow from the Crudo benefit - even with the massive influx of drunks they were charming! The spot is adorable with a fantastic upstairs where you can canoodle the night away, of which there were plenty of couples doing.  Something about the ambiance lends itself to make-outery. When it was time to kick us out the staff were very nice, but firm (I said firm staff). We took our glasses down & put them on the bar, because I'm ocd that way, and they were really gracious about that. I didn't even mind that people were smoking, but I don't think it was as crowded at 6pm on Sunday as a weekend night.
author: Colleen B.

description: I like this bar.  I've been here a couple times now. The crowd has always been fun.  The music was great.  Also, they serve Newcastle on tap (one of my faves).
author: Angie C.

description: I can't believe I have forgotten to review my all-time fav bar.  I use to frequent it nearly daily (I'm not an alchy...I use to live above the bar!) & love how chill yet lively this place is.  I have met so many neighbors and tourists (mostly euros) here, it is a fun mix.  Not to mention the fact that you can smoke upstairs (I love to smoke when I drink), and the beats some of the djs spin...I love this place.
author: Mabel L.

description: Good music (hiphop on saturday), dim lighting, couches, small dancefloor and cheap drinks. $3.50 for a rum & coke, in the city? Wtf? I can't believe places like this still exist. The crowd was cool and laid back and the bartender was a nice guy. Even on a Saturday night, the place was full but not so full that I had to maneuver. Everything is just right here.
author: N S.

description: funky, casual vibe, great drinks! blackberry mojito--best in town. be back soon! :)
author: Djamila D.

description:
i wouldn't really call it a dive bar. it isn't dirty. the music is good. the crowd is wealthy.

it's just, well, a little dark. and hard to find free parking. but it is directly above the stockton street tunnel, so you'd expect sucky parking in the neighborhood, regardless of the time of day/year.

they have a DJ every night at 10pm, who is decent but unfortunately the music is piped into the speakers so loudly that you need to yell to have a conversation. 

the drinks are good and cheap [except for some bomb erdrinks, they'll charge you separately for an entire guinness for an irish car bomb of an entire red bull can for a jaeger bomb], but they only take cash. and there are no atm's nearby, so bring it with you.

the narrow balconies up top that lead to the DJ booth are good for couples to hang out, but any group larger than 2 people will have everyone contorting around the rail just to pay attention to each other. it's also where the music is the absolute loudest. stick to the larger area or the lower floor for optimal conversational pleasure.

again a nice place, but bring cash, earplugs [or just have you and your friends communicate via text messaging, it might work better], and your best banana republic outfit. this is the Financial District crowd, no doubt about it.
author: Charles C.

description: Okay place... a so so mojito, cool chandelier... but I had the most uninteresting conversation with the most uninteresting person here...Also lots of hipsters and financial types looking to pick up said hipsters... kind of a weird melting pot that doesn't quite work for me.
author: Doris M.

description: This place is a nice mellow joint with two floors.  I recommend the watermelon gimlet.  One less star because they let people smoke.  I'm not against smoking, it's just hard to bear in a confined space.
author: Pelle Y.

description: This place was a trip.  As soon as we walked in, it had that churchy feeling atmosphere.  It was red and dark and a video or t.v. is being projected onto an antique picture frame and candles all over the place.  As we walked upstairs, there was a big cross, so being Catholic, I thought I had to kneel and do that thing with your hands.  I couldn't help but have my drink blessed by this cross.  I know it's a bad joke, but hey... I've been good everywhere else.  Other than that, atmosphere was OK for me and the drinks were fairly cheap.  When people ask where it is, you tell them it's Behind the Green Door (isn't that a name of a porno????)... anyway, I liked where it was located, because it's like going to the Batcave to get there.
author: Nino M.

description: I came here for the first time the other night.  Not bad if I may say so myself.  We were able to get some stools by the door on a saturday night.  Love the fact that the bartenders had a heavy hand.  Wasn't too big on the raspberry mojito that I tried (now I know to stick to my usual).  Ang OMG the drinks were freaking cheap.  I might be too used to paying 11 to 12 bucks a drink but shit I was able to get 3 and I repeat 3 drinks for $17.  What deal.  I'll come back again...ha also to try Bar Crudo next door.
author: Allison T.

description: I was impressed by this place a few months back.  It was a Friday night, and it was busy, but my friend and I could still get a seat upstairs.  Nice decor, reasonably priced drinks, and no visible douchebaggery.  It gets a big plus for its diverse, laid-back crowd.
author: Charles C.

description: Tunnel Top is a great neighborhood dive bar.  The Guiness and Hoegaarden are always good pours and never expensive.  I'd say Tunnel Top packs a good bang for buck, and it's a great spot to pre-game before heading out to the clubs around Union Square or in SoMa.  Catching a cab on Bush is never that difficult either, after coming out of this fine establishment.  It's definitely dive-y, so don't expect martini glasses and pin-striped suits, but you can expect friendly service, good tunes, and great prices.
author: Robert S.

description: Absolutely one of my favorite bars in The City, hands down. Tunnel Top combines a very cool and unique interior with very friendly and fun bartenders, as well as interesting drinks at decent prices. A great location only a few blocks from Union Square and talented DJs don't hurt, either. It is cash only, so make sure you have some extra currency in your pocket before you make your way over. One of my typical haunts in the neighborhood, a five star bar for when you need some enjoyable company and drinks!
author: Aaron J.

description: This place was so much fun!  It was a quiet Saturday night and between my girlfriends and I, no one wanted to get into anything too crazy!  So we went over to this small 2-story bar into club venue where the place was packed.  The music is pretty much early 90s and top 40s.  The DJ was completely into his set and the people seemed to be as well.  There was a mix of Guns 'N Roses and Earth, Wind, and Fire, and other great jams pre-2000.  Its a fun place to dance with your girls and not be bothered by completely nasty and sleazy guys...like the ones you would find at a more "hip and new" club.
author: jen k.

description: Simply best Mohitos in the world! Beautiful place!
author: Vera S.

description:
i went here the other night and i decided to get one of the suggested drinks, a fresh blackberry mojito, and it did not have much taste to it. my friends got drinks that seemed to lack flavor, and the employee was slow. 

but the look of the place was great and i would love to go back and hope that it will be better next time i go.
author: brian j.

description: Good dive bar that's not so much a dive.  Cash only please.  Stairs can be a bit difficult to navigate after a few too many drinks, but overall fun place with a really friendly bartender.  Cosy upstairs.  Good place for meeting up with friends.
author: Jolsna J.

description: For the longest time, I couldn't reconcile the hoards of people smoking upstairs at the Top with, you know, the whole Cali-no-smoking thing.  Apparently there's some catch, which was explained to me once, but I'd had a few too many to remember.  Either way, I head here early in the evening when in the mood for low-key swank.  Think retro-ish West Village hangout, complete with filmstrip projected on the wall.  Later in the night there are just a tad too many I'm-so-cool-for-you-and-yet-wasted types for this place to be a consistent neighborhood staple.
author: MScott S.

description: The little dive bar that isn't!  Very chill. Love the upstairs loft area....great place to chit chat with old friends or cozy up to new ones.
author: Laurie A.

description: It's crowded in here.  Damn, is it crowded.  They usually have a DJ on a Star Wars-like catwalk on the balcony.  This is just kind of a place to chill and hit on strangers, who are in the process of becoming ever so slightly more intoxicated.
author: Apollo L.

description: Too many suits were in this place for it to be considered a true dive bar.  Stopped in before having dinner at Bar Crudo next door (excellent raw and cooked seafood) and ordered one of the special drinks: a watermelon martini.  Looked promising.  Fresh watermelon cube floating in a mixture of fresh watermelon puree and vodka.  Well, how wrong I was.  As my friend put it, "tastes like pure acetone."  Guess I should have ordered a beer.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Tunnel Top is a dive bar?  Yes, the sign outside suggests that the interior might sport some cracked leather bar stools, but I think it's anything but.  Bar is your standard setup on the first level, but the upstairs has some couches and nice little nooks and crannies that are appropriate for more intimate conversations.  Good happy hour specials.  Seems to be the place to be on Tuesdays, which are affectionately known as Tunnel Top Tuesdays in our office,
author: Amy Z.

description: Gretest dive bar in SF....small palce and great people..Can be quite smelly in there though..Overall favorite place to chill and not be bothered if you are a girl :)
author: Tricia M.

description: You know, this place is just fine by me, not amazing like the Black Horse London Pub.  I thought they could have better happy hour specials and its cash only.
author: Lindsay T.

description: One of the first bars I went to in SF, and after the hike up the hill, only to go into this dive and find out they only served Pabst Blue Ribbon, I was like, what the hell kind of city is this?  Then I took my beer and sulked in the corner and slowly let the vibe come over me.  I was with some friends, so we started talking and having a good time and realized that it's not the quality of the bar that you go to, it is the vibe that you get from it and if it make you feel welcome and relaxed and this place definitely did.  Granted I never went back however...
author: Pele N.

description: On a weeknight the Tunnel Top is just right. The location is interesting and slightly out of the way. The colors and the shapes are fantastic both inside and out. The music can be a a bit loud at times, but it's often good stuff.
author: Gavin G.

description: If I were to have friends come visit, this is definitely one of the bars that we would end up at, either at happy hour or at the end of the night.  Good spots to chill upstairs when the first floor gets crowded (and it will).  A wide variety of Chill music.  This place attracts a diverse and interesting crowd.  Come wearing a t-shirt or button down shirt, who cares?!
author: Mike D.

description: I've been told this is the industry bar for folks who work in Union Square, but I didn't see much of that when I went there on a friday night. Drinks were tasty but hard to order due to the crowd. The upstairs was not particularly well ventilated when I was there, but who goes to a bar for their health eh?
author: Tom S.

description: Came here for the lounge, stayed for the dive.  Need to go here more often although to be avoided on weekends.
author: Shan K.

description:
myfavritebar
merci,ludo,jeanmi..........
thestaff
author: germain m.

description: Ttop is a small, hole in the wall near union square.... awesome bartenders, good vibe, great dj on Mondays :)
author: Sylvie L.

description: This is a top-notch neighborhood bar. There are DJ's on the weekends who really know how to throw down. There is no dance floor, and in the later portion of the night is standing room only. Upstairs can get a little stuffy, hence the fans. There's one bar (the place isn't very big), but they are great about getting you drinks. And when your muscles get a little crampy, you can head downstairs and get an alternative masseuse.
author: M S.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Tunnel Top!!!!! Been coming here for years, and there are many fond memories of this place. Used to go to this place with my friends from work two or three times a week. And many people may see this as a downfall, but they let you smoke cigarettes on the upper floor. Being a recovering nicotine addict, i see this as a plus. Sorry =(
author: Lynette R.

description: It's fun to sit in the smoky haze and watch yuppies slum it and dance (really, really badly) to whatever the DJ is spinning, all the while trying to figure out what movie is being projected on the wall and trying even harder to put off having to use the restroom because the ladies' room at this place is pretty much one of the nastiest bathrooms I've ever been in. It's like people get so drunk they can't figure out where the toilet is. I have to roll up my pant legs whenever I need to use the WC -- don't want them dragging in any puddles.
author: Michaela B.

description: Great dive bar... hard to pull that off, but Tunnel Top manages to do it. Casual atmosphere mixed with laid back crowd make this a great place to hide away for a few drinks.
author: Jyri K.

description: Perfect joint for happy hour or a pre-date cocktail. When in a group, get there early to grab the comfy lounge area upstairs. Great for people watching. Drinks are very reasonably priced.
author: Jon b.

description: Not a bad spot in the hours right after work.  But later it gets crowded with people you don't want to be crowded with, and the smoking is not for me.
author: John Z.

description: Definately a favorite! Rocking DJ's most nights, a little crowded on the weekends but always a good time.
author: Doug H.

description: Good music on Wednesday nights.  We went there on a Saturday and the place was kickin!  Music was still good!  Old school hip hop and the place was packed!  I'm definitely a fan.  One advice:  BRING CASH, the ATM machine next door is broken and you would need to walk down to the other street through the peer infested stairs....
author: Abby E.

description: After serious bouts of drink binging I've considered talking to the owner about changing the name to Dradle, Dradle only because the room wouldn't stop spinning.
author: Vanessa C.
