description: Went back recently and the place looks like it was renovated or something but same cool place with great drinks. Lively atmosphere and I must say a very attractive brunette slinging the drinks...
author: R P.

description: I went to Tunnel Top on Friday, passed midnight coming from a friend's gig at Boom Boom Room. Just wanted to check out the place since it got a lot of good reviews. Generally to say, the place was cool. Awesome music!! Mediocre drinks. Inexpensive tho. There's a second floor. You can easily mix with people or find your own corner. I would like to give the place 4 stars... However, it was a little bit awkward over the crowd. Bunch of pretentious wannabes. The place made me feel low.... I should just stay at BBR......minus one star.
author: Angie L.

description: Strong, cheap drinks. And it's next to Bar Crudo, which has excellent food. Get there early to score a seat upstairs (although you'll have to send someone down to get the drinks...preferably someone sober who won't trip or fall).
author: kim m.

description: Total dive bar that I've gone to for happy hours.  If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd prolly give it a 4 stars for proximity purposes but other than that if you're into mixed drinks this might not be the place for you.  I've gone there a couple times and my mixed drinks have always been off.  Price is decent.  One feature I do like about this place is its little upstairs seating area, but you have to be quick if you have a group because this seating area gets filled up fast.
author: Syonora A.

description: I love Tunnel Top.  It's hip but not pretentious with a mixed crowd of patrons.  It's downtown in the Union Square area but it's got a local vibe to it.  The bartenders are cooler than most.  The music is always bumpin'.  Minus one star because it's so dang crowded on the weekends (as is the case with pretty much every bar in this thirsty city) and because the dancing area isn't quite big enough to be comfortable.
author: Jenni A.

description: I meet some friends here for a happy hour on a Tuesday night. We had not ever been here before and found the place with a Happy Hour application on our phones. We were definitely pleased with the few drinks we had here. A great intimate environment with the typical red-lit darkness that seems to be the norm in San Francisco. They had a some good beers on tap (Anchor Steam, Speak Easy, etc.) and a well-stocked shelf of low end to high-end booze. We sat at the bar, but the loft area with tables that wrapped around the bar looked inviting as well and made a great-silhouetted scene when the sun was setting. Laid-back atmosphere with live music occasionally, make this a bar I will want to revisit.
author: m p.

description: OK...The Tunnel Top sucks. Not only are the drinks pricey....AND weak....but it may be the most uncomfortable bar in the city to hang out in...even when it's NOT jam packed full of retards. The bar is narrow so when you walk in you have a limited amount of space between the stairs and the bar...if you don't get a seat...you're fucked...because after that your only other option is heading upstairs to stand or sit pressed up against the edges of the wall on a catwalk. It's lame. There are sooo many other great bars in this beautiful city of ours...why do it? Though, I am still forced to go here on occasion because some of my stupid friends think it's cool...it's NOT cool.
author: Karl N.

description: Used to be a cool spot when they actually had experienced dj's that hadn't just left their bedroom for the first time. Embarassing mixing by these happy hour dj's have scared the peeps elsewhere, including me. Now it has become  more of a neighborhood hang as it was before it got semi-swanked so if you're looking for a quieter excursion, it's ok. Not much else happening in the area so probably better to stay below the Tunnel.
author: jim d.

description: We had an event there last week.  The owner is nice but neither he nor the bartenders were very accomodating.  They acted like they were doing us a favor even though we brought a large group to their un-filled bar.  I would recommend the place to chill and meet up with friends but not to have an event.
author: Dean P.

description: i'll give this place 2 stars because i do like a drink and they will supply it, but smoking is allowed. i would tell my younger friends to hit this place up. tight spaces to bump into others they might want to be in tight spaces with. my smoker friends will like it here since upstairs you can smoke without having to go outside in the cold rain, or leave that hot person you just met behind while you step out for a smoke. i would tell my friends that have a hard time holding a conversation to go here since talking will be useless because of it is loud. some of my ugly friends might do well here too as the lighting is dim. not my kind of place but it is a good place for those i spoke of, or tourists in the union square area.
author: roger b.

description: Tunnel Top is my neighborhood bar, can't be any closer or I would be living there. I always hear the drunkards coming out of TT on Saturday and Friday nights from my nearby apartment, but sometimes it's best to just participate in the festivities myself. Tonight was a random TT night- I've been here quite a few times and I always order the exact same thing: blackberry mojito. The drinks are serious, no watered down BS here. My particular concoction was made with crushed blackberries and loads of mint leaves. The end product is served in a tall glass over ice with straws. I usually have a hard time finishing these beasts, since they are so potent and so sweet, but I never seem to have a problem finding someone to help me out. I can't quite figure out the crowd- it seems to vary depending on the night, but tonight was mainly Marinaites-not too many hipsters. We sat upstairs in the dimly lit attic and looked down over the long bar and crowds below. There is a cool chandelier made from old wine bottles which adds character to the decor. Someday I am going to take my SLR and get some kick ass photos of this place, because the view down below has definite artistic potential.
author: Kate A.

description: What a pleasant surprise - an unexpected GREAT TIME was had here!  Loving the cozy quarters upstairs, where you can get your groove on and mingle with some cool peeps.  Salsa dancing upstairs - no shame!  Very hip, divey bar.
author: Lisa L.

description: Cheap and strong drinks.  Need I say more?  The atmosphere is awesome too.  This is a fun place for locals and visitors alike.  I don't get out often, but when I do, I head to the TT!
author: Janet J.

description: After a botched attempted to interview for a job. I decide to call Gina and mosey out with her for the evening. So i trek my arse out to arguello and mcallister to check out her place. I had a latte and a glass of wine... Gina had five shots of vodka.... we leave and we walk to the 1 California.... and it begins... "man Gina i gotta pee... why didn't i go before i left your house... DAMN IT" so we hop the bus and travel out to north beach via china town... "are we there yet? How many blocks do we have to walk? I need to PEE!!!" (yes there was an increase in the sense of urgency). So we finally... it felt like forever.... roll up to Moose's where we were suppose to go and check out this funk band and the place is closed... we missed the boat... fuckers... But they were rad and let us use the bathroom (review to follow) Oh man that was the best bathroom break EVER! fo real, fo real..... FO REAL. So now what?!? Uh i don't know...hmmm we can go to Tunnel Top, haven't been there in awhile.... never been....really?? we are soo growing (yea this was a conversation i am over using quotation marks) we walk back through C-town and up the Stockton tunnel past the Ritz Charlton and through the magical gates of wonderland... or the front door of the bar. Surprise! it is Latin night wooooo-whoooo. We ran into this dude David Molina that we know and chatted and danced and drank one too many Jameson neats... oh yea all the smoking all the crosses... i missed this bar. I even got some peeps to trek out from bernal because of the word.... "where you at?!?!?" "Tunnel"...
author: o. c.

description: good place to come unwind after a hard day of working.  cash only, which sucks, but they make a mean strawberry mojito.
author: Helen T.

description: Some might describe the Tunnel Top as a dive.  I myself would say it was like a charming little wooden cabin in the middle of a city.  Aside from the warm interior the Tunnel Top had good music that kept me and my friends upbeat and put us in the mood to laugh.  We found ourselves not only reminiscent but totally delighted with the vibe that was going on there.  The drinks were good and not overpriced.  Despite our To Do's in SFC, the Tunnel Top was it for us...love at first drink
author: Niki M.

description: when i first wandered in here a few years ago i thought i would hate it because it doesnt look like much, but i love this place. best place to grad a table is upstairs because you can see everyone below. its a dark place where you drink hard and talk loud. everytime i go its packed with a very interesting bunch.
author: Michelle I.

description: Stopped by this place with my boyfriend for a Saturday happy hour before heading out for the night. 2.50 bottled beers can't really be beat. The place wasn't crowded about 7:30-8:30 when we were there. Just a few small groups. The place is pretty dark which makes it feel a little more comfortable and intimate. My boyfriend and I were able to enjoy a nice conversation at the bar. It is a nice casual place to start the night.
author: Lauren H.

description: I love love love this bar.  It's my favorite bar, maybe for sentimental reasons, but I do love it.  The music is always good, it's never too crowded but always just crowded enough, the bartenders are nice, and the red lighting makes me feel pleasant inside.  You'll feel comfortable sitting or dancing.
author: Donna F.

description: this place is cozy, casual, and cool. the drinks are strong, the crowd is mixed...the seating can be a bit tight when crowded, but it more then makes up in music, and people-watching.
author: Sha A.

description: i was randomly introduced to this place years ago and every time i go back, it's just as fun.  the music has always been good, the crowd mixed and cool and the drinks stiff.  love it.
author: Seong P.

description: if im in the area and we're trying to figure out where to get a drink, id suggest this place. great bartenders and drinks. i like when they play 90s hip hop (i think it was friday), but the other days they place salsa is an interesting mix.
author: Michael N.

description: what a great little place!  it's a small bar, but you walk upstairs and you can sit at intimate candle lit tables.  we snagged one by the window..so cute!  the bar was at a nice capacity where we didn't have to wait an hour to get a drink.  the place was non-pretentious, fun and romantic at the same time.  it's truly a bar where it can be whatever you want it to be.  we had reservations next door at bar crudo, so we left as the dj's were setting up...darn.  but i'll definitely be back!
author: betty w.

description: Small little dive bar. Nice bartenders and good drinks at a great price! Good crowd too!
author: Brian W.

description: the dj on saturdays is sick. the drinks are great and  on point! and the bartenders are nice and friendly! When there's a lot of people here, you'll probably get a drink spilled on you or your foot stepped on, but otherwise, it's a good place.  I wouldn't have ever known of this place if my friend never mentioned it. and now, it's definitely a place I'd come back to when i just wanna go somewhere to chill and listen to some real hip hop!!
author: christine d.

description: i dont miss much from working downtown, but hitting up the tunnel top for drinks after work will always be one of them. good drinks (they make a slamming mojito) at fair prices from cool bartenders and lil hideaways (the upstairs single tables along the window) and good tunes make for a great lil watering hole.
author: daniel c.

description: went there for salsa night. armenian bouncer stalked me, got a free mojito, got raped on the dance floor, and my friend ended up dancing on and breaking a table, gashing her leg, and dragging me with her to the ER for stitches. overall, a success.
author: Lisa M.

description: It's a great dive bar.  I mean the epitome of dark, dank and bad decor but me likey!
author: Misti L.

description: pretty sweet bar. they have good music, an upstairs and reasonably priced drinks. (cash only). oh yeah, they don't play the godforsaken music too loud to talk which is nice. ill be back more often than not.
author: Evan M.

description: not a bad watering hole..the crowd..hmm well ts all sorts of people and if memory serves me well think they had a dj spinning on wednesday night...go after 1030ish or so..unless ur already flashing the dragon before then...
author: jigi s.

description: I went here for the first time this past weekend.  My buddy and I arrived just before it got too busy and snagged a seat at the bar.  Totally random night.  Cheap drinks, great bartenders and fun music!  What more do you need!?!?
author: Ed D.

description: i don't know why, but i was expecting something sketchy. tunnel top was quite dashing by comparison. in reality, it is more like a goldilocks of bars-not too big, not too small, not too much of anything but just enough of everything to be something. the downstairs bar had stella on tap, the upstairs had booths just large enough to facillitate mingling, and there are even some seats by the window that are perfect for two-somes (conveniently situated to disguise that blank look as pondrous gazing should conversation peter out).
author: julia r.

description: cool bar near union square. cool crowd and music. def. recommend for happy hour. Can get very crowded.....
author: ji k.

description: you can have a cheap fernet and cigarette in peace. what else does one want in life?
author: Lisa M.

description: the tunnel top is a cute little bar.  i love the upstairs area where there is lots of seating.   it's been pretty crowded everytime i've been here, but i can usually find a place to sit.  the drinks are good and i really like the lighting/decor.  i wish i'd gone there more when i lived in the city.  i'll have to stop in after work someday soon.
author: Kate W.

description: Thank you a million times over to whoever returned my wallet to Tunnel Top bar on Friday night.  Not only were all my cards and id there, but all the money was as well.  I cannot even begin to express how thankful I am and impressed by your ability to withstand temptation.  Ill pay it forward for you. Thanks again.
author: Blake L.

description: The nicest thing about the tunnel top (i'm not a smoker so I can't totally get behind the smoke thing) is that from the top floor in the back you can grab a window seat that looks down onto the entrance.  it's perfect for anonymous scoping OR (if you're feeling bold after the relatively strong drinks), the windows open and you can actually prevent patrons from leaving or entice those questionable ones to enter.  The key take away from this: strong drinks.
author: Anjali K.

description: I love this bar!  Always great music (usually hip hop or house), PBR in a bottle, and you can smoke upstairs.  Cash only, but there's an atm down the stairs on Stockton St. if you need it.
author: Nate B.

description: one of my favorites - just a chill place to get a drink.  come in tattered jeans or a suit straight from work.  no one looks at you funny or treats you any different.  bring some cash as it's a cash only bar but the drinks won't cost you an arm and a leg.  oh yea, did i forgot to mention that you can smoke?
author: michelle k.

description: The place is a little grimmy...but hey, you can smoke upstairs...while watching the DJ...nice place to go if you are in the area.
author: Sig O.

description: This place is pretty good. I went there with a group of friends and I would say we had a good time there. The drinks were stiff, the crowd was OK. I would probably give it 4 stars if it wasn't for the smoking. My clothes and I were pretty stinky after going to this place.
author: Prairie D.

description:
Woho-s! 
1. One of a kind, probably because it doesn't fall into a distinct polar category of a specific type of bar.  Far from sticky loud sports bar as well as far from overpriced pretentious lounge, it's where you can grab a drink with a friend from any of the diverse cliques of San Francisco. 
2. They have girly drinks and I don't have to dress girly. But I probably will dress girly, um, well girlie drinks are under $10, so I'm a happy camper.
3. You can sit down!.
4. You can sit down up high on the 2nd floor interior balcony!
5. It's right near Union Square on your way to the Marina/ Russian Hill/ North Beach. So great for happy hour when you're on your way home, given it is on your way home. Yay circular reasoning!
6. They play music at a volume that you can actually have a conversation over.
7. I haven't experienced it to be so crowded that I can have a martini glass. I spill carrying a covered cup of coffee, it is rare of I can carry and not spill a martini glass.
8 There is a beer bottle chandelier!

Ehh, not so loves
1. Cash only, so stock up or use the in house ATM that I bet has a fee.
2. You'll have to go up the tunnel steps and risk stepping on a bum.
3. One of those places where the line for the bar is in the same location of the line for the ladies room. There's only so many ways you can organize a small space, but if crowded this can be a problem.
author: Lisa E.

description: This place is really small, the drinks are kinda expensive and it's really mellow. Good for after work drinks but I thought it was a bit boring.  It's difficult to be in a group here unless you have an entire section or tablet to yourselves.
author: foodbot c.

description: My favorite neighborhood hangout!  I used to live across the street.  All I can say is ya never know what's gonna happen at the TT!!
author: Jenn P.

description: this place use to be full of grimey, smokey, grinding fools spilling drink on people's heads on the first floor.  god damn, i miss those days.  it's been a bit gentrified, but what hasn't in this city.  but this place STILL soothes my palate for low key fun, and good music.  the crowds vary depending on the dj, so check your listings before leaving the green door massage parlour.
author: Kazuo L.

description: good tunes, live DJ to shake it to.   get there early , some seating upstairs.  bartenders were good and fast.  Didn't notice any smoke though others say its allowed here.   no food so bring quench your palette elsewhere, then head here with cash(no credit) to imbibe and socialize with your blokes
author: James H.
